results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded clubs, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to NEW Madison Square Tavern in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  We will have the private Madison room downstairs all for our group.

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

Drink specials till 7pm

$5 Bud Light Drafts

$6 Craft Beers$8 Wine

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-Fun and friendly bar staff

-A full menu available 

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Any train to Penn Station Herald Square

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: NYC's Friendliest After Work Party at The New Madison Square Tavern

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE: Only RSVP yes if you are actually coming! We want to ensure accurate headcounts and will be taking attendance. If something comes up and you can't make it, be sure to remove your RSVP before the event starts.

Hello Heat Seek NYC Volunteers! 

We're having another volunteer meetup. Volunteers with established projects will be hacking on those, and newcomers and non-technical folks are invited to help with our ongoing fundraising research or suggest new projects!

We encourage new volunteers and those interested in becoming volunteers to join us for the meeting. It's a great opportunity to learn more about our progress and plug in to upcoming volunteer opportunities. Got a great idea for keeping New Yorkers warm this winter? Come and let us know about it! 

We hope to see you there! Call [masked] if you're having trouble getting in.
results.how_to_find_us: 30th Street between 7th and 8th Avenues
results.name: Heat Seek NYC Volunteer Meetup

Every year, the Ben Appelbaum Foundation celebrates the accomplishments of the past year and recognizes those in our network who have made an impact. This year will be no different as we have plenty to celebrate. 

Join us for our 17th Annual Reception at the breathtaking Yale Club to make meaningful business connections, enjoy tasty hors d'oeuvres and to see how you can get involved with the Foundation. Help BAF celebrate the accomplishments of the past year and recognize those in our network who have made an impact! 

Register early as space is limited.

RSVP required, no cost to attend

RSVP at http://bit.ly/1Rnajf1

results.description:
It would be hard to go into the busy NewFronts and Upfronts season without talking about Programmatic TV! We have a great panel of speakers confirmed including:

• Kate O’Loughlin SVP of Media Tapad, (@Tapad)

• Cordie DePascale, VP of Product Management at Mediaocean (@TeamMediaocean)

• Richard Hall, VP of TV Strategy at Videology  (@VideologyGroup)

• Tim Ware, VP of Advanced TV at Tremor Video (@TremorVideo)


The panel will be moderated by Todd Wasserman, who recently wrote this article on programmatic TV for Campaign US. Here are a few the topics that our panelists will cover: What does ‘programmatic TV’ really mean today? Convergence - how can we help digital buyers buy TV and vice versa? How should buyers approach TV Measurement?

Event Details: 

• Location: 1501 Broadway #801, New York, NY 10036 

• Date: April 6th, 2016 

• Time: 6 - 8PM EST 

About our location sponsor: Tremor Video provides software for video advertising effectiveness. The company's buyer and seller platforms enable seamless transactions in a premium video marketplace by offering control and transparency to clients. Tremor Video employs patented all-screen technology to make every advertising moment more relevant for consumers, and deliver maximum results for buyers and sellers.

Don't forget to RSVP!
results.name: Programmatic TV Panel Discussion + Happy Hour

results.description:
Explore your gender identity at the GenderCrossing dinner.   Come and socialize with other transgender/CD's at our wonderful facilities where you can relax in a safe, supportive, non-judgemental group environment.  This particular event is not open to men, only CD's and transgender women.

Bring your clothes and make-up and we will provide a dressing room and well lit make-up station. Doors open at 6pm for changing and socializing. Dinner at 7:30.
Dinner cost $20, first-time participants $10.
Questions, call[masked] or email Allison:  [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Call, message, or email for specific address on W. 47 Street  cdicommunity@gmail.com

results.description:
FREE TO ALL INVENTORS WITH THAT GREAT "IDEA"JOIN US FOR "PITCH A PRODUCT™" NIGHT AT MICROSOFT WE ARE EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE  WE HAVE TEAMED UP WITH HSN!!! 

ALSO JOIN US FOR OUR "TWO NIGHT SUMMIT" WITH HSN WHO IS OUR GUEST APRIL 12th & 13th !!  WE STILL HAVE 5  OPENINGS FOR PRODUCTS TO BE "PITCHED" TO HSN.  SUBMIT YOUR PRODUCTS TO BE CONSIDERED TODAY!!

TO ALL INVENTORS WITH THAT GREAT "IDEA"YOUR INVITED TO "PITCH A PRODUCT™" NIGHT at MICROSOFT..  ANDREA ROSE® & HER MARKETING ASSOCIATES ARE LOOKING FOR THAT NEXT "WINNING" PRODUCT TO BRING TO MARKET!! 

We are excited to announce at ‘The Inventors Road Show™” our  workshop “Pitch a Product™”.   Award winning inventor Andrea Rose® will facilitate the evening helping the group  learn how to present their products to market while on the lookout for that next “Winning” product to introduce to her marketing associates that include such companies as"As Seen On TV , mass retailers. international distributors and television home shopping companies to name a few. We are excited to announce we have teamed up with HSN!!

Attendees will have “5 minutes” to pitch their inventions to the group.  This workshop helps inventors learn how to present their “Ideas to Industry™”.  It also helps them discover how to look at their inventions as a solution to a problem that is needed in the marketplace.  To have a successful  “product/invention”  it must fill a need in the marketplace and this workshop explores this very important aspect of inventing.  During each workshop we discuss  other various topics that provide the attendees with the tools they will need  to turn their "Idea" into a commercial success.  All inventors are welcome!!!

NOTE:  Andrea Rose® is an award winning inventor who has alliances with companies that provide services to inventors.  We at "The Inventors Road Show™" are excited to announce we have teamed up with HSN!!!  Andrea will be providing the group with her expert advice and looking for the next  "Winning" invention to present to her marketing partners.

Andrea does one on one consulting for inventors who are seeking personalize assistance. For more information contact:  [masked] or visit www.theinventorsroadshow.com

(From time to time there will be surprise guests who will join Andrea Rose® at the workshops.)

DISCLAIMER:  Andrea Rose® is not an attorney and does not provide any legal advice to any inventor. All inventors  pitching and presenting their inventions in the workshop should have filed for a provisional patent, have a patent-pending or an issued patent if they choose to participate in giving a pitch to the group.  Otherwise their idea could loose the legal  protection that is provided by filing for a patent.  It will be at the discretion of the inventor if they want to pitch their product.


THE INVENTORS ROAD SHOW™ IS HONORED TO ANNOUNCE THEY HAVE TEAMED UP WITH THE TESLA SCIENCE FOUNDATION WORLDWIDE[masked] + STRONG FOLLOWERS &  INVENTORS!!!


The Tesla Science Foundation's mission is to establish and promote the recognition and awareness of Nikola Tesla's inventions, patents, theories, philosophies, lectures, and innovations. With the Foundations 11,000+ strong  followers & inventors.   The Inventors Road Show™ will help bring their inventor's new "Ideas to Industry™. <a href="http://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theinventorsroadshow.com%2F&h=XAQH66ukRAQG90gs2QqzDvt7KrDwE8U0ZfMH3oMMttonmeg&enc=AZOP5b5ZodbzJTVUIWKOh8KNd7VoXbXiW1Mf20Bekj1IpqOZe52YCa1Lq7AIlFFcuzTh_jcffsN43FY4T1z4U8PYpYfYkC4Sedku-bCV-EVrdOJZK7z7CoKb0DudBkk227kvvFJ8qTINM3zDN_vNCy-1Ws_Tz-Mg-h1vA3jCLmAQsZUBKfGo48Vr8y_7yccNiMuIyqYdIiZ4hJk2dW-o66w_&s=1"></a>


For more information email us at: [masked]

WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK OUR SPONSORS FOR THIS EVENT:   

Jason  B. Scher, Attorney at Carter, Deluca, Farrell & Schmidt, LLP                                                                                                                                                                             Mo Azeez, Attorney at Patnovo IP

Microsoft 

 NV STUDIOS
results.how_to_find_us: Microsoft New Flagship Store, 677 Fifth Avenue, 3rd Floor, New York, New York.  Microsoft is located between 53rd & 54th Street on Fifth Avenue on the east side of the street.

results.description:
In addition to our semi-annual conferences, throughout the year ONUG conducts smaller user-centered meetings across the country focused on driving open software defined cloud infrastructure. The informal meetups provide year round opportunities for the existing ONUG Community to engage with new IT leaders and continue the discussion on topics introduced at the semi-annual conferences. 

ONUG Board and community members will lead a lively discussion on network state collection, correlation, and analytics as well as an overview of the ONUG Software-Managed Infrastructure framework.

The discussion will be lead by ONUG Board Member Neal Secher (BNY Mellon).

Welcome & networking – 6:00pm-6:30pm 

Panel and discussion (Q&A) – 6:30pm-8:15pm 

Follow-up & networking – 8:15pm-9:00pm

Food and beverage will be provided. About ONUG: ONUG’s mission is to guide and accelerate the adoption of open software defined cloud infrastructure solutions that meet IT end user requirements as defined through use cases, proof of concepts, and deployments to ensure user needs are met. Throughout the year, ONUG meetups will be attended by members of the ONUG Board, which is comprised of representatives from Bank of America, BNY Mellon, Cigna, Citigroup, Credit Suisse, FedEx, Fidelity Investments, Gap, Inc., Intuit, JPMorgan Chase, the Lippis Report, Morgan Stanley, Pfizer, UBS, and Yahoo. For more information on ONUG, visit www.opennetworkingusergroup.com
results.name: Discuss Software-Managed Infrastructure

results.description:
This is the monthly planning meeting for the New York Energy Week Steering Committee.  Join us! 


Dr. Marie Corio will also present her research, “A Top-Down Approach to Assessing the Maintenance Costs Associated with Cycling Plant.” Her research provides a unique econometric view of the financial impact of demand response programs in energy generation and its impact on the capital requirements to maintain the current coal fired generating fleet. Dr. Corio’s models provide a tool for predicting the trade off between cost and reliability as power plants age.


Come see what New York Energy Week is all about.  This meeting is open to current committee members as well as other energy professionals and energy business students who want to get involved in New York's annual cross-sector energy industry series.

RSVP is required.  Due to building security, no walk-ins will be allowed.

Meeting Format:

6:00pm - Doors open.  Pizza and beer served.  

6:30pm - Meeting kicks off with welcome, followed by featured presentation by Dr. Maria Corio, President, Applied Economic Research Co (topic details here), 

7:00pm - NYEW updates, idea storm, and sector-lead group breakout sessions.  until 7:45pm.

results.description:
parking lot on the corner of Orange/Essex Street OR Orange/University

Schedule: 

6:00 - 6:30: Speed Networking 

6:30 - 6:50: "BDD with Codeception" by Tom Bartolucci (Billtrust)

6:50 - 7:45: "Automation via Jenkins CI Pipeline" by Kishore Bhatia ( Cloudbees)


7:45 - 8:30: Open Space Group Discussion 

Other: 

Food, Refreshments and Venue provided by Audible Inc.

Automation with Jenkins Tech Talk

Hands-on demo of a CI pipeline with Jenkins and Gerrit, using Jenkins Pipelines to construct a build/test pipeline that is triggered when patchsets are submitted for review


- Construct a Dockerized code review/automation environment with full integration

- Demonstrate an integrated, containerized setup of Jenkins + Gerrit

 - Demonstrate how Jenkins Pipeline facilitates complex build/integration-testing/code-review schemes


Practical Automated testing in PHP using Codeception. 

This talk will go into lessons learned from the hands on use of Codeception in real world distributed development environments. I will cover what it is, what it does well, and some of the short comings that can be overcome with additional coding.


About Kishore Bhatia 

Kishore Bhatia works for CloudBees, building custom frameworks with open source software and helping customers solve engineering problems around continuous delivery and DevOps at scale. Kishore is a Jenkins expert with development experience in FinTech enterprise software and Cloud platforms

About Tom Bartolucci

Tom has been in web software development for over 13 years. He has built applications in Java, .NET, PHP, Python, and Javascript for clients in publishing and mobile video. Currently VP of Development at Billtrust a SaaS based Payment Cycle Management company. His team of 13 web developers works on delivering 6 of the Billtrust SaaS products and uses Codeception - a PHP based BDD framework to test.

About Audible:

Audible's mission is to unleash the power of the spoken word.

Audible Inc. is a seller and producer of spoken audio entertainment, information, and educational programming on the Internet. Audible sells digital audiobooks, radio and TV programs, and audio versions of magazines and newspapers. Through its production arm, Audible Studios, Audible has also become the world's largest producer of downloadable audiobooks.

Please visit www.audible.com to learn more 

GETTING HERE

By Train

· Broad St Station: Audible is just a block away from the NJ Transit Broad Street train station. When you get off the train, look south, towards downtown Newark. You’ll see the “Audible” sign at the top of our building.

· Newark Penn Station: A complimentary shuttle runs between Audible and Newark Penn Station. Exit the building through the main lobby. Look for a yellow and black van with Audible written on the side 

Driving

· Parking available on the corner of Orange/Essex or Orange/University street.

results.description:
Our next InDesign User Group Meeting is scheduled for Wednesday, April 6 at 6:30 PM in Kean Hall (Room 127), Kean University in Union, NJ. Free pizza will be served starting at 6:15 PM.

Deconstructing Impossible Projects

Sometimes when working on a project, you’ll be faced with an impossible task, something which would normally take a tremendous amount of time and effort to complete.

In this meeting, we will be starting with completed tasks in InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop. Then we’ll deconstruct the work process to show how this impossible task can be completed in minutes instead of hours. 

Don’t miss out on what should be a fun night filled with lots of tips, tricks, and secrets.

Looking forward to seeing you there.

Mary and Jeff

Mary Belthoff and Jeff Witchel 

Adobe's Co-Representatives to the InDesign User Group of New Jersey

results.description:
Growing a business is HARD. Mistakes are unavoidable. Choices that seem obvious can blow up, seemingly without warning. Decisions that made perfect sense at the time bring consequences that can take years to repair.


As business owners, when we use the science of the brain and nervous system in the right way, we can begin to manage for mistakes and make better business decisions. As we make better business decisions, we grow our businesses more quickly and effectively. AND, we get to have more fun.

In this interactive discussion, neuroscience-based business consultant Nora Simpson and Launch NJ founder Carlos Abad will give you concrete tools for overcoming the internal programming that drives bad decisions for entrepreneurs, for customers, and for business collaborators. You won’t leave perfect. But you’ll be a whole lot closer to achieving breakthrough growth.


Nora Simpson:

Nora Simpson is widely recognized as a business pioneer and the creator of a neuroscience-based business approach that creates radical breakthroughs in revenue, profit, productivity and fulfillment. Nora has customized her tools for the unique needs of more than 140 companies in 60+ industries and over 10,000 individuals to address business development, strategy, operations, financial systems, succession planning, and all manner of growth issues. She has helped numerous companies grow year-over-year revenue by over 100%.

She has also served on the advisory boards of two early stage company incubators in New York: the Varick Street Incubator and the NYC Accelerator for a Clean and Renewable Economy (NYC-ACRE), a cleantech incubator. She is also the author of the newly released book Get Ahead and Stay Ahead: Use the Secrets of Your Own Brain to Unleash Your Success at Work. Learn more at <a>www.getaheadandstayahead.com.</a>

Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

Intrigued by the culture, arts, history, and sacred traditions of Himalayan Asia?

Tashi Chodron, the organizer of Rubin Museum of Art's Himalayan Heritage meetup group has invited us to join them as she explores topics of interest through discussions, gallery tours, films, and meetings with guest speakers. The group is open to all.

----

A Warrior for Nonviolence: Celebrating Mahavira, the Jain Prince

Rubin Museum: "In this celebration of Mahavira, the warrior prince who gave up his wealth and power to establish Jainism, practicing Jains will share their insights into their 2,600-year-old religion based on the principles of non-violence, compassion, eco-friendliness, and “truth from many viewpoints.” A gallery tour of Sacred Spaces by Tashi Chodron will be followed by Jain bhajan songs, stories, and hands-on activities presented with India Home."


"About Jainism: Imagine there’s no violence or fear or anger. Imagine an earth where the tiniest insects are protected and where everyone understands that there are many truths. In the sixth century BCE a great Indian spiritual teacher, Mahavira, established a religion based on these very principles. Born a prince, he renounced his wealth and power to establish Jainism, a religion that now has ten million followers all over the world."

----


To help the museum expenses, the Rubin Museum will charge a nominal fee of $15.  Use discount code "HHMU" for a $5 discount..  Tickets sell out fast so please purchase in advance.  For more details see below.   

Tickets may be purchased day of program at the Admissions desk. or contact[masked] x344 to purchase ticket or visit RubinMuseum.org/adulteducation. Space is limited.


6:30 PM - meets at the base of the spiral staircase.

Eddie

While bicycles seem to be everywhere these days, their heyday was a century ago, and New York was arguably the cycling city. Thousands upon thousands cruised the city’s newly paved streets, its parks, and its world-famous bicycle paths, day and night. It was home to more bicycles, more cycling amenities, and was more infused with a bicycle culture than anywhere else in the world. It was a particular place at a particular time in which bicycles, like never before or after, shaped American cities. Historian Evan Friss will discuss this new book of the same title from the University of Chicago Press.

results.description:
In April we're combining network analysis and htmlwidgets visualization with Dr. James P. Curley.

Thank you again to eBay NYC for hosting us.


This is the last meetup before the 2016 NY R Conference, April 8-9, featuring Andrew Gelman, Matt Dowle, JJ Allaire, Wes McKinney, Bryan Lewis, Simon Urbanek, Hilary Parker, Max Kuhn and Drew Conway among many other great speakers.

It is almost sold out but you can use code nyhackr for a 20% discount off remaining tickets.

About the talk:

Although it is relatively straightforward to represent static network graphs and to emphasize various network properties or node attributes in R, providing interactivity for the viewer can dramatically improve visual appeal as well as comprehension. Further, effectively visualizing how social networks emerge or change over time is still a great challenge. In this talk I will briefly recap standard methods for visualizing social networks in R using packages such as igraph as well as transferring R data to other visualization tools such as Gephi or d3.js. I will also give examples of some recently developed R packages and htmlwidgets such as networkD3, visNetwork and threejs that provide user interactivity. Finally, I shall describe some ways in which the temporal dynamics of social networks can be captured.


About James:

Professor James Curley is an Assistant Professor of Psychology at Columbia University and executive member of the Columbia Center for Integrative Animal Behavior. His lab researches the temporal dynamics of social behavior particularly within social hierarchies as well as the neurobiological, genetic and hormonal bases of social relationships in social networks. Prior to establishing his lab, James was a Research Scientist at Columbia University, the Charles & Katharine Darwin Research Fellow at Darwin College, University of Cambridge and a Leverhulme Post-Doctoral Research Fellow in the Department of Animal Behaviour, University of Cambridge. James received his PhD in 2003 from the University of Cambridge. James teaches introductory and intermediate R programming at Columbia University to undergraduate students as well as mentoring and teaching graduate students from the Psychology, Statistics, Data Science, Quantitative Methods in the Social Sciences, Evolutionary Biology and Sports Management programs. James also taught Data Visualization in the Columbia University edX MOOC “Statistical Thinking for Data Science and Analytics.”


Pizza begins at 6:30, the talk shortly after and then we'll head to a local bar.
results.name: Interactive and Dynamic Social Network Visualization in R

Sunset is at 7:25 pm, so we should catch it on the walk back. Denning's Point is a state park which is closed between December 1-March 31 due to it being a popular place for bald eagles to roost. It used to be home to brick factories and remnants of the buildings and bricks can be found there. There are nice views from the beach, as well as from the walk out to Denning's Point along the river.

Clarifai - Ryan Compton (LinkedIn, @rycpt, ryancompton.net) Ryan Compton is a data scientist at Clarifai. He was previously on the research staff at Howard Hughes Laboratories and has a mathematics PhD from UCLA. 


Presentation -Streaming visual information retrieval and moderation with deep learning. Ryan's presentation will show how neural networks can be used to cluster and surface conceptually similar images from social media while repressing nsfw photos.  As a demo he will use Clarifai's api to filter the public Twitter feed.

What  What : The professional space extends beyond handshakes, business cards and small talk at conferences; whether you're actively looking for work, starting your own business, contributing to the community, or networking, you now need to know how to navigate the digital professional world. 

Join WWCode NYC on Wednesday, April 6th for the next event in our #HIREWWCode Series: Developing Your Digital Presence. We'll hear from women in the industry about how, why, and where to build your online profiles and introduce resources for contributing to and being present in a variety of digital professional and social spaces. Then we'll break into groups for some co-working and collaborative profile building. Bring your laptop, and a friend!

Speakers:

Tami Reiss, Why The Words in Your Email Are Holding You Back. (Or Keys to Effective Email Communication) 

Tami leads the Cyrus team to deliver great results for our clients. She focuses on ensuring that Cyrus is a great development partner, guiding clients through tough times and helping them grow.

She is an experienced product person who has worked with dozens of companies of all sizes to bring their products and services to market. She is a public advocate for Agile development, Lean strategies, and cross team collaboration to accomplish business goals. 

Tami introduced the Female Founder initiative to Cyrus. She provides pro-bono product strategy guidance to help women led and community profit organizations. As part of that, she launched Just Not Sorry, a gmail plugin which encourages effective email communication.

Ayuna Volgel, Technical Blogging
Ayuna Vogel is an iOS developer and an Access Code 2.2 alum.  She presented her latest project, Neverlate, an iOS app that helps motivate users to be on time, at the NY Tech Meetup in February 2016: https://vimeo.com/155126592#t=1h21m51s 

In her free time, Ayuna volunteers with Coder Dojo and Women Who Code and blogs about her coding journey atmedium.com/@AyunasCode.  She'll share tips on technical blogging and overcoming writer's block.

Jiaqi Liu, How to Talk About Your Technical Project

Jiaqi is a Data Scientist at Capital One Labs. As part of the consumer product team, Jiaqi has worked on a variety of projects ranging from building out big data platforms to support credit card transaction data to rapid prototyping for consumer facing financial service. She frequently mentors at Hackathons and is also an organizer for Women in Data, a community for Women in Data Driven Careers.


HOST:Greenhouse is an applicant tracking system and recruiting software designed to help you find better candidates and improve your entire recruiting process.

results.description:
Caserta Concepts and Databricks address the number one operational and analytic goal of nearly every organization today – to have complete view of every customer. Customer Data Integration (CDI) must be implemented to cleanse and match customer identities within and across various data systems. CDI has been a long-standing data engineering challenge, not just one of logic and complexity but also of performance and scalability.  The speakers bring together best practice techniques with Apache Spark to achieve complete CDI.

Speakers:

Joe Caserta, President, Caserta Concepts

Kevin Rasmussen, Big Data Engineer, Caserta Concepts

Vida Ha, Lead Solutions Engineer, Databricks

The sessions covers a series of problems that are adequately solved with Apache Spark, as well as those that are require additional technologies to implement correctly.  Topics include:

·  Building an end-to-end CDI pipeline in Apache Spark

·  What works, what doesn’t, and how do we use Spark we evolve

·  Innovation with Spark including methods for customer matching from statistical patterns, geolocation, and behavior

·  Using Pyspark and Python’s rich module ecosystem for data cleansing and standardization matching

·  Using GraphX for matching and scalable clustering

·  Analyzing large data files with Spark

·  Using Spark for ETL on large datasets 

·  Applying Machine Learning & Data Science to large datasets

·  Connecting BI/Visualization tools to Apache Spark to analyze large datasets internally

We’ll also touch on Data Governance, on-boarding new data rapidly, how to balance rapid agility and time to market with critical decision support and customer interaction, and well also share examples of problems that Apache Spark is not optimized for.
results.name: Using Apache Spark for Mastering Customer Data

NYCCEO is having our very own Mu Chen speaking to fellow community members before he heads back to China to start his FinTech ventures. High school in Singapore, college in the US, then finance the City, he followed the path of thousands overseas Chinese students. But in throughout these years, he took steps that deviate gradually from this "golden path", leaping form finance to tech to an startup entrepreneur. In the upcoming talk, Mu will share his experience and thoughts: 


- Why did he decide to start a data technology venture in China? 

- How did he build a supporting network to enable his leaps? 

- How did this transition happen?

- What challenges did he face? 

- What the differences between big corp vs startup, finance vs tech, working for someone vs starting your own business? 

P.S: Backed by top tier VC and angel investors in China, Mu's also building his founding team to kick start his data technology project to solve financing problems for small & medium business in China. Any aspired talents who wants to work in an interesting & meaningful project with smart people should check it out!

The role of a product manager can be wide-reaching depending on the size and stage of your product group. In this workshop, we will talk about the distinction and benefit of having separate roles for product and project managers, and how they can work well together. Come with questions and anecdotes for open conversation. We want you to walk away with something useful. 

Timeline:

6:30 - 6:45 pm - Meet & Greet

6:45 - 7:45 pm - Speaker Discussion

7:45 - 8:30 pm - Networking

* refreshments & snacks will be provided

Takeaways: 

• Gain a better understanding of how these roles are practiced at other companies throughout different verticals 

• Learn how to get a better sense of which of these roles is a better fit for you

• Hear directly from somebody who has practiced both roles and has defined them for others

• I think there will be snacks

Meet the speaker:

Audrea Soong is currently the Director of Product Development at Forbes. She has been in media for 11+ years with experience in product, video, and marketing with her longest stints at Forbes and VIBE. Most people want to know why she’s stayed at this job for 7+ years; the answer has a lot to do with CHANGE. Audrea often finds herself talking about what change means, the subjective nature of product work, being a native New Yorker, co-miserating about the Knicks, and most niche things about food. 

About our Co-hosts:

Product School offers product management courses in San Francisco, Silicon Valley and New York.

Grind isn’t an office, it’s the antidote to offices. A members-only shared workspace and coworking community dedicated to taking all of the frustrations of working the old way and pulverizing them to a dust so fine it actually oils the wheels of the machine.
results.name: Project vs Product Managers: Yea, there’s a difference

results.description:
Uber taught us to depend on on-demand taxis, and advances in driverless cars are in the headlines weekly. But are cars the whole future of how we’ll get around? Sally Simms, VP of Product at transportation tech startup Buster, explains how today’s early-stage group transportation companies are moving us toward a friendlier and more accessible future of transportation.

About the presenter:

Sally Simms is the VP of Product and Operations at Buster, a transportation technology startup in Brooklyn bringing bus, limo, and van booking online. She came to Buster from Google, where she managed marketing partnerships with the news media, and worked with partners like The New York Times, Vogue, NPR, and Mashable. She graduated from the University of Virginia with a B.A. in French, which she now mostly uses to eavesdrop on the subway.
results.name: Envisioning a Friendlier Future of Transportation

results.description:
We are thrilled to host a Coder Career Series every other Wednesday at Byte Academy. The events will help attendees brush up on programming on-the-job or land that perfect job. Regulars range from people who recently learned how to code, to developers at the New York area's top technology companies. Cracking the Coding Interview (5th or 6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell will be followed. Although the event will break individuals into groups to discuss the topics of choice, this session’s focus is Chapter 2. Chapters are non-cumulative, and coders of all different skills and languages are welcome.

The series will run every other Wednesday and is a joint event with the Fin-Tech Meetup, http://www.meetup.com/Byte-Academy-Finance-and-Technology-community/.

About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)
results.name: Algorithms and Interview Prep at Byte Academy

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

It was great seeing so many of  you this past Wednesday evening for Orphan Train.  I think we discovered that sometimes the publisher's questions can be a tad repetitive so perhaps we will pick and chose more selectively next time. : )  Also, Lit Lovers has some great questions that can be used for any fiction selection (and even perhaps memoir which will be our next genre).

I have already read The Glass Castle and I found it riveting.  I will aim to reread as some shared that it was difficult to recall details for the Orphan Train discussion if it had been quite a while since rereading it.  

If there is anyone who would like to lead the discussion, let me know.  I will be there but wouldn't mind sharing the reins!  Also, a volunteer to bring name tags would be great, too.  I always find I am scrambling last minute. ; )

Looking forward to seeing everyone next month! 

Kathy

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Tonight's meeting will be led by Thia Reggio

Rev. Thia Reggio is the pastor of Astoria First Presbyterian Church, and a frequent participant in the Wednesday evening Mindfulness Meditation practices. Thia completed the Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction course offered by Emily Herzlin last summer, and has participated in the practices since they began in the fall of 2013. She has also trained in Buddhist, Hindu, and Christian meditative practices, including breath practice, guided meditation, and group facilitation through meditation.

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, March 30th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The April session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (March 30th - April 20th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (March 30th - April 20th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (March 29th - April 19th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

results.description:
Violin and Vim with Paul Stefan Ort


Software development is an intellectual discipline, but it involves a mechanical component: typing. Mechanical skills are trained through physical conditioning, and the world of violin playing offers many lessons. Shortcuts are useful, but little attention is paid to improving technique at the computer keyboard. While typing is unlikely to be the primary bottleneck in development, why not make it as effective as possible?

In software development as in music making, creativity is undermined when technique is underdeveloped.


This talk is about improving your technique in navigating your text editor and general computing environment.


We will consider:

• how to position your hands

• optimal finger motions

• improving correctness

• avoiding injuries

• building agility (life is too short to tolerate unnecessary slowness)

Paul is a developer at Cyrus Innovation in NYC. In addition to his work in software, he is active as a classical musician performing violin and piano (having played both instruments for over 16 years).

Introduction to custom mechanical keyboards with Loren Rogers

We'll introduce mechanical keyboards, talk about keyboard history, and an overview of the Atreus keyboard's design and development.

Loren is an experience designer at EMC. In his free time he is the web developer for bodegamag.com. He lives in Brooklyn.
results.how_to_find_us: 1384 Broadway 20th Floor, New York, NY 10018
results.name: Violin and Vim, and Custom Mechanical Keyboards

results.description:
Meditation, Chanting & Satsang. We will begin with chanting then meditate together as a group. We will ​begin the study of the new book, How to Awaken Your True Potential.

Are you ready to take serious steps to discover the hidden resources of divine joy, love, and power within you? Paramhansa Yogananda, one of the best-loved spiritual teachers of modern times, offers step-by-step guidance to help you awaken your true potential. You will discover that hidden within you is untold power, and you will learn how to take steps daily to live life with greater joy and meaning.


Yogananda rouses you to awaken your true nature, beginning by looking at the habits that hold you back and how best to change them. He gives practical steps to prepare you for the inner journey of awakening. The book includes not only the meditation technique that he calls “one of India’s greatest gifts to the world,” but many other techniques for achieving inner stillness and realization. Yogananda also shows you how, once you begin to discover the power of your soul nature, to use higher consciousness to live more productively and successfully.

This priceless handbook is drawn from courses and articles he wrote in the 1920s and 1930s, and most of the material is not published elsewhere. The book is organized in a potent, easy-to-absorb format.
results.name: Meditation, Chanting & Satsang- How to Awaken Your True Potential

group.name: Ananda NYC Paramhansa Yogananda Meditation & Satsang

results.description:
New York Times bestseller, “When Breath Becomes Air”, by Paul Kalanithi chronicles the author’s transformation from a naïve medical student “possessed by the question, given that all organisms die, of what makes a virtuous and meaningful life”? Paul, an aspiring neurosurgeon at Stanford working in the brain, that most critical place for human identity, becomes a patient and a new father confronting his own mortality.


We’ll explore what makes life worth living in the face of death. What do we do when the future, no longer a ladder toward our goals in life, flattens out into a present that now sees an ending? Are we allowing the fear of death to rob us of being fully alive?


These are some of the questions that we’ll be addressing over four Wednesday evenings as we discuss how we or our loved ones can “go on”, or in popular parlance “keep on keeping on”, particularly when facing a terminal illness prognosis. We invite you to bring your personal insights, your questions, even your doubts and fears as we take hope from the author as he quotes Samuel Beckett’s famous 7 words: “I can’t go on. I’ll go on.”
results.how_to_find_us: East 34th Between Second and Third Avenues.Closest subway stop is 33rd and Park on #6
results.name: "When Breath Becomes Air" -  An Open, Honest Discussion of this NYT's Bestseller

group.name: "When Breath Becomes Air": A Groupthink Dialogue MeetUp

results.description:
Deep inside each one of us is the power of our heart. We are holding the key to knowledge of the past, present and future. Together we are learning, or more exactly remembering how to “unlock the gate” to our heart.

People have a hard time accessing this information and knowledge due to emotional traumas. Through the meditations, exercises and techniques brought to us by Drunvalo Melchizedek we will work on the heeling process of emotional traumas, finding a way back into the heart.

The heart is holding the key to all knowledge. Creating from the heart in UNITY brings us into a level of consciousness. HOW IT WOULD BE TO CREATE IN EVERY MOMENT YOUR OWN REALITY? How would this change your life?

Remembering we are ONE, all connected in the same consciousness, is the power we all need during the Ascension Process as we shift from the 3rd dimension into higher dimensions.

Come and join us in our quest for Truth, Peace, Light, Harmony, Love and Trust with Reverence for ALL.

Love and Light, In ONE SPIRIT.

Michelle

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
Details TBD.

For newcomers, read on:

If you aren't already familiar with the wider EA movement, I'm glad to have reached your eyeballs! Effective altruism is about recognizing the importance of using our lives to do the most good we can and looking for ways to help others that are high-impact and well-supported by evidence. This approach may sound obvious, but careful consideration of the impact of different strategies for doing good can lead to some surprising, and even controversial, conclusions. Ethical philosophy, career strategies, economics, and persuasion methods play important roles in these considerations, so EA attracts smart people and provides intellectually invigorating topics of discussion.

A great way to start learning about our perspective is to watch Peter Singer's TED talk: 
http://www.ted.com/talks/peter_singer_the_why_and_how_of_effective_altruism?language=en

If it piques your interest, have a look through the introductory links on the Effective Altruism Forum, or read Will MacAskill's excellent book on the topic, Doing Good Better -- and let us know what you think!

Feel free to send me a message if you'd like to know more. Hope to see you there!

-Chris
results.name: Effective Altruism Meetup

results.description:
RAVENLOFT RETURNS!

Join us for the launch of a brand new season of D&D Encounters! Ravenloft, the classic D&D setting of gothic horror, rises from the grave as we begin with the exclusive Adventure’s League adventures leading up to Death House. This is a 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons game for 6 players. Reserving a seat is no charge, but players pay a $10 door fee. Adventurer’s League passes can be purchases for $80, which cover 10 sessions of play.

In order to RSVP, players must go to our registration page and sign up for a specific table. Be sure to read the description to find out if the table matches your experience level! Be warned that signing up on this Meetup page does NOT guarantee a player a spot at a table.

Register here: bstrat.eventsmart.com

Play begins around 7:30pm and ends at 10:30pm. Late arrivals and early exits should try to notify their DM in advance, but are rarely a problem.

We will be creating characters during this first session and then running a three-week introduction to the game, a perfect opportunity for players who are looking to begin a fresh new campaign. Players are welcome to bring ideas for their character, or even build a 1st level character in advance and help the newer members. Character sheets, pencils, paper, dice, miniatures, and battlemaps are all provided by the store; copies of rulebooks are available to borrow, but are limited by supply. Players are welcome to bring their own gaming supplies as well as snacks and beverages.

Encounters welcomes brand-new players every week, so don’t hesitate to jump into one of our Beginner-level tables with no prior RPG experience!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Curse of Strahd

results.description:
Occasionally we substitute an interval training session for our Wednesday night road run. We'll be running some self-paced sprints in order to improve our speed and conditioning. You don't have to be a running pro to do this! Everyone sets their own goal and their own pace.

Details: We’ll start out at the Greene Field running track at the Masters School in Dobbs Ferry (see map here: https://goo.gl/maps/JKXpQcPvCET2). After a warm up jog around the campus, we'll run some timed laps on the track.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. In warm weather I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Directions & Parking: The Masters School - Greene Field running track (across from 34 Clinton Ave, Dobbs Ferry, NY 10522). After turning onto Clinton Ave from Broadway, park anywhere on the street. 

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

Please mark your calendars and join ArtCondo on Wednesday, April 6 for an Information Session about ArtCondo and how you can participate and purchase work space with other creatives!   If you haven't joined our mailing list please sign in at www.ArtCondo.com so we can keep you up to date!

---

ArtCondo (www.ArtCondo.com) is a community-focused real estate initiative that helps creative individuals to purchase commercial workspaces and townhomes in a new way.  ArtCondo connects groups of creative individuals together, and supports their creation of new and vital working, creative communities.  We guide eligible buying groups to leverage their collective buying power and to purchase collectively.  Participants help with building development and the creation of a non-profit Foundation, and earn Sweat Equity directed toward their future purchases.  Participants comprise people working creatively, including those who work with knowledge or problem solving.  Fine artists, musicians, designers, architects, programmers, scientists, teachers, artisans and more are all invited to participate.

results.description:
Continuing with Ch. 3, we'll find out graphical criteria for saying whether a causal effect is identifiable from observational data!


We'll cover sections 3.5 through 4.1.

Do read the material before the meeting, but it's okay if you don't understand all of it! If you get stuck somewhere, make a note of where. It's likely others got stuck in the same place! Try to push through and understand as much of the rest of the material as possible. We'll try to get everyone on the same page at the meeting!

We're an extremely informal group, and the format is generally to put the book up on a screen, and talk through the material. We stop and discuss sticking points (your notes!) throughout, and dwell on definitions and theorems.

You can also ask any questions about the material in our piazza course page, using the access code stats101 ! -- and it supports latex! http://piazza.com/nyc_ml_study_group/fall2015/stats101 Recommended Pre-requisites:

• Probability Theory (intermediate): Know what a joint and conditional distribution is. Know what marginalizing is. Understand conditional independence. • Causality up to Sec. 3.2. • Graphical Models (intermediate): Know how to factorize a graph. Understand what it means for a distribution P to be "Markov relative to" a graph G. Understand what a "Causal Model" is. • Analysis (intermediate): Be comfortable with product (big Pi) notation, indices, basic methods of proofs, basics of set theory, analysis notation (e.g. the funny e thing for "is an element of")

Logistical Notes:

• Be sure to be on time! If you're more than 15 minutes late, you may have trouble getting in. 

• Be sure to bring ID for security! 

• There will be signs upstairs ("Math Meetup") directing you to the room.
results.name: Discuss 3.5-4.1 of Causality

results.description:
To secure your spot, register on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/igda-nyc-playwell-mentorship-roundtable-tickets-24038864892

Mentorship is an important element for a successful career, and one that's often overlooked. No matter your stage of professional development, the wisdom and support of a more experienced advisor can prove invaluable. More than simply providing professional advice, a good mentor can become a trusted friend and confidant, supporting your growth and development, guiding you toward opportunities, helping you work through challenges, or just serving as a sympathetic sounding board.

But identifying and approaching a potential mentor can be a daunting prospect. Do you really need one? How can you find one that's right for you? How do you initiate that relationship? And what do you do once you've got one?

In our Mentorship Roundtable, we'll discuss these questions and more from a variety of perspectives, from structured professional or academic mentorship programs to more informal ad-hoc relationships, hearing from both experienced mentors and those who have benefited from being on the other side.

We'll also kick off a discussion about how best to support, encourage, and facilitate mentorship opportunities within our own communities and industries, connecting game developers right here in New York. Your experiences, ideas, and input are welcome!


CALL FOR SPEAKERS:

We're seeking additional panelists for this event who can share their mentoring experiences, as either a mentor or mentee, or as someone involved with organizing mentorship programs. If you are interested in participating, or would like to get involved with our mentorship initiative, please email us at [masked].
results.name: IGDA NYC + PlayWell Mentorship Roundtable

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT - YOU MUST PURCHASE A TICKET ON EVENTBRITE HERE

FuckUp Nights is the fastest growing, global movement of entrepreneurial people who come together to tell, discuss and learn from stories of businesses and personal failure. Now in over 150 cities worldwide, we’re excited for you to join our third FuckUp Nights NYC!

Fuckup Nights NYC Volume 3:

- Bob Dorf, the co-Author (with the famous Steve Blank from Silicon Valley) to arguably one of the most important books every entrepreneur should read, The Startup Owner's Manual!  Bob is a legend in entrepreneurial circles and certainly has his share of... In his own words, "scars from 7 startups, 24 angel deals, 7 IPO's and 6 direct to toilet investments."

- Jake Levine, former GM at Betaworks, regarded as Ground Zero for NYC startup culture, then GM at Digg and now the Founder of Electric Objects, a startup that wants to bring the beauty of the Internet to the walls of your home, changing how we buy art.


- Peter Sinkevich, the Director of Fuckup Nights NYC and a multi-exited serial entrepreneur who got my start in a virtual reality startup at the age of 19 before the dot com boom and has served more than 100 startups as a founder, mentor or advisor since.


- Max Ringelheim is a NYC entrepreneur who created an online video platform called Vonvo and is fresh off a stint with Phunkee Duck, one of the prolific companies to brought rise to the hoverboard trend everyone reads about these days.


If that were not enough, we are also lucky to have Fuckup Nights co-Founder Pepe Villatoro joining us while visiting from Mexico.

Speakers will share their story, including the project/business, what they did wrong – the FAIL – and the lessons learned.

Attendees, you’ll enjoy local brews, beverages and snacks in the beautiful Pivotal Labs space in Chelsea with the opportunity to talk with presenters, ask questions, network and share your own fail story in a supportive and collaborative environment.

Need more information?
Follow us on Twitter, Instagram or shoot us an email.

<a></a>


Huge High Fives to our Sponsors

KATE CLINTON HEADLINES GOTHAM COMEDY CLUB LAUGH-FEST FEATURING JUDY GOLD, CLAUDIA COGEN, ROBIN CLOUD.

On Wednesday, April 6, OP.LYNX, the dynamic women’s network of Out Professionals, invites you to Chelsea's Gotham Comedy Club for ”Girls Gone Hilarious,“ a laugh-out-loud evening of big-city stand-up headlined by Kate Clinton (far left).

“To be simultaneously a million laughs and politically super-smart, it helps to be Kate Clinton,” says Pulitzer Prize-winner Tony Kushner. “She is unique in all the world, brilliantly, elegantly funny about everything that terrifies us. Seize any opportunity that comes your way to hear Kate Clinton.”

Joining Kate is writer, actor and two-time Emmy Award winner Judy Gold (near left), whose solo show “25 Questions for a Jewish Mother” won a GLAAD Media Award for Outstanding New York Theater. And Robin Cloud (far right), one of Go Magazine’s “100 Women We Love.” Host of "BK Live," Brooklyn’s daily cultural showcase, Robin tours nationally with ”Accept Yourself Before You Wreck Yourself.”

Hosting is Claudia Cogan (near right), of NBC's "Last Comic Standing" and New York Magazine's "Ten Comics Funny People Find Funny.” Claudia was hailed by Time Out NY as the writer of TONY’s "Joke of the Year.”

WHERE

Gotham Comedy Club, 208 West 23rd Street, between Seventh and Eighth Avenues. Subway: No. 1 to 23rd/Seventh; C/E to 23rd/Eighth; F/M to 23rd/Sixth.

WHAT’S UP

Doors open 7:15 p.m.; showtime, 8 p.m. sharp. Don’t miss out on sitting and socializing with OP.LYNX. Be among the first 40 OP.LYNX arrivals and enjoy Prime Center Banquette seating!

ADMISSION

Cover, $20 (or just $15 with discount code LYNX), plus a two-beverage minimum per person. Reserve now at GothamComedyClub.com or phone GCC at[masked]. Be sure to enter or mention LYNX for the OP discount!

SPECIAL MEMBERSHIP OFFER

Be one of the first five women to purchase a new 12-month Out Professionals membership and enjoy free admission tonight — an $80 value for just $65! And remember, this buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.

“Do you want to change the world? How about beginning with yourself? How about being transformed yourself first? But how do you achieve that? Through observation. With no interference or judgment on your part.  Because when you judge you cannot understand.”

Anthony De Mello in his book Awareness: The Perils and Opportunities of Reality

Part of the Spiritual Process and life itself is awareness.  What patterns in your life are serving or not serving you?  How do we start to grow, if we are not aware of what we are doing?  Come join us as we explore awareness.

We meet every other week to talk about being gay and topics of spirituality.  This is NOT a group about religion. This is a great way to connect with other men who have an interest in spirituality. We chat about spirituality and have an opportunity to meet other gay men with similar interests. Our group is about exploring your own spirit and sharing ideas with others.

All gay, bisexual, curious, questioning men, and gay FTM’s are welcome.

For more info: email Chris DiGiorgio: [masked] 

At the end of the meeting we ask for a free will offering, no one is refused for lack of funds

results.description:
Introducing solid foods? Dealing with a picky eater? Control battles over food?

We understand that dads enjoy the opportunity to attend workshops to assist them on a quest to become better parents.  We're excited to tackle 'Developing Healthy Eating Habits-Infant/Toddler Nutrition' next in our series of FREE educational workshops offered to NYC Dads Group members in 2016.  


We'll provide pizza, beer, and refreshments as the dads get educated, learn tips and best practices, and have their questions and concerns addressed by Dana Kearney, a popular speaker and Registered Dietitian. 

Nearly every parent of an infant or young child wants to be well equipped with knowledge on a variety of topics surrounding food and nutrition.  The presentation will include: 

--> Surviving Common Feeding Issues from Birth to Toddler Nutrition

--> Starting Solid Foods

o What foods to start with

o How much/How Often

o Fullness Queues 

--> Developing Healthy Eating Habits

o Picky Eaters

o Tips on how to establish healthy eating habits

o Control battles over food, 

* This 75-90 minute discussion including Q&A is completely FREE for NYC Dads Group members

* Conversation geared mainly towards infants/toddlers/preschoolers - recommended for parents of kids between newborn - 6 years of age. 

* Pizza and Beer will be served. Come hungry.


* Space can accommodate 30 parents. Feel free to bring along your significant other.

* Special thanks to our gracious host Pregnancy & Parenting (also known as Tribeca Parenting) for offering us a lovely space in their Chelsea location for the workshop.

This workshop is presented by BabyNes Advanced Nutrition System.  Four NYC Dads Group members recently field tested the BabyNes System - check out what they had to say about it. 

A BRILLIANT FUTURE STARTS  WITH SMART NUTRITION

Inspired by breast milk, we created Gerber® BabyNes®, an advanced nutrition system bringing six stages of single serve formulas together with a Wi-Fi-connected Machine. It's a smart way to nourish the greatness in your baby at each stage of development.

**Disclosure Note: This is a sponsored event with BabyNes in which we have received compensation. We limit our sponsored collaborations to relevant partners that offer quality products and services we believe in. **

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly:
[masked]


Time:
The closer to 7:15 pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

Find freedom from anxiety, anger, and stress through understanding the true nature of our world.  Buddha’s teachings on profound emptiness have the power to reduce stress, increase our peaceful and loving states of mind, and ultimately lead us to liberation from all suffering and dissatisfaction. No meditation experience necessary. Everyone is welcome.

$15.00 Suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)
results.name: Wed Night Crokinole!

results.description:
A 6 mile loop on trail in Van Cortlandt Park. Headlamps are required.

Trail Details: These are mild, mostly non-technical trails, good for beginners. Keep in mind though that you will be in the dark. 1 mile back and forth to the restaurant for a total of 7 miles.


Public Transit: Take the 1 train to 238th Street.


By Car: Put 445 W 238th St, Bronx, NY in your GPS.

Bag Drop/Etc: We drop our bags off at An Beal Bocht Cafe then after we finish running the trails, we head back to An Beal Bocht Cafe change out of our sweaty clothes and socially bond.


We encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. This is about running trails and having a midweek wilderness adventure.

results.description:
Please note: for the time being, native speakers of English should not attend the English table in order for participants to feel safe enough to practice English free from intimidation. Thank you for your cooperation.

We are restructuring things a bit. The Japanese table is on hiatus until a teacher is found. The English table that used to be held on Saturday will join the Korean and Chinese tables on Wednesday Evening.

It will be a casual time to practice English conversation over coffee. Feel to bring coffee or buy at Dunkin Donuts or Barnes and Nobles café.

If you have homework or writings that need to be proofread, feel to bring them too.

A little about myself: I am Korean American. English is my first language. I used to teach English for the Language Institute of Yonsei University. I also managed 7 ESL schools in Pennsylvania. I understand the struggle to master a foreign langue in America as my parents are immigrants. I look forward to meeting you.

How to find us...

Go to 53rd street and Lexington Ave. The building is across the street from a CVS pharmacy on 53rd St, there are two main entrances. The top entrance in the picture is on 53rd St between Lexington avenue and 3rd avenue. The bottom entrance is on the corner of 53rd St and Lexington avenue. The building is called the Citigroup Center but the area where we sit is also called the Atrium Shops and Cafes. Which is located on the bottom floor: a big open area which has many round and square tables and chairs. The ZIP CODE is 10022. If you still have problems finding us look for a high rise glass building. Barnes and Nobles and 24 Hr Fitness are also located in the same building except on the upper level. If you enter on the upper levels then take the escalator down to ground floor where all the people and tables are. There is also a  GRAND BLACK PIANO.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
A weekly dynamic dance meditation, an exploration into ourselves, our bodies, connection to spirit, love, truth, play, heal, grow with the unique practice of the 5Rhythms. 

There are no right or wrong moves, no choreography or steps, the body naturally opens up and follows the wave of music and energy. Curiosity, willingness to move, layered comfortable clothing, water bottle, bare feet - is all that is required. The rest is up to the dance.

Through unscripted, free-form movement we unlock potential, get un-stuck and invite creativity to flow through us. Join our alive, heart-throbbing, truth seeking, transforming-sweat-to-gold, growing and mighty moving group!

Closest subway: A/C/E, D/F/V to West 4th St. Open to everyone. No pre-registration required. Cost: $15 per person. Cash only, please. Thank you!
