results.description:
Be part of the team!  You CAN make a difference in the world. 

Our strategy is simple, the outcome is huge. 
Empower individuals so that they experience significant growth of their own political and personal power, as well as discover and celebrate their own capacity to make a significant difference in this world. Our volunteers break down partisan and ideological barriers by reaching out to key stakeholders to build positive, effective working relationships.

Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate. 
View this short video: https://youtu.be/9oyguP4nLv0

What Others Are Saying

"With all the negative news on climate and Congress it's understandable to feel discouraged.  But hopelessness is not a strategy for making a difference and neither is acting alone.  Citizens' Climate Lobby is the antidote, the missing link, the Harvard of citizen activism." ---

Sam Daley-Harris Founder, RESULTS, Microcredit Summit Campaign, and the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation

"Most impressive is the work of Citizens' Climate Lobby...If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group." ---

Dr. James Hansen Climate scientist and former head of the NASA Goddard Institute

"The Citizens' Climate Lobby has identified the issue of pricing carbon as a vitally important lever in promoting dialog and action on climate protection. If you've been looking for that one group to join, you can stop looking now." ---

Dr. Daniel Kammen Professor - University of California, Berkeley

To learn more about Citizens' Climate Lobby visit us online at:

www.citizensclimatelobby.org

and also register for a Wednesday night (8 PM ET)

one hour introductory conference call.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.
results.name: Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate.
Ki and Ka

results.description:
I'm sure James could give us better ideas about how to do small production runs of custom Printed Circuit Board designs but:

Fritzing is an open-source, Arduino oriented PCB design tool that includes a "print to PCB Fabrication" feature. (automated transmission of your design to a PCB fabrication company and order placement system)

It's oriented towards the design+building of custom Arduino-derived boards.

Also, Jim hopes to show us the Raspberry Pi / ESP8266 based temperature logging system he's been working on.

At the last meeting, we got to see the marshmellow shooter that John built and that he painted during the meeting.

The other project that John realized was the creation of an "Idaho" shaped cutting board, which he cut on Surface Grooves' Shop-Bot.

And: Conversation included the fact that Microsoft is including support for Ubuntu packages in Windows 10, including BASH, ssh, vi, emacs, apache, Aptitude, etc....
results.name: Contemplate PCB Design with Fritzing (design your own arduino)

results.description:
if you are interested in this class. Please join and RSVP in the official meetup for this class. I will be adding future schedule there: http://www.meetup.com/Salsa-Classes-for-Absolute-Beginners/events/229446230/ 

Wednesday's Level 1 class Cycle ends on March 30th and we are very happy to see how much they have progressed. they went from being absolute beginners to being able to do and understand the basic concepts and steps of salsa dancing. I am excited to be able to start Level 2 now. This level is very fun and now that students have a strong basic foundation, we can do some more advance stuff.

As the minimum requirement for this class, you should know the following:

-basic step
-right turn
-left turn
-cross-body lead (and cross-body lead-inside turn combo)
-open break
-walk around.

If you do, come and take this class and learn Level 2 foundational steps, moves, and footwork.

Location: 519 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY 

Time: 8:30pm - 10:00pm

Room: Studio H (12th Floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only)

What we will learn:

In Level 1 we concentrated on doing footwork using the basic timing. in addition to basic timing, In this class you will learn footwork with more intricate timings such as: chord beat, full count, and syncopation.

For partner-work we will be learn how to do hammerlocks, trading places, mambo jazz, copa, wraps, traveling spin preparations, traveling spins, hooks, and variations of these moves.

We will also continue learning about execution, technique, and music.

Let's do it!!!!
results.name: NEW Level 2 Salsa Class Cycle (Starts April 6th)

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
The webcast will consists of two presentations. One on Fault Tolerance in Apache Apex, and second a deep dive of Ingestion into Hadoop through Kafka using Apache Malhar 

Talk #1: Fault Tolerance in Apache Apex by Thomas Weise 

- Components of an Apex application and how they are made fault tolerant 

- How native YARN support is leveraged for fault tolerance 

- How operator checkpointing works and how the user can tune it 

- Failure scenarios, recovery from failures, incremental recovery 

- Processing guarantees and which option is appropriate for your application 

- Sample topology for highly available, low latency real-time processing 


Talk #2: Apache Apex/Malhar Kafka Integration by Siyuan Hua 

- Feature Overview 

- Partitioning 

- Fault-tolerance 

- What changed between Kafka 0.8 and 0.9 

- Performance 

- Demo 

Profile of the speakers 

- Siyuan Hua, committer of Apache Apex 

- Thomas Weise, PPMC member of Apache Apex. A Hadoop veteran

Please register for Fault Tolerance and Ingestion from Kafka: Apache Apex, next gen Hadoop platform on Apr 6,[masked]:00 PM at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/412700963184250372

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

results.description:
Musikalische Mäuse is a German music and movement program for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers created by Gabriele Tranchina, director of Sol La Ti Music, Inc.

The song material used in class derives from the German folk tradition, spiced up with a contemporary flair, allowing families to reconnect with their own childhood memories and passing them on to the next generation in a fun-filled way. Old and young will enjoy learning how to use the songs creatively and how to include them in their daily routines. We invite non-German speakers to join in as well, and make sure that everyone can follow easily. The classes are age appropriately designed. They are infused with finger plays, dance segments and instrument exploration and provide a rich environment for music development, creativity and cognitive development. Learning a language through music is very effective. Rhythm and melody help the brain to memorize with ease. The latest research shows that music has a unique way in activating speech pathways. Come and find out what it can do for you and your child.

Age group: Birth-4 years

Fall Free Trial Class: Thursday, April 7th at 10:30AM RSVP HERE

How to get there:
Bus access: M104 or M4 to 114 Street
Subway: 1 Train to 116 Street or 110 Street
(Corner Bway and 114 Street)

Tuition: New Families $355.00

Returning Families: $340.00

Additional Siblings: $295.00 (siblings birth to 8 months are free of charge if accompanied by their older sibling)

Semester runs for 10 weeks - The fee includes a songbook with the song material used in class

Contact: (212)[masked] | Cell: (646)[masked] or [masked]

About Us

Sol La Ti Music has been offering Music Together® classes since 1997 in Morningside Heights and Harlem and received the Golden Daisy Award for best enrichment program by Macaroni Kids in 2014. This German off shoot is a new addition created for the German speaking community and also for those who would like to learn a new language with their children.

Director: Gabi, a German native, is an international jazz vocalist performing in the US and Europe. She has released two CD’s “The Old Country” and “A Song Of Love’s Color,” on the “Jazzheads” record label. In 1997 she founded Sol La Ti Music, and overlooks a staff of 3 teachers and supervises 3 locations. Ms. Tranchina holds a BFA in Education from JW Goethe University, Frankfurt. She came to New York to independently continue her studies in dance and voice. Gabi is a voice instructor certified level 3 in “Somatic Voicework TM” and a Certified Level 1 Music Together instructor. She also plays guitar and some piano. In 2012 some of her German families showed a strong desire for Gabi to offer a music class in German. She started German Music Together but the German families preferred the focus exclusively on German song material. Hence “Musikalische Mäuse” was born.
results.name: Musikalische Mäuse -FREE TRIAL

results.description:
APRIL 7 FROM 11:30-7:30

SCIENCE, NARRATIVE
AND THE ARTS
FEATURING A KEYNOTE BY
Lance Weiler, Director of Experiential Learning & Applied Creativity at Columbia University

Some are fans of new technology. Others are skeptics. Become a critical consumer.
Immersion technology is everywhere. The New York Times and Wall Street Journal have created immersive platforms for news. Virtual reality is used for everything from training pilots to treating PTSD. Films are in 3-D, galleries and theatre immerse audiences in their art. Dive into a dynamic day on immersive technology with thought leaders from neuroscience, education, gaming, advertising, business, museums, and theatre. Contributors from NYU, The New School, Columbia, Baruch College, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, 3-Legged Dog Theater, and more share their expertise and art. An interactive exhibit including the Neurodome - a virtual tour of the human brain - lets you to explore how multi-sensory, 3-dimensional, virtual and augmented reality, are changing the way we play, create, consume news, enjoy art, sell products, and understand the world.

results.description:
This is one of my all time favorite multi-day backpacking trips - lush forestry, awesome views, and three sweet campsites ALL with reliable river water sources.

Meet up when you can - I'm aiming for 12pm around lunchtime so I can get the fire going and maybe some dogs or ribs (we're car camping that 1st night so bring your creature comforts).

We will meet at the Ghost Town of Masten on Thursday where we'll make a fire and camp for the evening. Here we'll use the remnants of an old chimney stack to house the fire as we throw up our hammies/pitch our tents among the surrounding area.

Pleasant Stream runs right by camp where we can refill or just watch the stars from the unobstructed viewpoint.


Friday morning we'll break camp and hike clockwise on this orange-blazed trail 10.6 miles to our 2nd camp, right on the banks of Pleasant Stream. There's no bridge here and, depending on the conditions of the stream, we can ford if safe enough, or we will shimmy across the downed tree. Here we make camp.

Saturday morning we will head out and hike towards our 3rd camp which is located at the convergence of Yellow Dog Run and River Run (it's gorgeous here).  Distance 10.5 miles.


Sunday morning after breaking camp we'll head out for the final 6 miles back to Masten and our vehicles.

There's a great dive bar just north of Ralston on PA 14 is anyone wants to grab some food and something frosty before heading home.

HOW TO GET THERE IF YOU'RE COMING IN FROM RALSTON, PA


The forest road into Masten is right off PA 14 in Ralston, PA (41°30'21.9"N 76°57'15.9"W)

Take Thompson Street and it will veer left then right and over Lycoming Creek into the foothills of the mountain.


Keep going for a short time and where the road forks, KEEP RIGHT onto Rock Run Road. 

Keep driving up and deeper into the mountain for about 3.5 miles where you'll hit another fork - KEEP RIGHT again and pick up Yellow Dog Road.


Drive for a little over 2 miles and you will come to Ellenton Ridge Road. 

Take a LEFT here and take Ellenton Ridge Road for a little over 3 miles and you will see a sharp right hand turn onto Masten Road.


Another 1.5 miles (ALMOST THERE!) and you will come across Pleasant Stream Road - turn right here and you will see the chimney stack and parking a little ways down.

***IMPORTANT***
Driving up into the mountain should be (weather pending) quite simple. Once you get to Masten Road the conditions get a little, well, 4x4-ish. Last time I was here the road had a lot of rutting and a lower sedan type vehicle may get scraped on the undercarriage. Our group holds no liability for any damage to your vehicle should any over-confidence in your car's ability not suit the conditions during this trip (READ: YOUR CAR IS YOUR RESPONSIBILITY).

========================

Contact:

David "Jolly" Hannan
Organizer
[masked]


*please don't text/call before trip date - this is for day-of cancellations/ETA updates on the day of the trip.

Responsibility of all hikers: (YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOU)
Hiking and other events organized by this Group are inherently risky and may result in death or serious physical or emotional injury.

Join these hikes (or other events) only at your own risk. The hike organizer and those connected to this group and this website may not be held responsible for the safety or well-being of anyone or their pets who chooses to join these events. By going with us, you agree to research the trip, and send the organizer or others questions as necessary. On the trail, we all care for each other as friends, not as guides or leaders or agents – if you sign up to come, you agree to take primary responsibility for yourself. There are no “liability waivers” or other written agreements to sign. By signing up you agree not to hold anyone responsible if something goes wrong for any reason.

The Group Leads. The Organizer Organizes.
We do not have "trip leaders." There is, however, always an organizer who gives out as much trip event information as possible and practicable on the website event post prior to an event. Nothing replaces the collective wisdom of the group, especially in the wilderness. We work hard to strengthen our post information and advice to ensure our trip groups are matched for our hikes and that everyone in the group is ready mentally or physically for the hike and that everyone has all relevant facts before the event. As a member you can do your part - read the post carefully prior to your attendance. If you have questions, suggestions or comments, email them to your organizer well beforehand.

Hike Preparation
You are solely responsible for researching each event and for selecting and bringing appropriate gear and supplies, including clothing, food and water, to each event. If you have any questions regarding appropriate gear or supplies, please contact the event organizer for the event. You understand that any guidance given by an organizer is done as a courtesy based on the organizer's personal experience and physical capabilities, which may not be the same as yours, and will not hold any organizer liable for guidance provided. You remain responsible for you.

Leave No Trace:
Outdoor skills and ethics - protect our hiking resources. https://lnt.org/learn...

Children:
Children are allowed on hikes or other events at the sole discretion of the event organizer as indicated in the event posting. You are solely responsible for all children under your care.

Identification and Insurance:
We strongly encourage all hikers to bring along identification, medical insurance card and emergency contact names and phone numbers.

Pets:
Domestic pets are allowed on hikes or other events at the sole discretion of the hike organizer as indicated in the hike posting. All pet owners must bring a leash along in case needed for the safety of all hikers, other pets, or your own pet. Pets must be leashed on the request of the event organizer. Pet owners are solely responsible for their pets and their actions. If you are afraid of dogs, and are attending a hike that permits dogs, please advise the hike organizer ASAP, so we can try to accommodate your needs.

Event Updates:
By signing up to an event, you agree to check the event posting often for any updates to the event.

Waits at Trail Junctions:
The group decides where and when to wait up for those behind - but no one joining us should always count on that. It's easy for trail junctions to be overlooked. By going with us, you agree to research the trip on your own, know where we are going and how to get back, even if for some unanticipated reason you may wind up having to do that by yourself.

Hike Pace:
There is no set pace - you set your own. HYOH - Hike Your Own Hike.

Any hike over 10 miles will not be done as a large group hike, we will leave the parking area together but then split apart as our pace allows us to do so. All hikers are encouraged to hike at a pace they are comfortable with. Please make sure you know the route and can make it out alone if needed. If you have concerns please see the organizer before the hike starts. The organizer will wait at the end of the hike to make sure all hikers complete the hike safely.

Attendance and Lateness Policy:
Be on time. At the discretion of the organizer, we may wait 15 minutes only for late attendees that have already signed up for an event.

Group Size:
The group size will be determined based on the hike and the rules of the land we will be hiking on. Please update your 'YES'- or 'MAYBE' RSVP if your plans change so members on the waiting list can attend the hike.

results.description:
Take a break from the work day and head over to Snowflake's NYC Headquarters in WeWork for a Lunch and Learn of our revolutionary cloud data warehouse.

We'll provide a brief overview of Snowflake, describe customer use cases, and review a technical demo where we will:

-Ingest semi-structured (JSON/Avro) data as SQL, regardless of schema.

-Re-size a cluster on the fly in mid query, without having to unload / reload data

-Create multiple warehouses simultaneously so multiple users can access Snowflake without contention for resources.

Please only RSVP if you will attend as I'll be adding you to the WeWork guest list. Give yourself plenty of time to arrive as there is only 1 elevator and it is slow. Go directly to the 9th floor upon arrival.

If you can't make it to lunch but would like to learn more please reach out. 

Look forward to seeing you on Thursday!

Gavin

results.description:
Lighting Video (and Photos!) with

Practical and Available Light

Practicals is a term that is often used to describe exististing light sources as well as "non-professional" lighting you bring to the scene. There are two main reasons to work with practical light sources when making your film; Firstly, many lights may already exist in your scene, so these are just unavoidable. Secondly, your budget. 
Lighting can be a costly part of making your film and many people budget little for this key tool. Building and modifying given light sources can help create a look that is uniquely you. 

Fear not, you can make great light with practicals, some knowledge and a little bit of work. Join Daniel Norton On Set as we create several different lighting scenarios using only practical light sources.

LEARN: Why Photo Floods are dollar for dollar a great source of light. 
LEARN: How to use color temperature and a few gels to create various times of day. 
LEARN: How to build some simple lighting tools.

There will three distinct sessions of this event. 
Come for one, come for all! 
12:00pm, 2:00pm and 4:00pm

Daniel Norton is the Creative Director for Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.
results.name: FREE Demo! Filmmaking on a Budget: Lighting with (Mostly) Practical Lights

PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

This event is organized by Mobile Growth Academy. 

Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.

This event is a webinar. You can participate online via your computer or any web-enabled device.

Participation in this event is free.

In order to participate, please register here:

https://mga.samcart.com/referral/Free-Webinar/143147 

(After you register, you will receive info on how to get onto the webinar.)

How do you interact with every single user, on a personal basis, at a scale without going insane? How do you personalize your app experience and marketing messages to every user without hiring an army of marketers.

Without customizing your messages to every single user, at every stage of the growth funnel, you'll never be able to scale, and your marketing will most likely fail and cause your startup to crash.

In this webinar, you will  learn the most important three steps you need to nail down  to transform your business into a marketing machine that instantly turns every new users into long term happy users.

The speaker will cover:

1) The critical three steps for scaling your marketing for free, even if you have no marketing team


2) The #1 reason why most app marketers fail at bringing back existing users and  keep them happy (and what to do instead).. 

3) How to instantly delight new users who just installed your app 

4) A simple hack to exponentially increase your retention rates 

and more!

About the Speaker

Nagi Salloum has 12 years of marketing expertise and is currently the founder and CEO of the Mobile Growth Academy, an online platform that offers mobile startups a step-by-step guide to help them market and grow their apps. 

Prior to that, Nagi was the head of global product marketing for Tango Messenger, a Silicon Valley company that raised over $350M and has 400M users worldwide. Nagi also served as the chief marketing officer at N2V, a leading internet investment group, a regional marketing executive for Google, and as a regional brand manager for Procter and Gamble.

Nagi is also a board member, mentor and advisor to dozens of tech startups in Silicon Valley, Norway, Spain, Portugal, Mexico, UAE, UK, Germany, Egypt, Lebanon and many other countries.

If you have questions about the content of this webinar, please contact Nagi at:

[masked]

In the middle of that awesome visualization I felt a burst, a huge leap of energy expanding in my heart chakra (and since I am an energy healer it makes so much sense). Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. I can feel at ease knowing I have this new tool in my hands, it's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I wanted to first thank you for hosting this. I have been doing a lot of things, such as the law of attraction, access consciousness, and yoga, and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I love how you said to write down all your thoughts/ lists about yourself, as well as goals, to see where the conflicts lie. I haven't really come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a free Lust to Love Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

Ayelet (www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron) is a relationship expert. I asked for her advice regarding my recent breakup with my boyfriend of six years, which is why I went to her event. Ayelet explained that we have a tendency to constantly chase guys who don't treat us right, and we have expectations of other people that in turn, create unhappiness in our lives. Working on the root chakra helps us let go of those expectations and find inner peace.

The meditation event helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The free meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC

results.description:
Come out to our April 7 OpenShop.

We're having 3D printing mini-workshops for adults and kids.

And... if you're a parent Art & Technology Summer Camp Open House!

For this one we're focusing on 3D Printing! Yes, you know something about this, but you have to come and see it for yourself.

You can print out a keychain, a Ganesha, or a bike part. 

You'll learn how to use TinkerCAD (super simple 3D modeling) and then see it printed right before your eyes. Truly amazing stuff.

And we're not just talking about Makerbots... our lab has three 3D printers now... including the  WASP 2040 -- it's the world's fastest printer. (Made in Italy... it's basically the Ferrari of 3D printers.)

Here's the plan:

7-10PM JC Fab Lab 3D printing mini-workshop. 



4-7PM JC Fab Kids 3D mini-workshops! 


Character prototyping on the laser-cutter. And, 3D printing in our newly upgraded 3D printing lab. We have 3 printers now... one is the world's fastest 3D printer: the WASP 2040!


Please be our guest at our OpenShop at JC Fab Lab! Bring a project idea, or, even a project in progress to share with the group or collaborators.

Get the nickel tour of The Lab... we have a 2000sq. ft shop with 

• traditional woodshop tools

• basic metal-working tools (including a MIG welder)

• 3D printing lab (WASP 2040 delta printer and Makerbot dual-extruder clones)

• Epilog Fusion 40 laser cutter / engraver

• Xcarve CNC Mill (1000mmx1000mm)...


• Shapeoko2 CNC Mill (1000mmx1000mm)...

• 4 color screen printing station

• Puma III Vinyl Cutter  

• Electronics workbench (with a full stock of basic electronics components)  


and more!

Meet potential collaborators.

Find out about the resources, workshops, and upcoming events at JC Fab Lab.

==============

Membership Info

==============

We officially kicked off official public membership on Jan. 15. If you missed it, that's okay... pretty simple... you can apply for membership at JC Fab Lab here:

http://www.jcfablab.com/membership-application

We're actively looking for members to join up (for monthly memberships)... it's pretty simple:

1. Apply online

2. We'll contact you to set up a new member interview.

3. You take the General Shop Safety Class. (this is given every Tuesday evening at 6:30PM or by appt if need be... go to the Workshops & Events page and search for "safety" to find the next one that fits into your schedule.)

4. Pass the quiz, and Contact Us to sign-up for the pricing plan you're happiest with.
results.name: JC Fab Lab OpenShop Apr. 7th — 3D Printing & Laser Cutting!

results.description:
The First Unitarian Fellowship of Plainfield is honored to be one of the venues for this year's Women's Film Fest! 

Check out more info on this festival at http://www.wim-b.com . It is running at various NJ venues from March 29th through April 7.   Please note that members of our host church and other members of the community will also be attending this event without signing up through Meetup. 

The two films to be screened at our venue are 

I Don' Been Through the Snake's Skin & Come Out Clean (58 mins)

Coming through the snake’s skin describes surviving the trials and tribulations of life, intact.  A feature documentary about the Frank family elders who survived life in the deep south in Opelousas, Louisiana provides one example of strength and sustainability, faith and family outliving Jim Crow laws, this depression, mass migration north, major wars, and the struggle for basic human and civil rights in the country.  The story of Mama and Papa Frank has not been recorded in history books, yet they are a testimony to a strong African American family.  They have greatly impacted the lives of their family and played a significant role in society as a honest, hardworking African American couple who have built a strong family foundation and exemplified a solid work ethic.  Like millions of American families, they should be remembered as beacons of humanity. (more detail at http://wim-n.com/i-don-been-through-the-snakes-skin-come-out-clean/ )


Look at Us Now, Mother (84 mins)

Gayle Kirschenbaum is an Emmy® award-­‐winning ﬁlm maker, television producer and speaker. Called the “Nora Ephron of documentaries,” with her trademark self-­‐deprecating humor, Gayle now turns the camera on herself. Her documentary, LOOK AT US NOW, MOTHER! is about the transformation of a highly charged mother/daughter relationship from Mommie  Dearest to Dear Mom, from hatred to love. This is the larger version of her funny award-­winning festival favorite ﬁlm, MY  NOSE, in which we follow her mother’s relentless campaign to get her to have a nose job. (more detail at http://wim-n.com/look-at-us-now-mother/ )

For more information about the Women's History Month Film Festival, visit the Women In Media of Newark NJ website at www.wim-n.com

These films have been curated from dozens submitted for this year's festival and are guaranteed to be compelling and fascinating! Everyone who has seen them just loved them, and I bet you will too!
results.name: Women In Media's Women's History Month Film Festival 2016

YES,  THIS IS SOMETHING NEW YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN OR DONE UNTIL NOW.

No more feeling stuck,frustrated, overwhelmed, afraid, anxious or any other emotion that interferes with your ability to communicate or get things done.

Learn to access your power, creativity, mental focus, and more during your day because now you have a tool in hand to direct your thoughts and feelings.

Welcome to the world Neuro-cognitive Art methods. 

"Have The Answer Is Always Inside Your Head"-James Murdock 

AT DOOR $30

I WANT TO TOUCH MY MIND CLICK TO RSVP NOW $25 ONLINE

A COGNITIVE STYLING PRODUCTION

 THIS IS WHAT OTHER EXPERIENCED:


DAWSRBK

It's truly amazing how little we know about how our minds work and how little we understand what labels do to limit us. ChangeAthon literally allowed me to take what kept me down and make it so small that there was room to replace with a attitude that my mind can SEE. Please attend the next seminar to find out more about how you can take back control. 

PAUL W

Great session! An illuminating introduction to some tools developed by James Murdock from his research in cognition and behavior to effect desired behavior changes.

 ARIANA

It was a great introductory to using your brain/like a touch screen. The actual experiment done in fact reduced nervousness and anxiety using your fingers pretty amazing. However application and practice is crucial. Interested in more meets up teaching this system.

MATERIALS FEE INCLUDED

FACTS ABOUT COGNITIVE STYLING METHODS:

1. This method is totally different from an emotional sharing support group.

2. This method is TOTALLY different from philosophical lecture. 

YOU WILL HOLD, TOUCH AND USE YOUR "TOUCH SCREEN MIND" TO EXPERIENCE THE CONTROL YOU CAN HAVE WITH YOUR EMOTIONS,FEELINGS  AND THOUGHTS. NEXT, YOUR  "TOUCH SCREEN MIND"  GOES HOME WITH YOU.

3. You continue to use your "TOUCH SCREEN MIND" at home or office to make adjustments to your brain.  

YOU CAN USE YOUR  "TOUCH SCREEN MIND" PRIVATELY AT HOME or OFFICE WHENEVER YOU DESIRE TO CHANGE YOUR MIND AND HABITS.

2016 is the right time to gpain a method for literally remote controlling your mind. The “Touch Screen Learning Lab” is an introduction to your Brain-mind system as a physical object you can hold in your hands or show a trusted friend.

YOU WILL LEARN HOW TO USE A PHYSICAL ARTIFACT THAT YOU CAN HOLD IN YOUR HANDS TO DIRECTLY REMOTE CONTROL YOUR MIND:

1. FOR BEING YOUR BEST SELF DURING PUBLIC PRESENTATIONS, PITCHING AND SPEECHES. NO MORE FEAR.

2. GET CONTROL AND FINALLY TAME FEELINGS THAT GET IN YOUR WAY.

3. ACCESS THE FEELINGS OF POWERFUL MOTIVATION.

4. HOW TO MAKE YOUR GOALS AND VISIONS REAL. 

This workshop is different from a discussion group and support group.

AT DOOR $30

I WANT TO TOUCH MY MIND CLICK TO RSVP NOW $25 ONLINE

This is a Learning Lab:

 
You do experiments while learning the technique to remote control how you behave, think and feel. 
The “Touch Screen Learning Lab” is an introduction to your Brain-mind system as a physical object you can directly influence like a touch screen appliance. 
“Use Your Mind Like A Touch Screen” is new technology for those who want to discover self-control beyond willpower.Learn how your inner resources like love, creativity, or confidence are blocked or flow when you need them.

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. This will be our 3rd visit to Free First Thursdays, so far it's been a great time. We'll have a loose group schedule that you can choose to follow or explore on your own (see below). 


Event highlights include:

Free admission to MAM's permanent collection and special exhibitions.

Full-service bar with special Free First Thursday Night prices. 

Previous events have included live music, tours, Draw Along Workshops, Chair massages, live performances, Food Trucks, Art activities

https://www.montclairartmuseum.org/learn-and-create/lectures-and-programs/free-first-thursday-nights

UPDATE/APRIL EVENT DETAILS:

Official schedule below/our schedule in bold. 

• Undaunted Spirit: Native American Art, the third and final phase of the Rand Gallery Reinstallation, opens to the public! Tour the new exhibition with Native American Curator Pamela Jardine at 5:30 or 6:30 p.m. I am attempting to arrive around 5, but depending on traffic it could be 5:30. Let's use the foyer in the main entrance (next to the Rand Gallery and where the bar and store are located) as ourmeeting point between 5-5:45 p.m. Anyone wanting to attend the Undaunted Spirit tour, can jump over there at 5:30.

• Flamenco music with Hernan Romero

• Preview Ekphrasis: Art & Words, exhibition of art and poetry presented by Gallery U in honor of the 20th Anniversary of National Poetry Month, with a meet and greet from 5–6 p.m. and a reading starting at 6 p.m. No location listed, so get the updated map/schedule upon arrival and let's plan to move the party to this Meet N Greet at 5:45 and then catch some poetry at 6 p.m. If you arrive after 6:30 p.m., text me to find the group [masked])...perhaps some exploring, perhaps an escape to the bar or food trucks!

• Halfway There poetry reading with Melissa Adamo, Mark Ferguson, Ananda Lima, Joseph Palestina, Joseph Rathgeber, and Kem Joy Ukwu at 7:30 p.m. Possibly, depending on locations and leaving time to explore. 

• Interactive art project Post by artist Kasia Skorynkiewicz, presented in collaboration with the MFA Studio Art Program at Montclair State University

• Preview the Montclair Film Festival 2016 line-up at 8 p.m. Let's do this, location to be determined. It will help us to plan for when we go to the film festival!

• NJPAC info table

• Montclair 10 exhibition featuring MAM staff and volunteers opens at Berkshire Hathaway Home Services, across the street at 695 Bloomfield Ave

• Food trucks: Thai Elephant and Original Soupman

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Join us as we welcome:

Jana Memel

President, HollywoodWay

How To Present Without Putting Your Audience To Sleep

4/7/[masked] pm

Mailman School of Public Health Auditorium, Floor R8

722 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032

**Join us afterwards for Coogans HITLAB Happy Hour! First 25 seminar attendees receive a free drink voucher.**

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Three-time Academy award winning writer, producer, and entrepreneur Jana Sue Memel has produced over eighty films from shorts and features to music videos and documentaries. Her films have been nominated for eleven Oscars and won Emmy’s, Writer’s and Director’s Guild awards along with numerous film festival awards.

The HollywoodWay, her marketing and branding consultancy, works with corporations and 501c3s to integrate storytelling into their day-to-day business practices. Jana creates presentations on complex business issues, designs marketing and sales collateral and builds websites. Her HollywoodWay workshops train sales, marketing, HR, PR and technical teams to use story to create impact.

Currently, Jana teaches screenwriting at the Academy of Art in San Francisco and virtually for the Film Connection. Two projects she co-wrote and produced are set for release this spring. A series of parenting videos she wrote, produced and directed in 2015 aimed at Foster parents “Get Results With Effective Conversations,” will be available online in April. Teenparent.net, a web portal she recently designed and built for Teens in Foster Care has just received a commendation from the Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors. Past films include: So I Married An Axe Murderer, Champion (a documentary on Evander Holyfield) and Showtime’s 30-minute movie whose cast, writers and directors included: Toby Maguire, Rob Lowe, Laura Dern, Helen Mirren, Richard Dreyfus, Jeff Goldblum, Robert Downey Jr, and a host of others.

results.description:
This group isn't your typical 'networking' event:  Our focus is helping each other grow our businesses through mastermind/brainstorming.  We are building business through building relationships with each other, so we can help each other succeed.

Here is an example of a typical Mastermind meeting:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Mastermind: 4-5 individuals at about 8 minutes each (45 minutes)

6:30-6:45pm – Connection/Business needs requests (15 minutes)

6:45-7:00pm - Open networking (will sometimes go past 7pm if space allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.  We only have 12 chairs, so come early!

Please take a moment to read "About us" at the top left so you get to know what we're all about before you RSVP.
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the dedicated parking lot in the back of the building, off of Cook Ave., then walk to the front of the building and come in the lobby door.
results.name: Monthly Mastermind

results.description:
DISRUPT is an information exchange designed to energize, inform and empower executives, business leaders and people in the HR field.

Are you tired of the same old approach to Human Resources? Are you ready to start talking about talent in a whole new way? DisruptHR is for you!

TICKETS: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/disrupthr-new-york-april-2016-tickets-20944362151

WHAT IS IT?
DisruptHR is built on the belief that how we’ve approached people and talent in the past won’t be the best way to approach them in the future. DisruptHR is founded in the idea that ALL business leaders (and that includes you, HR!) need to be ready to take some risks, to stir the pot…in short, to DISRUPT.

SHOULD I ATTEND?
DisruptHR is a high-energy idea forum designed to inform and empower executives, business leaders, people  in the human resources field and anyone, really, who are PASSIONATE ABOUT TALENT.

WHAT'S THE DEAL, ANYWAY?
Join us for a lively evening of spirited, focused presentations by local professionals who'll share their disruptive ideas on how to move our collective thinking forward when it comes to talent. We're taking the brilliance of TED Talks, adding a pinch of energy from Ignite events, finishing it with a dash of "talent" and giving each speaker 5 minutes to blow your mind on topics relevant to the human experience in the workplace!
No, You don't have to be in HR to attend nor to submit to speak. In fact, Disrupt talks have been given and attended by C-Suite Leaders, Technologists, Restaurateurs, Students, Politicians...and, yes, even a few HR Professionals.

Thursday, April 7th, 2016 | 5:30-9:00pm
Arrive and network 5:30-6:30pm
Speakers start promptly at 6:30pm 
Break around 7:15pm 
More speakers and we're done by 9:00pm!
results.how_to_find_us: www.disrupthr.co/newyork
results.name: DisruptHR New York April

This is a two-part event. RSVP Yes if you attend both or either one.  However, if you are NOT joining us at the diner (going to the debate only), please let us know in a comment.


We are privileged to have an NRA officer joining us at our group dinner and the debate.

------------------------------------------
-- Part 1 @6 pm.  Drinks/Dinner.  Meet and socialize with fellow NY Conservatives members at The Red Flame Diner, 67 W 44th St (btw 5th & 6th Aves). 

Order drinks/dinner on your own bill.  Menu.  Shortly after 7 pm, we’ll walk across the street to the debate site and continue to socialize there.


-------------------------------------------


-- Part 2 @8 pm. Oxford-style debate at NYC Junto.


General Society Library, 20 West 44th St (btw 5th & 6th Aves).

• In order to reduce its murder rate, the U.S. needs more stringent gun-control laws.

Paul Helmke takes the affirmative.  Former president of the DC-based Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence.

John Lott takes the negative.  Author of “More Guns, Less Crime.”

The audience may ask questions and will vote both before and after the debate to determine the winner.


Admission is free.  No reservation needed.  Doors open at 7 pm, various announcements at 7:30 pm.  The debate begins at 8 pm.

results.description:
Hey all, I just wanted to alert you to this fundraising dinner that MAPS helped put together. See the event announcement below. The event is a collaboration of many groups including Evolver/The Alchemist’s Kitchen, Drug Policy Alliance, Psychedelic Education & Continuing Care Program, Center for Optimal Living, the Psychedelic Society of Brooklyn, East Meets West Medicine Fest, Psymposia with Lex Pelger, The Love Shack with Britta Love, and Consciousness Hacking NYC. You can RSVP and pay the ticket price here: https://nycglobalpsychedelicdinner.splashthat.com/

Join us for an intimate evening of conversation, food, and friends in support of thirty years of research lead by Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS) and their innovative clinical trials of MDMA-assisted Psychotherapy to treat Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). 

Featuring stories from luminaries: 


Dr. Julie Holland,
Daniel Pinchbeck,
Dr. Katherine MacLean,
and Ingmar Gorman, M.A.
and hosts Neal M. Goldsmith, PhD
& Jeff Breau. 

This event is a collaboration of Evolver/The Alchemist’s Kitchen, Drug Policy Alliance, Psychedelic Education & Continuing Care Program, Center for Optimal Living, Brooklyn Psychedelic Society, East Meets West Medicine Fest, Psymposia with Lex Pelger, The Love Shack with Britta Love, and Consciousness Hacking NYC.


The event will be at Evolver's new space, The Alchemist’s Kitchen.

The ticket price of $75 includes two of their state-changing, botanical elixirs, a light vegan and gluten-free meal, and a generous donation to MAPS of $25. If you'd like to donate more to help MAPS raise $400,000 to purchase 1 kg of pharmaceutical-grade MDMA, please visit the New York City fundraising page at https://www.razoo.com/NY-Psychedelic-Dinner.
results.name: NYC Global Psychedelic Dinner

results.description:
This meetup is about coming together to hear what we all are working on, pitching new ideas, discussing our needs to begin and finish projects, and helping to make it happen.  Please be sure to answer the RSVP questions fully to help ensure this meetup is successful.


During our time together, there will be an allocated time where each member gets an opportunity to introduce him/herself and their experience level. Those who are ready to launch projects/or are looking for writing collaborators will have three minutes to pitch her/his idea to the room, with (if needed) an extra minute to mention above and below the line needs in terms of crew, locations, extras, support, phone calls, whatever. Following the pitches, we will then break into an informal session of conversation, where we can talk among ourselves about the pitches and our experience, offer advice, get to know one another, form crews, etc.


We firmly believe that you don't need money to make films, and creative projects, all you really need is friends.


Let's do it.

NOTE: The meetup fee is simply to cover the cost of the venue.

THIS PAGE HAS IMAGES,  if you do not see them and you are viewing this page with


1)  the Meetup App - click the "DESCRIPTION TAB"

2) Android - open your browser's settings menu and click ''REQUEST DESKTOP SITE". 

3) Apple IOS - click the "DESKTOP SITE" button at the bottom of the page.

4) Microsoft Windows - buy a new computer :)

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely vid of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me loitering in the lobby of 529 West 20th Street.

https://vimeo.com/161663358

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...


Paul Feeley


An Artist's Game with Jacks

See you at the Hop

Todd

Since 2011, our group has expanded to several hundred real estate investors who are constantly learning & earning together in NYC. Come and meet our EPIC Community of Local Real Estate Investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. 

Within our real estate investing community, we help train people with no experience to professionals who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So No license or experience is necessary, and if you are a professional, you are more than welcome to join us and learn how we create successful network of educated real estate investors.

Real Estate can be a very risky business which is why you need to network with other local educated investors, get educated yourself so you can invest in real estate, learn to save money on taxes, and build wealth. The bigger our community is, the more we can network and work together!

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about members that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, and we will also talk about how you can make  upto $10k per referral helping our community grow. 


To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location!If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member. 

To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: 28 East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City. To enter, please press buzzer #2 outside the red door for the Gallery/Lounge on the 1st Floor. PLEASE attend the meeting only if you RSVP since the space available is limited.

Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/singles-mixer-stand-up-comedy-night-out-tickets-24302665928

This is one of our most popular Meetups. Have some laughs, make some new friends and enjoy a fun night out of mingling and comedy. From 6:30 to 8:30 PM you'll be able to mingle and get to know other people at the event. All ages are welcome - typically 20s, 30s, 40s & 50s - Whatever your age, you'll find people in your age range to mingle with. Presentation: 

With React.js gaining traction in web application development, QA professionals are looking into how to automate test cases for these applications. This presentation begins by defining Facebook’s React, and then continues by examining some of the differences between migrating an existing test suite and creating a new one.  The advantages and disadvantages of using different automation tools will be discussed. Finally, there will be an open discussion with questions and answers. 


Speaker: 

Waiki Sin has over twenty five years of software quality assurance experience as a quality assurance engineer in health and welfare, financial, insurance, search engine marketing and software development industries.  He currently works at Lifion by ADP as a Sr. QA engineer (SDET) and lives in Forest Hills NY.


Agenda:

• 6:30PM - Check-in

• 7:45PM - Q&A 

• 8:00PM - Networking

• 8:30PM - Doors close


Thanks to:

results.description:
We will close the door after the first 100 people arrive due to the limitation of the space. Sorry for the inconvenience.

+++++++ 

Big Data: The Cutting Edge of Modern Marketing


Big Data is the buzz. But how do you separate BS from real business value? Learn how the analysts at Time Inc. are providing advertisers and agencies with an ability to move well beyond the cartoon caricatures they historically had to rely on to understand their customers. 

By combining capabilities at the intersection of Data Science, Mathematics and Psychology – with the unique insights that come from a database that includes audience insights into over 150 million adults – the geeks at Time Inc. are reinventing marketing; and developing tools that will change the way you understand, predict, and influence consumer behaviors.

+++++++


Speaker Bio:


Dr. JT Kostman is the Chief Data Officer for Time Inc. Widely regarded as one of the world’s leading thinkers on the strategic utilization of data, Dr. Kostman has gained deep insight into human behavior through his experiences as a Data Scientist, Mathematician and Psychologist. Since the dawn of the Big Data Revolution, Dr. Kostman's teams have been at the forefront of developing cutting-edge analytic capabilities that have fundamentally changed US Intelligence Agencies, Digital Media Marketing, Predictive Analytics, and Consumer Insights.

Dr. Kostman joined Time Inc. from Keurig Green Mountain, where he leveraged data assets to better understand customers, identify strategic marketing opportunities and improve productivity and profitability. He previously held senior-level roles at Samsung, AIG and Aptus Insights, where he led data science teams that shifted the organizations’ mindset toward data monetization. His work has fundamentally changed the way businesses treat digital media marketing, loyalty and retention and data mining.

Dr. Kostman has also led data initiatives for several US intelligence, defense and security agencies, as well as the Obama 2012 presidential campaign on social media analysis and insights. In addition, he has served on several advisory boards, including for the Department of Homeland Security and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence.

Dr. Kostman holds a PhD in psychology from the City University of New York and completed his postdoctoral work in mathematics and physics at the New England Complex Systems Institute at Harvard and MIT. A decorated veteran, he served as a team leader of an elite reconnaissance team with the US Army Special Forces.
results.name: "The Cutting Edge of Modern Marketing" - JT Kostman,  Chief Data Scientist

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway

results.description:
On Wall Street, the mere mention of the name Sigsbee Manderson is enough to send a stock soaring—or bring it tumbling back to earth. Feared but not loved, Manderson has no one to mourn him when the gardener at his British country estate finds him facedown in the dirt, a bullet buried in his brain. There are bruises on his wrist and blood on his clothes, but no clue that will lead the police to the murderer. It will take an amateur to—inadvertently—show them the way.

Cheerful, charming, and always eager for a mystery, portrait artist and gentleman sleuth Philip Trent leaps into the Manderson affair with all the passion of the autodidact. Simply by reading the newspapers, he discovers overlooked details of the crime. Not all of his reasoning is sound, and his romantic interests are suspect, to say the least, but Trent’s dedication to the art of detection soon uncovers what no one expected him to find: the truth.

Delightfully irreverent yet ingeniously plotted, Trent’s Last Case is widely regarded as a masterwork of the mystery genre (Goodreads)
results.name: Trent's Last Case, by E.C. Bentley

Over the last few years, there’s been an acceleration in the shift in project management approaches from traditional Waterfall to the Agile methods. This adoption of Agile is having an impact on how enterprises approach UX. In this meetup, we will discuss these impacts, the UX design processes, the benefits, the challenges and more. Agencies, UX designers and clients all have different points of view. We’ll explore how an Agile approach can help bridge the gap to create great user experiences. We will begin with three thought-leading UX-centric speakers followed by audience Q&A.

We're sure you'll work up quite an appetite. Not to worry! There will be snacks and beverages provided. 

This event will be hosted by Yodle, Inc. located at 330 W 34th Street, 18th Fl.  

Speakers include... 

Denis Lacasse 

EVP, Momentum Design Lab 

Lauren St. Jean 

Agile Coach, Yodle Inc., Works with Yodle's UX organization to develop training for product teams

Danny Setiawan

UX Manager and Lead for Mobile at The Economist , UXD Instructor at General Assembly and Product & UX mentor for startups

results.description:
Registration URL: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/4020436108151605762


This mini-course will teach you how to read market structure. Understanding market structure allows you to anticipate coming price action. You will learn to identify and analyze accumulation, distribution, re-accumulation and re-distribution – the key trading ranges that power trends. You will also learn Wyckoff trade set-ups based on market structure, how to enter an existing trend, and how to recognize in advance when a trend is likely to end. Why analysis of market structure should precede everything else

The Price Cycle: Accumulation, Mark-Up, Distribution and Mark-Down

Trading ranges that generate big trends: accumulation and distribution

A key concept in Wyckoff Method analysis of trading ranges: Phases

Phase anatomy: Wyckoff Method events (e.g., climaxes, tests, springs, upthrusts, signs of strength)

Identifying phases in accumulation and distribution

Identifying phases in re-accumulation and re-distribution

How to enter a position in an established trend

Price behavior signaling a change of trend and/or beginning of consolidation

Distinguishing re-accumulation from distribution and re-distribution from accumulation

Three rules to trade Wyckoffian market structures

Wyckoffian Buying and Selling Zones, including entry and exit strategies

Exercises and home assignments

Course Duration: 4 online sessions

Dates: April 7, 14, 21 and 28

Time: 3:30-5:30 p.m. PDT

Regular Cost: $400 for new students

Payment methods: PayPal due on or before April 7th

Discounted Rate before March 31st: $350 for new students (for April series only), or $1,400 for all four series (April-July).


Registration URL: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/4020436108151605762
results.name: FREE Advanced Wyckoff Trading Course - Wyckoff Structural Price Analysis (Web#1)

Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/singles-mixer-stand-up-comedy-night-out-tickets-24302665928

This is one of our most popular Meetups. Have some laughs, make some new friends and enjoy a fun night out of mingling and comedy. From 6:30 to 8:30 PM you'll be able to mingle and get to know other people at the event. All ages are welcome - typically 20s, 30s, 40s & 50s - Whatever your age, you'll find people in your age range to mingle with. At 8:30 the stand up comedians come on - You can find a seat if available but a lot of people like to hang out by the bar and have drinks while watching. At about 10:30 the last comedian will finish and you can continue mingling until for the rest of the night (until about 11:30 or so). This is such a fun night out!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES. WE ARE EXPECTING BETWEEN 60 AND 100 PEOPLE TO ATTEND.

* Complimentary Appetizers from 6:30 to 7:30!
* Drink Specials From 6:30 to 9:00!
* Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy

IMPORTANT: No tickets will be sold at the venue door. You have to PrePay online ahead of time at this link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/singles-mixer-stand-up-comedy-night-out-tickets-24302665928

results.description:
Lending Times presents :


What Marketplace Lenders Need to Know Right Now 


With: 


• Matt Burton, CEO @ Orchard Platform

• Michael Finkelstein, Founder andCEO @ The Credit Junction

• Christian Lawless, Founder and Managing Partner @ Conversion Capital


• George Popescu, Editor-in-Chief @ Lending Times, "The latest trends in Marketplace Lending"

• Brian Korn, Partner @ Manatt, Phelps & Phillips LLP, "First hand experience working with startups in p2p and marketplace lending"

• Ram Ahluwalia, Founder and CEO @ PeerIQ

A discussion hosted by Isabel Verkes and George Popescu, together with our co-sponsors: 

Lending Times, a news, data and analysis portal for the p2p and marketplace lending industries.

Manatt, Manatt, Phelps & Phillips LLP, a progressive and entrepreneurial law firm with offices across the US, representing a sophisticated client base in various industries. 

When & Where 

When: Thursday April 7, open from 6.30pm 

Location: 7 Times Square

• Welcome/networking (30 min)

• Three short speeches (20 min)

• Panel discussion with all five speakers and Q&A with the audience (40 min)

• Closing and networking 

        --------------------------------------------------------  

Bios of speakers: 

Matt Burton is the CEO of Orchard Platform, a technology and infrastructure provider for marketplace lending. Orchard supports operational efficiencies to help institutional investors, investment managers and loan originators connect and transact. Matt has spent his entire career helping build, scale, and optimize the internet’s top advertising exchanges (Google, Admeld, LiveRail) and has overseen trillions of transactions. He is a three time Texas State Tennis Champion and loves racket sports.

Micheal Finkelstein is the CEO and founder of The Credit Junction which is an online lending platform providing working capital financing solutions to small and mid-sized manufacturers, suppliers and distributors. Michael has been an operational and financial executive at primarily high-growth companies within the technology, financial services and infrastructure industries for the past 15 years. Michael started his career in corporate finance at Salomon Brothers. 

George A. Popescu is the editor-in-chief of Lending Times, a news, data and analysis portal for the executives of p2p and marketplace lending industries. George built 10+ businesses and exited 4 of them successfully. He was the co-CEO and co-founder of Backed, an online lending marketplace focused on co-signed personal unsecured loans. Previously he sold and exited Boston Technologies (BT) in 2014. BT is a fin-tech company in the currencies over-the-counter space. George was the Founder and CEO and boot-strapped it from $0 to a $20+ million business without any equity investment. BT has been #1 fastest growing company in Boston in 2011 and on the Inc. 500/5000 list 4 years in a row. BT was acquired by Currency Mountain in 2014.


Brian Korn is a partner in the Capital Markets practice group of Manatt, Phelps & Phillips' New York office. His practice focuses on corporate finance transactions, including initial public offerings (IPOs), early-stage and start up venture financings, and mature corporate and high-yield debt finance. He also advises clients on SEC compliance, broker-dealer compliance and corporate swap transactions. Mr. Korn has made multiple appearances on Fox Business Television, Bloomberg, CCTV America and National Public Radio commenting on the JOBS Act, including its impact on crowdfunding, peer-to-peer lending, IPOs and market trading dynamics. 

Christian Lawless worked in the banking sector before he founded and became the managing partner of Conversion Capital LLC, an early stage Venture Capital fund. Conversion Capital focusses on the disruption and transformation of Financial Services and analogous sectors, that can leverage technology as a change agent and driver of innovation. Conversion Capital was an early stage investor of marketplace lending businesses and related companies such as Orchard, Osper and EVEN financial.


Ram Ahluwalia was a Senior Vice President at Bank of America-Merrill Lynch before he became the CIO of Winged Foot Capital, an investment advisor responsible for managing an alternatives portfolio via investments in hedge funds, real estate, and late-stage venture capital. As an expert in statistical arbitrage and consumer credit, Ram is currently co-founder and CEO of PeerIQ: a credit risk analytics firm that helps institutions analyze, access and manage risk in the peer-to-peer lending sector.

     ------------------------------------------------------------
results.how_to_find_us: Our office is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan on the corner of 42nd Street and Broadway in Times Square.
results.name: What Marketplace Lenders Need to Know Right Now

results.description:
An 8-Week Course in Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) 


EARLY BIRD REGISTRATION HAS BEEN EXTENDED to March 29! Save $25 if you register by then!

Register here. You can attend orientation without registering, but you must register if you want to guarantee yourself a spot in the course.

Join the Mindful Astoria community this spring for an 8-week course in Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR), the curriculum developed by Jon Kabat-Zinn at the University of Massachusetts Medical School Center for Mindfulness.

Mindfulness is paying attention, on purpose, in the present moment, without judgment. Studies indicate that mindfulness-based stress reduction programs can reduce anxiety and increase general well-being and overall happiness.

Over the course of eight weeks, we will learn several different forms of mindfulness practices such as mindful breathing, walking meditation, and mindful movement. We will practice bringing mindfulness into daily activities, stressful situations, self-care, work, relationships, communication, and more.

Click here to watch an episode of 60 Minutes on mindfulness.

Important dates
Orientation: Thursday April 7, 6:30-9pm, required for participation in the course. If you cannot attend orientation you must schedule a makeup orientation with the instructor.
Classes: 8 Thursday nights 6:30-9pm, April 14-June 16; daylong retreat Saturday May 21 10am-5pm

Location
Astoria First Presbyterian Church
23-35 Broadway
Ground Floor
Astoria, NY 11106

Via public transit:
NQ to Broadway, MR to Steinway 

Register here. 


Full Class Schedule 


Orientation April 7 

Class 1 April 14 


Class 2 April 21
Class 3 April 28
Class 4 May 5
Skip May 12
Class 5 May 19
All day retreat Saturday May 21, 10am-5pm
Class 6 May 26
Class 7 June 2
Class 8 June 9 

Course fee:


Early bird $315 until March 17.
$330 after March 17. 

Register here. 


Two scholarship spots of $150 each are available to those who identify as people of color. If you identify as PoC and would like one of these scholarships, please email [masked]. 8 students minimum, 16 maximum. 

In the event that the course sells out prior to orientation, a waitlist will be available.

Frequently asked questions about the MBSR course here. Please be sure to read before signing up.

Refund policy
Notice of cancellation by Friday April 8th (1 day after Orientation): Full refund minus $20 processing fee.
Notice of cancellation by Friday April 15th (1 day after Class 1): 50% of the course fee will be refunded.
No refunds will be granted after Friday April 15th.

About the teacher, Emily Herzlin.
Emily Herzlin has been practicing mindfulness meditation for thirteen years, and trained in Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR.
Email [masked] with any additional questions.
results.name: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) 8-Week Course Orientation

results.description:
Unlike most Meetups, you don't sign up for these events--no RSVP required. This is a first come/first served, drop-in service offering one-on-one counseling for LGBT individuals and couples.

Two Identity House volunteer peer counselors staff the Walk-In Center for 2 hours, each Saturday and Sunday night. Each session with a client or couple is about 45 minutes.

What is a peer counselor? The word, "peer", means "equal". In this usage, a counselor and a client are on level ground. The counselor is not a therapist and does not provide professional therapy.

As peers, we have the opportunity to share as equals with our clients. This means that, unlike therapists, we can share our personal experiences, so that the client knows there are others who have been through a similar situation.

What does a peer counselor do? Using active listening skills, empathy, and the sharing of experiences, the counselors help clients clarify their thoughts and feelings; and explore various options or solutions.

What else can the counselors do? Sometimes clients just come in to talk and that's all they need, but if clients feel that they might benefit from referrals to other resources, the counselor will discuss with them: short-term peer counseling (8 weekly, 1-hour one-on-one visits), therapists, discussion groups, and other community resources.

Our outreach is supported by donations from Identity House members and our clients. We do ask for a reasonable donation at the conclusion of the counseling session, but no one is ever turned away because they are unable to donate.

For more information about Identity House or how you can support our work with a donation, please visit our website: www.identityhouse.org.
results.name: Now, An LGBT Walk-In Center on Thursdays Nights

Spring Lake Farms is offering a 15 pound all ground beef box for $100. Our beef is 100% grass-fed and dry aged.

The best!

Our ground meats are extremely high quality.


THE FARMER'S WILL NOT BE PROVIDING AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX IN ADVANCE.  THEY HAVE AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX POSTED TO EACH BOX ON DELIVERY DAY. 


The total cost for your 15 pounds of ground grass fed dry aged beef will be $108.20. The box is $100 plus a $5 meetup fee plus the paypal fee.  


THE FARMERS WILL NOT BE DELIVERING TO INDIVIDUAL ADDRESSES MIX BOXES ALONE.  PLEASE COME AND PICK UP YOUR MIX BOX.  EXCEPTION - 2 OR MORE PEOPLE GETTING TWO SHIPMENTS WOULD LIKE TO HAVE IT DELIVERED TO THE SAME PLACE - THEY WILL DELIVER FOR THAT.

Spring Lake has a great website <a>www.springlakefarmny.com.</a> Ulla Kjarval, the farmer's daughter also writes a farming & food blog with several recipes to complement the meat her parent's raise. Our beef has been completely grass-fed. Ingi Kjarval, our farmer, has been cross-breeding his cattle to help build a smaller, sturdier steer that does well in upstate NY on grass. Our cows are part Simmental, Hereford, Angus & Highland.
