A prompt is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

JCW members provide the writing prompts on a rotating basis. These prompts can be anything the scheduled writer decides. The only rule is the group just has 10 minutes to write it!

results.description:
Join us and discover the language that makes the Web interactive: JavaScript.

In this class, we will walk you through the basics of the JavaScript language and how to use it to communicate with the HTML/CSS on a web page. By the end of this class, you will be a able to create an dynamic web page. This class is aimed at beginners with basic knowledge in HTML/CSS. 

Key Takeaways:

Learn tools you need to get up, running and coding with JavaScript
Learn basic programming concepts like variables, loops, functions, strings, arrays and objects
Learn how to write these things in JavaScript
Interact with the HTML and CSS of a webpage using JavaScript
We’ll provide you with available resources if you’d like to continue learning

Prerequisites and Preparation:

A basic understanding of HTML/CSS and JavaScript (e.g. topics covered in Codecademy’s HTML & CSS and JavaScript tracks).

Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page).
Light snacks will be provided.

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
How to Find a GOOD Apartment Deal


It’s easy to find an apartment deal. You can buy one right now online. But is it a GOOD deal? Will it be profitable? Does it suit your personal criteria? That’s a different story.

No matter what you’re investing in, being an educated investor is necessary.


Let your multifamily investment property build equity while you sleep, the ultimate combination of cash flow and principal paydown. We are helping our clients stack stable assets for the future with multifamily real estate.


This month at the LI Multifamily Investor Group, join us as we share some of the techniques we use on behalf of our clients to find good apartment deals. We will discover:


• Positioning yourself with commercial brokers

• Manufacturing deals through loop-net


• The criteria we use to scrub a deal for further analysis

We want to become a resource for those investors interested in investing in multifamily real estate. If you’re just starting out or have done some deals, this is the place to network with other investors. We pride ourselves on providing superior education: The best investor is an educated investor.


Looking forward to seeing you April 7th at 6:30pm at the Hotel Viana in Westbury. The meeting is $25.


Make sure that you register by clicking here.

Come and join us at this growing and thriving real estate networking group! Get your questions about multifamily real estate answered and make some great connections. Make sure you pre-register for the event.

We want these meetings to be a place where interested real estate investors like yourself can get their questions answered about buying an apartment building for investment. Like a Real Estate Investment Association meeting, we feature networking so you can be surrounded with like-minded investors solely focused on investing in multifamily real estate.
results.name: How to Find A GOOD Apartment Deal

results.description:
As the value of online digital ads races to the bottom, we're left wondering if it's become just another form of spam, something that software should filter out. Indeed, some say adblocking is the biggest boycott ever known with 200 million people blocking the ads and growing. What caused this backlash against the business model that was supposed to fund free content on the Web? How has data been misused to trigger an abusive relationship between businesses and consumers? What's the prognosis for a marketplace that industry insiders are increasingly admitting might be "subprime?" What if it's about to be substantially reshaped by market forces, shifting social attitudes about personal data collection, and looming regulatory changes on privacy and data protection? 

David Carroll will tackle these topics and more at the next UX + Data Meetup. David is the associate professor of media design at Parsons School of Design where he teaches in the MFA Design and Technology program. He is also a recovering entrepreneur whose failed startup was an AI brain learning pop culture through digital magazine archives. He's on Twitter and Medium as @profcarroll
results.name: Adblock is a Boycott: The failure of big data to see it coming

It's April and time once again for our semiannual Yarn, Tools, and Patterns Swap.  Do some spring cleaning in your stash!  Collect your extra skeins, the half balls leftover from a recently-finished project, the yarn that you cleaned out of your great aunt's attic.  Gather up the needles and hooks that you're no longer using.  And don't forget to clear out the books and patterns that just don't appeal to you anymore.

Bring them to our First Thursday, another opportunity to sit and knit or crochet with good conversation! We'll be meeting at St. Luke's Episcopal Church in Metuchen.  There is both street and lot parking.  Come in the Administration Building, and follow signs to the Craft Room (just a bit further down the corridor from the Robbins Room).  

Bring what you don't need or want from your stash, along with your current projects, recent stash and pattern acquisitions, and any completed projects to show the group. Your unwanted yarn might find a home with another Twisted Stitcher who needs it for a project.  Anything stash not claimed in April will be donated in May.

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com

results.description:
Join NYC Python and Magnetic for a night of warmup talks. Preview talks scheduled for PyCon Italy and provide feedback to the speakers.


Talks:

Python is not Java - Offer Sharabi

Developers with a Java background are often interested in learning Python as another language or sometimes are required to do so as part of a new job/project they are working on.

However, in many cases, they end up translating their knowledge too literally, writing ‘Java in Python’ where the resultant code feels clunky and is deemed non-‘Pythonic’. Yet, it is not always obvious what is lost in translation and how one can utilise their previous knowledge in the new domain.

Moreover, most of the literature in the area either compares between the features of the languages or provides low level mappings of data structures and data types. While both are valuable, none of those listings provide tools on how to harness previous knowledge or insights into why certain translations succeed and others fail.

Motivated by code examples, this talk aims to bridge that gap between the languages. It focuses on common design patterns in Java and looks not only at their anti-pattern counterparts in Python, but importantly also at the Python patterns that can be used to better effect instead. As such, the aim of the presentation is to offer the Junior to Intermediate developer in Python a range of tools that can be utilised to successfully translate current knowledge in the previous language to their new one.

About Offer: Worked as a developer for over 5 years now, coming from a research scientist background. Switched to program in Python from Java more than a year ago, as part of a new job. I use python for small scripts as well as for full commercial application with low latency and high throughput. In the latter we use python 2.x with PyPy for high performance. I also encounter python in other tools such as Ansible, Fabric and PySpark. This will be my first time presenting in a conference, although I have presented internally in my company and in several MeetUps.


Introduction to JSON Schema - Julian Berman


JSON Schema (http://json-schema.org/) is an increasingly popular, cross-language specification for schematization of JSON documents. It represents schema constraints on a JSON document as a JSON document, in a flexible validation language.

We’ll investigate some simple (and not so simple) examples of data validation using the jsonschema Python package (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/jsonschema), which implements the specification.

Julian is the Director of Platform Engineering at Magnetic (http://www.magnetic.com/), a frequent contributor to the NYC Python Meetup group and a testing lover. He can also be found most hours of the day as tos9 on Freenode in more channels than he can count, including #python.

The Ministry of Silly Talks

About our sponsor:

Magnetic is a technology company with a marketing platform for enterprises, brands and agencies. Our prospecting, remarketing, and merchandising solutions help marketers find, keep and bring back customers across channels and devices. These solutions are powered by our unique data including purchase intent and behavioral insights.
results.name: PyCon Italy Warmup

results.description:
THE ORIGINS OF POLITICAL ORDER: From Prehistoric Times to the French Revolution - PART I

Francis Fukuyama

Bestseller Fukuyama provides a sweeping account of how today’s basic political institutions developed, beginning with politics among our primate ancestors and follows the story through the emergence of tribal societies, the growth of the first modern state in China, the beginning of the rule of law in India and the Middle East, and the development of political accountability in Europe up until the eve of the French Revolution.

Drawing on a vast body of knowledge, history, evolutionary biology, archaeology, and economics, Fukuyama has produced a brilliant, provocative work that offers fresh insights on the origins of democratic societies and raises essential questions about the nature of politics and its discontents. from tribes to national governments.

We’ll read and discuss the first half of this blockbuster (Chaps 1-15), then the second half in May. — Paperback

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all … and free!
results.name: SHSNY Book Club: "The Origins of Political Order" - Francis Fukuyama

results.description:
Speaker: Simon Lawrence (Head of Engineering @ TrulyWireless)

When you think of systems with the highest expectation of uptime, phone service ranks right near the top. People expect that every time they pick up the phone and place a call it will work. TrulyWireless has to provide that level of service while still rapidly iterating and improving their product. This talk is about how as a small team they were able to move from a unreliable monolithic PHP app to a highly available distributed system, ensuring that the businesses relying on them are receiving the calls they should be. The phones must ring!

Food will be on-hand (pizza and salad from one of our favorite nearby spots) as well as wine, beer, and non-alcoholic beverages. 

Event Schedule

7:00PM: Meet folks and enjoy some pizza
7:30PM: Talk begins
8:15PM: Talk concludes
results.name: Highly Available Telephony Architecture

Some topics to expect...
- Inheriting a Product (with Guest Expert: Felix Sargent)
- and more...

Featured Product: RJ Metrics

From Felix Sargent, VP of Product @ SeamlessDocs ...
"I grew up wanting to be a Product Manager. I grew up in my older Brother's shadow, listening to him tear his hair out at how hard it is to be an Engineer on a team with a terrible product manager. I wanted  to find a way to improve management in technology.  I got to fulfil that dream at Rackspace, where I released Auto Scale, and was the product manager for Repose, a realtime middleware manager for distributed systems. I'm now the VP of Product at Seamless Docs, and mentoring at The Product Group, I look forward to discussing how to take on new projects, and inherit old ones."

From Matt Monihan, Product Manager at RJMetrics...
"I am a product manager at RJMetrics (https://rjmetrics.com), where we inspire and empower data-driven people. We do that by providing a business intelligence solution that lets our customers connect, consolidate, and then visualize their data on an easy-to-use dashboard. Our biggest challenge is building the right tools for organizations experiencing an explosion of data sources, but having limited engineering resources to wrangle it all."


Note: Please make sure your meetup.com information is up-to-date (incl. First & Last names). You will need to show ID matching the name you used to RSVP. 


Hope to see you there!
results.name: The Product Group April 2016

results.description:
Comic time! This week: Rarity and Babs Seed, and Spike and Luna.  So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friends Forever #13 and #14(descriptions and download links below) 

http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/d/d8/Friends_Forever_issue_13_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141022150133

Friends Forever #13

Sweetie Belle  wakes up one morning, excited about the day, but finds she cannot stand up straight without falling over. A visit from a doctor reveals that Sweetie Belle has an ear infection that affects her balance and prevents her from traveling. Both Sweetie Belle and Rarity are saddened by this, as the two had been looking forward to a trip together to Manehattan.


Written by: Jeremy Whitley 
Artwork by: Agnes Garbowska

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-13/digital-comic/170952

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/1/19/Friends_Forever_issue_14_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141119061430

Friends Forever #14

During a dream in which he is bullied by Garble and his teenage dragon friends, Spike encounters Princess Luna, who says she needs him to answer the door. Spike wakes up and opens the front door of the castle to see Luna, who has come to recruit him to "assist in an important mission." A string of mysterious fires has plagued Fillydelphia for the past several nights, and the police suspect involvement by the local population of dragons. Luna has faith that Spike can help resolve the situation. 

Written by: Jeremy Whitley
Artwork by: Agnes Garbowska

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-14/digital-comic/189858

Love brazilian music? This workshop is for you!
We'll get to work on classics of bossa-nova, understand the rhythm patterns and learn the finger style technique to master comping and the nuances of brazilian clave.
You'll get familiar with 7th, 9th, 13th, diminish chords.
Nylon string guitar is recommended for this class but you won't get turned away if you bring a steel string guitar.
You must be familiar with open chords and comfortable playing songs and switching chords in time. Barre chord knowledge is a plus but nor required for this workshop.
This is a one hour workshop with the option of performing three songs May 1st at Arlene's Grocery.
Obrigada!

Bio: Susan, Esther, and Daisy started at university three weeks ago and became fast friends. Now, away from home for the first time, all three want to reinvent themselves. Going off to university is always a time of change and growth, but for Esther, Susan, and Daisy, things are about to get a little weird.

On Thursday, April 7, the Young Professional Board of Global Humanitaria USA will host their first Spring Gala "Paint the Future Bright" at WeWork Bryant Park. This event will bring together young New Yorkers—Global Humanitaria supporters, friends and young philanthropists alike. 

Join us for an evening of hors d'ouvures, cocktails and music benefitting Syrian children refugees. On display and up for auction will be artwork created by affected youth as part of their art therapy rehabilitation. Through creative expression, youth have an outlet to express and process what they have experienced in the war. 

The featured pieces at this event provide an insight to the on-the-ground reality from the lens of the most vulnerable, affected population: children. 

 
All proceeds will benefit our programs in Jordan and greatly contribute to the recovery of hundreds of children affected by the war. 

WHEN

Thursday, April 7, 2016 from 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM (EDT) - Add to Calendar

WHEREWeWork Bryant Park - 54 West 40th Street New York, NY 10018 - View Map

results.description:
THE ORIGINS OF POLITICAL ORDER: From Prehistoric Times to the French Revolution - PART I

Francis Fukuyama

Bestseller Fukuyama provides a sweeping account of how today’s basic political institutions developed, beginning with politics among our primate ancestors and follows the story through the emergence of tribal societies, the growth of the first modern state in China, the beginning of the rule of law in India and the Middle East, and the development of political accountability in Europe up until the eve of the French Revolution.

Drawing on a vast body of knowledge, history, evolutionary biology, archaeology, and economics, Fukuyama has produced a brilliant, provocative work that offers fresh insights on the origins of democratic societies and raises essential questions about the nature of politics and its discontents. from tribes to national governments.

We’ll read and discuss the first half of this blockbuster (Chaps 1-15), then the second half in May. — Paperback

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all … and free!
results.name: SHSNY Book Club: "The Origins of Political Order" - Francis Fukuyama

results.description:
How I Look at Interpreting a Birth Chart
I will walk through interpreting three (maybe four) birth charts to show how I personally pull out and prioritize all the information and put together a portrait of a human being from the data. This is a good opportunity for informed beginners who know the basics of astrology but still struggle to put all the pieces together in a holistic way. Every astrologer has their own preferred methods, and I will share my way of doing it.

SPEAKER

Anthony S. Picco has been a professional astrologer since 1986, accumulating hundreds of readings and many hours of client counseling along the way. He also co-hosts an internet radio show called “What’s Your Sign? I Have Your Number,” with Sharita Star, every Monday evening from 7pm-9pm Eastern Time, on the Hey Z Radio Network. His blog is at cosmictuesdays.com

Meeting starts at 7pm SHARP, with a 15-20 minute chat about some very basic astrology for newer students, given by co-organizer Anthony Picco, followed by 10-15 minutes of announcements. After that, we will turn the floor over to Anthony Picco for about an hour and twenty minutes, followed by general socializing. The suggested donation is $5, and greatly appreciated, but whatever you can afford is acceptable. And if you cannot afford anything, you are still welcome to attend.

PS: If you show up a little early, the Quest Bookshop is an excellent source of many metaphysical books and items, and well worth a browse. They close at 7pm. 


DIRECTIONS

Our meetup takes place at the Theosophical Society, which is next door to Quest Bookshop. You may enter through the bookshop before 7 pm (when it closes) or to the left of the bookshop after 7 pm. A sign will be posted on the door you can enter. The following is a rough outline. We start at 7 pm.

7–7:20 - Short talk sharing some astrological fundamentals, especially for beginners 

7:20–7:40 - Brief intros from attendees, announcements 

7:40–8:40 - Main presentation 

8:40–9:15 - Socializing (while putting away chairs)
results.name: April 2016: How I Look at Interpreting a Birth Chart

results.description:
3D Thursday 4/7: 3D Printing Show and Tell 

We are hosting a "3D Printing Show and Tell". This is your opportunity show your 3D prints, designs and project ideas! If you have something to share please feel free to participate or just come to observe what our group members have been interested in with 3D printing.

---

3D Thursdays!

So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.
results.name: 3D Printing Show and Tell

We're excited to announce the launching of new staff-run RPG events at the Brooklyn Strategist! Check out the details for each event below, and be sure to RSVP for your table by following this link: bstrat.eventsmart.com

D&D 5E, "Lost in the Sands": Dungeons & Dragons is a game take on heroic roles and interact with each other and the Dungeon Master to experience fantasy, fights, and epic storytelling. Run by the Strategist’s professional Dungeon Master Ben Williams, this program will offer guidance to beginner players new to the rules of Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), while still providing a veteran level experience. The campaign will be set in the Dungeon Master’s custom world, Unisum, allowing players a greater degree of character customization and incorporation into the world’s story, while still using 5th edition basic rules and content as a base. Play will consist of a mixture of roleplaying and combat with a focus on long-term story. Character creation, background-building, group play style and other game elements will be covered in the first session. Please contact Ben at [masked] with questions. This campaign will be supported by an Obsidian Portal webpage. Campaign details and background lore can be found at https://lostinthesands.obsidianportal.com/.

Call of Cthulhu 7E, "Masks of Nyarlathotep": Call of Cthulhu is a game of surreal horror in which players strive to uncover a vast and mysterious cosmic conspiracy before losing their lives or their sanity. Run by the Strategist’s professional Keeper of Secret Timm Woods, this program will offer instruction to players new to the rules of Call of Cthulhu (7th Edition), while accommodating advanced play for veteran gamers. Players will begin with the classic introductory Call of Cthulhu scenario “The Haunting” before transitioning into the award-winning “Masks of Nyarlathotep”. Character creation, background-building, and other elements of campaign play will be covered in the first session. Please contact Timm at [masked] with questions.

Remember that signing up for the Meetup event does NOT guarantee you a spot. Follow the link to our registration page and reserve your seat for free immediately!

results.description:
Click Here for Event Page and Tickets


Come join us Thursday, April 7th at 7:00pm at the Ark for a community meditation gathering to investigate the nature of mind while being taken on a journey of world music with instruments including the didgeridoo, Hang drum/handpan, Native American flute and hand drum, Tibetan singing bowls, African ngoni and mbira combined with medicine songs from various Native American traditions and Tuvan overtone throat singing.


This meditation gathering will also be a philosophical dharma study and discussion of the teachings of world renowned spiritual figures such as Chogyam Trungpa of the Tibetan Buddhist tradition, Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj and Sri Ramana Maharshi of the Advaita Vedanta tradition of India, S.N. Goenka of the Vipassana tradition, while drawing on the teachings from various indigenous shamanic traditions of the Americas and beyond. We will focus on a particular set of teachings for several classes and use the material for discussion and sharing at the end of the meditation practice.

We will engage in questions such as: how can meditation apply beyond the sitting cushion into a practical application of mindfulness and compassion in everyday life, how can we cultivate equanimity around physical and psychological pain, what is the nature of self, how do we create and sustain sangha (spiritual community), what is spirituality without dogma, and more.

Suggested donation is $10-$20 but no one will be turned away for lack of funds

Jerry Walsh has been a student of the dharma for the past eight years and a vipassana meditator for five years. Jerry has also been a student of Maestro Manuel Rufino for four years, studying the sacred traditions of humanity focusing primarily on the shamanic traditions of the Indigenous cultures of the Americas. He has travelled to over twenty-five different countries on five continents and spent a full year studying Buddhism and Himalayan culture in India, Nepal, and Bhutan from 2010-2011. He currently works with BEAT NYC, a non-profit that teaches Hip-Hop and Beatboxing in NYC public schools. He is a founding member of the Sacred Arts Research Foundation 501 (c) 3 and the Ark in Greenpoint, Brooklyn where he resides with the Golden Drum community. 

Jerry is a musician, vocalist, and beatboxer mixing ancient instruments and techniques such as the didgeridoo, Peruvian pan flute, Native American Fute, hang drum (handpan), and Tuvan throat singing with experimental hip-hop rhythms and lyrics revolving around mysticism and social activism. He has performed and taught at Sonic Bloom Festival, Gratitude Festival, Mysteryland Festival in Chile, Unifier Festival, Alex Grey's Chapel of Sacred Mirrors, and Cosmic Convergence Festival in Guatemala performing solo and in collaboration with Merkaba (Kalya Scintilla) and Srikalogy. Jerry has worked alongside internationally acclaimed sculpture artist, Kate Raudenbush, for the past three years bringing large scale laser-cut steel allegorical and spiritually inspired installations to New York City, San Francisco, Baltimore, Black Rock City, Amsterdam in the Netherlands, and Santiago in Chile.

Sometimes it's helpful to write in a group. So in this meeting we're coming together to just write. No critiques, no audiences (unless you want one), no pressure but that which you put on yourself. Here's how it works:


Part 1: 7:00- 7:45 we will write from a prompt provided by the organizer or one of the attending members.


Part 2: 7:50 - 9:50 is dedicated time for free writing. Work on whatever you want. We'd hope that work generated during these sessions will be submitted to any of the other Meetups or for broadcast on our podcast, Kaleidocast.


Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

NOTE: DOORS WILL LOCK AT 7.10PM. 

As a man you probably experience some level of sexual scarcity. You may complain about not having enough. Or about ending up in “the friend zone”. Or about how unfair it is that women have the all the power and don’t give you the sex you want. You may have even “given up”, and decided to stop trying to have sex, hoping that one day a woman will come along and decide you’re the one she wants. In the meantime, you seek other outlets like porn, strip clubs, and prostitution, and end up feeling empty, shameful and lonely.


There’s GOOD NEWS! What if I told you women want sex more than men? That they're hungry for it and have sexual scarcity too? What if women are regularly telling you that they’re interested in you, and you just aren’t able to hear them?

It’s like if a really amazing, turned on Japanese woman comes up to you, and starts telling you in Japanese that she’s attracted to you and wanted to go on a date. You don’t speak Japanese, so by the 4th or 5th time you tell her that you don’t know what she’s saying, eventually she’ll get tired and go away.

IT DOESN’T HAVE TO BE THIS WAY! You can move from scarcity to abundance, you CAN have the sex you want.

Keith Paolino knows this pattern well. For the decade before he showed up to OneTaste, he was emotionally stunted and had been celibate for years. Then he started an Orgasmic Meditation practice, got turned on, and powerful women started giving him reflections and adjustments. Now he has manifested an abundance of sex and intimacy most men don't dream is even possible. These days, he’s a successful sex and relationship coach with OneTaste Austin, and loves to give to other men what turned on women have given to him.

Come see how you might be talking yourself out of sex and connection. And take your next step towards abundance.

OneTaste teaches about relationships, intimacy, sexuality and purpose through a practice called Orgasmic Meditation. Orgasmic Meditation is a partnered consciousness practice where a man or woman strokes the upper left-hand quadrant of a woman's clitoris for 15 minutes in order to increase connection, sensitivity, and intimacy. Admission is FREE.

This event is open to all adults 18 years or older. All OneTaste New York events are drug/alcohol free.

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

group.name: The Happiness and Goodness Club - White Plains

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in a small group just inside the turnstile, or we gather in the track infield near the long jump pit
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
Sometimes ethical arguments don't work, so you have to fall back on utilitarianism. To that end, John Lott has done great work studying how access to guns reduces crime rates. If you have not read his books, "More Guns, Less Crime" or "The Bias Against Guns", come see for yourself how his years of research have led him to libertarian conclusions.

Also, bring your popcorn because the regular New Yorkers in the crowd will be sure to provide hilarious commentary.

This meetup is hosted by NYC Junto in the beautiful General Society Library. More info at: http://nycjunto.org/upcoming-speakers/
results.name: NYC Junto: John Lott vs Paul Helmke

results.description:
French culture hub Fluent City is hosting a screening of French film Hail Mary at Videology on Thursday, April 7th at 7pm. There will be English subtitles. All Williamsburg French Meetup members can get $2 tickets in advance using code "fluent_city2016" at http://bit.ly/1RNKh1r. (Tickets are $10 at the door).

Happy hour will happen from 6-7pm in the bar right beforehand with $5 old fashioned cocktails and super discounted beers and wines!

Dir. Jean-Luc Godard
French-language film with subtitles

Denounced by the Pope and banned and boycotted worldwide, this surprisingly serene and lyrical work translates the Virgin Birth into tangible contemporary terms, with Mary as a teenage basketball-playing gas-station attendant who receives the Annunciation by jetliner. Mary is a beautiful yet ordinary teenager who vows to maintain her chastity. Following a warning from an angel, a confused and innocent Mary unexpectedly falls pregnant and is forced to wed her taxi-driving boyfriend Joseph. He, in turn, must love his virgin bride from a distance, revering her without touching her. Forced to face a shocking reality, Mary and Joseph along with their family and friends must struggle to cope as the provocative theme unfolds. Hail Mary is a sensational and bold work from French master director Jean-Luc Godard which touched off an uproar of protest heard around the world.

See more upcoming French events at fluentcity.com/events.
results.how_to_find_us: Just come on back when you arrive!
results.name: French Film Night Hosted by Fluent City

results.description:
3D Thursday 4/7: 3D Printing Show and Tell  

We are hosting a "3D Printing Show and Tell". This is your opportunity show your 3D prints, designs and project ideas! If you have something to share please feel free to participate or just come to observe what our group members have been interested in with 3D printing.

---

3D Thursdays!

So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting!  

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.name: 3D Thursdays! : 3D Printing Show and Tell

results.description:
Its open board game night! Grab some friends and your favorite board game and head on over to the Highlander location in Boonton to have some fun.  Don't have a game, or interested in playing a new one?  We've got an extensive demo library open to everyone so feel free to pick whichever game strikes your fancy, grab a group, and play. 


Additionally there will be a featured demo of a different game each week, I'll be updating this meetup each week so you guys know what we've got. 


Other than that feel free to use this meetup as a way to organize your own games for Thursday nights, we've got space for everyone and plenty of people already show up so picking up a group should be no problem at all.  Hope to see you there!

results.description:
A general Toastmasters club meeting has three parts: a) Project Speeches; b) Table Topics;  and c). Evaluation. 

a).  The first part is Project Speeches. Our Project Speakers get their project assignments from either the Competent Communication manual or one of the Advanced Communication manuals. The Project Speakers prepare their speeches according to the project assignment.

b).  The second part of the meeting is Table Topics, which are brief impromptu speeches that require no preparation.  There are two purposes during this part.  The first purpose is to provide a speaking opportunity to members and prospective members who do not have a speaking role. The second purpose is to improve our impromptu speaking skills.

c).  The third and final part of the meeting is the Evaluation portion. Evaluation is an important part of a Toastmasters meeting. Unless we receive feedback on our speeches to know what our strengths and weaknesses are, we will not improve our communication and listening skills.

In the club meeting, you practice giving prepared speeches as well as brief impromptu presentations (Table Topics). There is no rush and no pressure: The Toastmasters program allows you to progress at your own pace.

Constructive evaluation is central to the Toastmasters philosophy. Receiving - and giving - such feedback is a great learning experience. In Toastmasters, encouragement and improvement go hand-in-hand.

Toastmasters is a place where you develop and grow - both personally and professionally. You join a community of learners, and in Toastmasters meetings we learn by doing. Whether you're an executive or a stay-at-home parent, a college student or a retiree, you will improve yourself; building skills to express yourself in a variety of situations. You'll open up a world of new possibilities: giving better work presentations; leading meetings - and participating in them - more confidently; speaking more smoothly off the cuff; even handling one-on-one interactions with family, friends and colleagues more positively.
results.name: General Toastmasters Club Meeting

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Are you LIVING a SUPER LIFE yet? SUPER CHOICES allows someone to solve the jigsaw puzzle of their life. A lifestyle where all the pieces of their life fit together providing opportunities to be an ideal self. Unlocking infinite opportunities to use your passion,ambitions,fun, love, talents, hard work, independence, intuitions, and spirit in the world. Stop sweating the future because your SUPER CHOICES create your desired future. Making SUPER CHOICES is your gateway to your SUPER LIFE in the story of your life. The choices that make all other choices work. You know what you really want out of life. Time to become SUPER! Are you ready to start making SUPER CHOICES?

Ever find yourself hunting ANSWERS in the business, psychology or self-help sections of bookstores, ONLINE videos or doing Yoga?

Do you wonder where are NEW outside of the box self-Development solutions beyond just “believe in yourself” or “have high self-esteem?” Counterintuitive answers that really work! A number of fields have been assemble to create "SUPER CHOICES-SUPER LIFE" : Behavioral Economics, Behavioral Psychology, Cognitive science, Neural Science, Social Psychology, Decision Theory, Positive psychology, and much more.

                                                   WHY STUDIO? 
"Adult learning needs to evolve to incorporate a dynamic interaction of both art and science"-James Murdock

STUDIO- a space where artists, designers and learners can experience, experiment, engage and create in multiple mediums. Where skills, abilities and tools can be developed in an environment that provides continuous feedback. 
A COGNITIVE STUDIO is also a place of ENDLESS PLAY!

Each studio session you will practice cognitive tools to immediately take your life to the next level. Forming A Community Of Shared "Specific Mind" Practices using Neuro-art and other tools during meetup sessions.


          WHAT TO EXPECT IN THE "SUPER CHOICES SUPER LIFE" STUDIO?

SOME ASSEMBLY IS REQUIRED LEARNING- Don’t expect to sit passively taking notes while nodding your head. All sessions require active thinking and moving to produce the daily results you want. Your hands, senses and brain will work together during our active and interactive learning methods.

HANDS ON ACTION

EVERY MINUTE IS PACKED

EVENTS ARE FAST-PACED, DYNAMIC AND FUN

It's time to turn positive accidents and lucky breaks into everyday events.

Reach your full potential today

Location

SUPER CHOICES SUPER LIFE 
Thursday APRIL 7 
Time 7:20 pm To 9:30 pm 
Location: Ripley-Grier 
520 8th Avenue 17 FL 
Between 36th and 37th street 
New York, NY 10018 
Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.

Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 16 Floor 
NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.

Room: 16 I

$10.00 online  
$15.00 at the door

                              WHO SHOULD ATTEND And BENEFIT? 
Self-Development Seeker, Executives, Power Networkers, Small business owners, I.T. professionals, Entrepreneurs,teachers, Running a Start up, Artists, Writers,Self-employed, Public Relations, educators, managers & executives, or Salespersons. Anyone and everyone with beliefs and those who communicate with others that have beliefs. Someone that wants more FREEDOM, CREATIVITY AND ACHIEVEMENT in their lives.

                                                               CURATOR

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

A COGNITIVE STUDIO is also a place of ENDLESS PLAY!

Each studio session you will practice cognitive tools to immediately take your life to the next level. Forming A Community Of Shared "Specific Mind" Practices using Neuro-art and other tools during meetup sessions.


          WHAT TO EXPECT IN THE "SUPER CHOICES SUPER LIFE" STUDIO?

SOME ASSEMBLY IS REQUIRED LEARNING- Don’t expect to sit passively taking notes while nodding your head. All sessions require active thinking and moving to produce the daily results you want. Your hands, senses and brain will work together during our active and interactive learning methods.

HANDS ON ACTION

EVERY MINUTE IS PACKED

EVENTS ARE FAST-PACED, DYNAMIC AND FUN

It's time to turn positive accidents and lucky breaks into everyday events.

Reach your full potential today

Location

SUPER CHOICES SUPER LIFE 
Thursday APRIL 7 
Time 7:20 pm To 9:30 pm 
Location: Ripley-Grier 
520 8th Avenue 17 FL 
Between 36th and 37th street 
New York, NY 10018 
Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.

Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 16 Floor 
NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.

Room: 16 I

$10.00 online  
$15.00 at the door

                              WHO SHOULD ATTEND And BENEFIT? 
Self-Development Seeker, Executives, Power Networkers, Small business owners, I.T. professionals, Entrepreneurs,teachers, Running a Start up, Artists, Writers,Self-employed, Public Relations, educators, managers & executives, or Salespersons. Anyone and everyone with beliefs and those who communicate with others that have beliefs. Someone that wants more FREEDOM, CREATIVITY AND ACHIEVEMENT in their lives.

                                                               CURATOR

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

Don't be intimidated by the title. This is still a go-at-your-own pace run, with stops and looping back for people. We just kindly suggest that you take it at your not-so-casual pace, whatever that may mean to you.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.

results.description:
“I was born with internal properties which I have not chosen. Then, the environment, my family and the education I received operated on me from the outside and built me in a certain way. And thus I live, as a result of these two conditions, which I have not defined. 

All of a sudden a question awakens in me: “Why am I alive? What for?” I didn’t choose this question either, it simply awakened from within me. This is the beginning of the awakening of the "point in the heart" and it pulls me to a higher world.

Here, the possibility of choice begins.” -- Dr. Michael Laitman

"The Path To Spiritual Development":

• Gain knowledge into the purpose of creation

• Become familiar with the concept of the Point in the Heart

• Leave with the understanding of the process of the development of desires

• Experience the power of connection through discussion circles

​Join us and other like-minded seekers! 

Kab Nights is a great way to get acquainted with authentic Kabbalah in a casual setting, guided by experienced instructors. Through original Kabbalistic texts, lively discussion, rare videos and all the coffee/tea and cookies you can have.

We promise a one-of-a-kind evening. 
Please come on by and tell your friends!

Register Here: http://kabnights.kabbalah.info 

We can't wait to see you!​
results.name: Kab Nights: The Path To Spiritual Development

group.name: Bnei Baruch Kabbalah Study Group Upper Westside, NY

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description:
Dear holistic friends: 

I am so excited to present the following wonderful holistic health practitioners and topics for our next course entitled How to Heal Body, Mind and Spirit, Naturally! 

This is a Port Washington Adult Ed course, offered Thursdays, 730-9pm, April, 7, 14, 21 and May 5, 2016, Only 60 dollars for all 4 nights, plus a nominal fee if not a Port Washington resident! Here is the registration link. Click on the link, then click on Adult Enrichment, then on Health and Wellness. 
LINK: https://portwashingto...­ 

Thank you for registering early to secure your space. 
Please contact me at [masked] if you need any assistance registering or if you wish to present in a future course. This can be a wonderful way to grow your practice as people truly get to know you during your presentation and during the course! And a wonderful way for you to network and explore career opportunities in this fascinating field of health! This course is very comprehensive and is open to everyone!! 


How to Heal Body, Mind and Spirit Naturally

DREAM THERAPY 
Jennifer Shafran, Lic. Master Level Social Worker 

I worked with various populations and along with a multitude of problems including but not limited to mental illness, alcohol, and drug addiction, homelessness and a host of medical illnesses including hospice care. However in the midst of the depression and despair I recognized one common thread that everyone seemed stuck in the situation with little hope of getting out of the situation until the situation resolved itself. 
I decided to become a Dream Builder Life Coach taught by Mary Morrissey. 
The basis behind my coaching is just what would you love in your life that you do not have and cannot understand how to get it. If money, education, time, and age had no barrier, what would you love! Life can change in an instant and most of us are stuck and do not even realize it but we no longer had the excitement about life that we once had. 
In Class, all attendees must bring pen and paper. Collectively all will write down their dreams in four areas: 
1-Relationships 
2-Health and Well Being 
3-Vocation 
4-Time and Money 
Then I will ask 5 questions that I would read over after one has written down 
their dreams, these are basic questions to see if their dreams aligns with their core values. This builds excitement. I help people is to realize their dreams in a short period of time. Not only do I help people find their inner dreams that are starving to come out; I help them realize that they DESERVE their dreams! In a short period of time, I can help you find your dreams. 
Reality is that most people have dreams but get lost in the everyday life. I help you become aware of what is holding you back from making your dreams a reality. Depression is really the separation of ones’ dreams. Instead of taking medication to numb our feelings and discontent lets follow this holistic approach to happiness and excitement! 
Let’s follow our dreams! 
--------------------------------------­----------------------------------------­-----------How to Heal Suppressed Wounds Through Inner Child Work and 
Past Life Regression 
Kelly Tallaksen, Board Certificate Hypnotist and Past Life Regressionist 
Specializing in inner child bonding and healing of the soul 

Learn: 
• Why the subconscious mind suppresses emotions 
• Why awareness of unconscious pain is the only way to heal it 
• How loving your younger self liberates your adult self 
• Do we really have past lives and how does past life regression work heal soul? 

Kelly Tallaksen is a board certified hypnotist, past life regression practitioner and instructor, holds a certificate in Holistic Psychology, specializes in 5 Phase Advanced Transformational Hypnosis, Parts Therapy and is the creator of the LUV Your Feelings Process. Kelly's work includes helping other heal unconscious painful memories in a gentle, loving and trusting manner. Kelly is also an active blogger forwww.heartsinharmonyhealing.com. 

Kelly believes many of the thoughts and behaviors we want to change are locked in the deeper parts of our consciousness and can only be accessed and healed by going into that deeper part of our minds and locating the source of our suffering. Awareness of the origins of our internal emotional discomfort is the first and foremost step to deep and profound healing. 
Website: www.heartsinharmonyhypnosis.com 
--------------------------------------­----------------------------------------­-----------Detoxing Naturally and Safely and Alleviating Seasonal Allergies with Homeopathy 
Jiuan Heng, Classical Homeopath 


Spring is a great time to recharge your body and mind. 
We will discuss the root cause of seasonal allergies, respiratory tract infections and menstrual issues, and learn how to support our bodies’ natural ways of eliminating toxins and boost immunity with gemmotherapy (dilute preparations of plant stem cells). We will also learn how to restore health naturally with homeopathy, focusing on remedies for seasonal hay fever. 
Learn how suppressing emotions such as anger or grief can impact your body and how you can support your emotional and physical detox with homeopathic remedies. 

About Jiuan Heng: Jiuan Heng is a classical homeopath who is passionate about helping people connect with their dreams by building long term health. She studied at the New York School of Homeopathy and passed the national certification examination within a year of graduation. She has continued to train with many world-renowned homeopaths. She is also a certified CEASE practitioner, working with individuals on the autism spectrum to address the root causes of their symptoms.She holds a Doctorate in Philosophy from Columbia University. 

Jiuan Heng, PhD, CCH (Cand.) 
Homeopathy Studio LLC 
homeopathystudio.com


Anger Management and Communication Styles 
Facilitated by Eileen Lichtenstein, MS. Ed. 
Certified Anger Management Specialist, CEO, Balance & Power, Inc. 

• Enhance all aspects of stress and anger management 
• Communicate more effectively 
• Be happier 
Explore strategies to release anger, reduce stress and deal effectively with others. Anger and communication issues are highly affected by stress levels. Being happier is a wonderful by-product of communicating effectively! 

Learn about distinctions among communication styles and behavior so that you can communicate more effectively at work and at home, be listened to, and respected. Learn how not to “take things personally” and reduce stress / frustration! Stress release techniques to help you cope with "difficult" people are included in this interactive workshop. 
The best predictor of a positive outcome is your willingness and intention to change patterns. 
Your communication, anger and stress impacts your relationships, health, work life and financial situation. 
Inner strength and being centered are keys to life and business success, and Eileen Lichtenstein has specialized for over 20 years in personal development coaching and training, including stress and anger reduction/ management, relationship and leadership building, sensitivity training, communicating effectively and career issues. Eileen’s background includes 
innovative training, speaking, coaching and bio-feedback, offering individuals and groups mind/body modalities and coaching strategies to facilitate success. She is based in Westbury, Long Island, NY conducting one:one coaching and small group trainings as well via skype, webinars and on-site. 
--------------------------------------­----------------------------------------­----------­How to Lift Mood with Food 
Dawn Riccardi Morris, CPA, Health Coach, Educator, Speaker, Consultant 

Does the food you eat affect how you think, feel, and behave? There's exciting new research to suggest that it certainly does! Join Dawn, as she shares the story of how she empowered her daughter to heal from a serious digestive illness, and how she learned how gut health is the foundation of a healthy, happy mind and overall wellness. 

Learn which foods support optimal brain health, and may aid in the prevention of and/or the recovery from depression, learning & behavioral disorders, neurological diseases, and even dementia and Alzheimer's. You'll leave with a clear understanding of which foods you need to include and avoid in order to maintain a brain healthy lifestyle.


Dawn Riccardi Morris is a certified health coach who specializes in cleaning eating and gluten/dairy/sugar free living. She is on a mission to help people purify their plates, using real ingredients and simple recipes (that don’t taste like cardboard!). You can find out more about Dawn and her work at her web site,www.TransformedByFood.com.

He will educate us on the three basic doshas: Vatta, Pitta and Kapha. Vata-the energy of movement, Pitta for metabolism and Kapha for body lubrication. Biju will also educate us on Marma Therapy and Nadi Pariksha and their roles in achieving optimal health!

Jennifer Hairston-Davis: Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Reiki Master Teacher, Silver Leader Young Living


Essential oils have been used since ancient times and they are making a strong comeback in this day and age where people are looking for better ways to support their health. Essential oils are more powerful than organic foods and dried herbs, energetically and therefore have amazing transformative power. 
We will discuss other reasons why essential oils are so powerful, the three main ways to use them, what they can be used for and how to have better mental/emotional health. Your emotional body is controlled by your sense of smell, making aromatherapy the KEY ingredient to feeling happier, lighter and less STRESSED! We will discuss the biochemistry behind this and how you can get in the driver’s seat when it comes to being in control of your feelings and your body. It’s time to take back your mind, body 
and soul and live from a place of empowerment.

She has a passion for holistic & non-toxic living and teaches others how to embrace this lifestyle. She has a private practice in Merrick, NY where the focus in on Mind, Body and Soul healing. Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

This week's group will be led by meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp and include guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition and a short walking meditation. Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

* Please try to arrive 5 min early, since we like to begin promptly at 7:30pm. And if you're late, please just enter quietly and join us.

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.

results.description:
Join us to discuss the novel Station Eleven by Emily St. John Mandel. 


An audacious, darkly glittering novel about art, fame, and ambition set in the eerie days of civilization's collapse, from the author of three highly acclaimed previous novels. One snowy night a famous Hollywood actor slumps over and dies onstage during a production of King Lear. Hours later, the world as we know it begins to dissolve. Moving back and forth in time-from the actor's early days as a film star to fifteen years in the future, when a theater troupe known as the Traveling Symphony roams the wasteland of what remains-this suspenseful, elegiac, spellbinding novel charts the strange twists of fate that connect five people: the actor, the man who tried to save him, the actor's first wife, his oldest friend, and a young actress with the Traveling Symphony, caught in the crosshairs of a dangerous self-proclaimed prophet. Sometimes terrifying, sometimes tender, Station Eleven tells a story about the relationships that sustain us, the ephemeral nature of fame, and the beauty of the world as we know it.

Novels at Night is a book club for adults 21 years and older who enjoy reading and sharing their opinions about books. Join us monthly at the 9 Iron Grille (314 Paramus Road) to meet new people, sample great food** and drinks, and discuss books in a relaxed atmosphere. Copies of this novel can be picked up at the Paramus Public Library (116 East Century Road). Please feel free to call the library with any questions about this program, (201) 599-1305.
results.name: Station Eleven by Emily St. John Mandel

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 3 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. Spots will be assigned within 24 hours.

The Place: Le Bernardin has held three stars from the Michelin Guide since its 2005 New York launch and currently ranks 18 on the S. Pellegrino World’s 50 Best Restaurants list. The New York Zagat Guide has recognized Le Bernardin as top rated in the category of “Best Food” for the last nine consecutive years, and in 2015 was rated by the guide as New York City’s top restaurant for food and service. 

We will be participating in the Chef's Tasting Menu that is $215pp.

https://www.le-bernardin.com/menus/dining-room/chef-s-tasting


*Please note the attire for gentlemen is formal (jacket required) and the equivalent for ladies.


Pre-Payment:As the restaurant has my credit card I am requiring pre-payment of $285 (includes tax and tip) with Chase QuickPay. The enrollment for non-Chase customers is here.


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 


Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Le Bernardin - Three Michelin Stars

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
John Lott and Paul Helmke will engage in an Oxford-style debate on gun control on April 7, 2016 at the NYC Junto. The debate will begin at 8 PM. Attendees are invited to arrive at 7 PM for socialization, followed by open discussion at 7:30 PM. 

The proposition for debate is: “In order to reduce its murder-rate, the U.S. needs more stringent gun-control laws.”

John Lott will argue against the proposition. Dr. Lott's book, "More Guns, Less Crime,” now in its third edition, was first published in 1998. He holds a PhD in economics from UCLA and has held teaching and/or research positions at Wharton, University of Chicago, Stanford, and Yale. He is the President of the Crime Prevention Research Center. He originally spoke at the NYC Junto in 1999.

Paul Helmke will argue in favor of the proposition. Mr. Helmke is an American politician, attorney, and advocate for gun control. He served as a three-term mayor of Fort Wayne, Indiana, President of the US Conference of Mayors, and President and CEO of the Brady Center to Prevent Gun Violence. He holds a JD from Yale Law School, is a Professor of Practice at Indiana University Bloomington, and is the founding Director of IU Bloomington's Civic Leaders Center.

Founded in 1985, the NYC Junto is a monthly meeting hosted by investor Victor Niederhoffer. Junto meetings are moderated by Barron's columnist Gene Epstein and Mr. Niederhoffer. Meetings occur on the first Thursday of each month, are free and open to the public, and take place at the General Society Library, 20 West 44th Street.

You may subscribe to the Junto newsletter at NYCJunto.organd connect with the NYC Junto on Twitter, Meetup, and the Podcasts app.

Related Links

https://www.facebook.com/events/466083283581197


twitter.com/NYCJunto

twitter.com/VicNiederhoffer

DailySpeculations.com

Junto podcast: 

https://itun.es/us/oQ4F0.c

Come with a friend, or come solo.

All comics performing on the show are professionals and have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc) + MORE!!

Being just around the corner from the legendary Comedy Cellar, we regularly get special guest drop in's from some of the biggest names in comedy!!

The Village Lantern is located at 167 Bleeker St.

Trains Stations Nearby: W. 4th St- D/B/M/F/A/C/E, Bleeker St- 6, Christopher St- 1

Meetup and hang out in the bar area from 730-8 and join us downstairs in the Comedy Club at 8 for the FREE SHOW!!

The Lantern offers a full bar and food menu!

Seating is limited and by reservation only.  To Reserve a seat, RSVP through Eventbrite w. your best email and show your confirmation at the door.
