results.description:
We all know the term "Law of Attraction." But, what is it, really? How does it work? And, what practical place does it have in day-to-day life?

The purpose of this group is to answer these questions, as well as bring like-minded people together to form a network of support in living with clear intention. You'll learn about the Universal Laws and Abraham Hicks' processes and practices. This will help you shift your energetic vibration, align with your higher self and empower you to deliberately create a life you love.

Coming together as a group to do this type of work is incredibly powerful. This is truly our life's work, and committing to our lives in this way is not only transformational for us. It's transformational for those around us.

$20

Please register at: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=231300&stype=41&sTG=53&prodId=10271

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]
results.name: Futsal on Thursdays Midtown/8:15pm

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
“For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to shew himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward him. Herein thou hast done foolishly: therefore from henceforth thou shalt have wars.” (2 Chronicles 16:9 KJV)

ATTENTION ALL MEMBERS OF THE CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA.

All members of the national organization of the Christian Party of America are invited to attend the monthly “Members Only” Conference Call via Skype.  If you are already a member of the national organization, you can obtain the call-in information by emailing the National Chairman Clell Drumheller at [masked].  If you are not yet a member but would like to become a member, you can find out how to join and obtain the membership forms at http://christianpartyonline.com/wp/join-the-party/

So members Please join us at the Christian Party of America’s monthly Members Only Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Clell Drumheller, National Chairman of the Christian Party of America and Texas State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Every quarter the National Executive Committee will hold its business meeting during the call and members are invited to observe the Executive Committee meeting on those occasions.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide members only Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other members of the Christian Party as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call.

“11 Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.12 For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.13 Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.” (Ephesians 6:11-13 KJV)
results.name: MEMBERS ONLY CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA CONFERENCE CALL

Since finding a suitable location for these Meetups has proven so difficult in the past I'm launching an experiment with a virtual reading group which will be conducted entirely online via Google Hangouts.  It will be a video call and I'll be using my PC, but anyone with a smartphone can participate.  We will go through the entire book in bi-weekly sessions covering roughly 50 pages for each session.   

For anyone who RSVP's yes, please send me your email so I can send an invite for the Google Hangout when it is set up.   I'll also email it out to people who RSVP'ed "yes" on Meetup right before it starts.

The itinerary is as follows:

March 10th: One-Dimensional Society, Sections 1 & 2 (Pages 1-56)

March 24th: One-Dimensional Society, Sections 3 & 4 (Pages[masked])

April 7th: One-Dimensional Thought, Sections 5 & 6 (Pages[masked])

April 21st: One-Dimensional Thought, Section 7 & The Chance of the Alternatives, Section 8 (Pages[masked])

May 5th: The Chance of the Alternatives, Sections 9 & 10 (Pages[masked]) and concluding discussion
results.name: Virtual Reading Group: Marcuse's One-Dimensional Man

results.description:
Learn and build with the hard parts of JavaScript through intuitive lectures and pair-programming

This event will be held online as well at twitch.tv/codesmithio

In JavaScript the Hard Parts, we cover callbacks, higher-order functions (functional programming with JavaScript), object-oriented programming with JavaScript, closure, scope and execution context

This week we continue our mini-series: Javascript - The Hard Parts. We will cover closure, scope, and execution context - one of the toughest concepts in JavaScript

We'll cover concepts and approaches that 80% of JavaScript engineers do not understand but are at the core of every single successful application. This is possible because we'll understand the essence of these tough concepts and then switch into pair-programming through the challenges to cement the concepts.


The evening session is comprised of: 

9:30 - 10pm: Meet your future pair programming partner. 

10pm-10:30pm: Core JavaScript concept for the challenge and introduction to the secret hack for learning to code - pair-programming. 

10:30pm-11:30pm Pair-programming.

Bring a friend who'd like to build and you can pair program together.


Price: Always free
results.name: JavaScript the Hard Parts - Closure, Scope & Execution Context

If your new to the group what better excuse to try us out. We play 3v3 or 4v4 depending on numbers. (No keepers)

THE PITCH is NYC’s only soccer-specific indoor facility, located in the heart of Brooklyn’s Williamsburg neighborhood at North 14th and Berry St.

We have one field, which is slightly longer and wider than the standard NYC Parks basketball court and middle-school gym. Unlike most of these courts/gyms, our field has a walled (padded) perimeter, so the ball never goes out. Also, our flooring is a real field: the best professional-grade turf product on the market -- the same turf used by many professional teams in the Netherlands and recently by some MLS teams like Sporting Kansas.

results.description:
The regular 1st Thursday event has been preempted for a special tribute to Reggae legend Garnett Silk! More details will follow!

ABOUT GARNETT SILK

Garnet Damion Smith (April 2, 1966 – December 9, 1994), was a Jamaican reggae musician and Rastafarian, known for his diverse, emotive, powerful and smooth voice. During the early 1990s he was hailed as a rising talent, however his career was ended by his early death in 1994, while attempting to save his mother from her burning house. Even today still hailed as a reggae prodigy, Garnett is considered inspiring and a credit to reggae music."

results.description:
People ask me how I can speak seven languages all the time.

It's simple...

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!


Join me at Starbucks whenever you'd like to study hard, practise conversation, and share good energy.

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Whatever you're learning, good, daily study habits will make you fluent. 

Try it out!
results.name: Let's Get Fluent! Language Study at Starbucks

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we have the pleasure of having Laurel Touby come and share her journey.


Laurel Touby founded mediabistro.com, a website that revolutionized the way people in the media industry do business, connect and communicate. During her time as CEO, she pulled the company through two recessions, pivoted, managed growth with minimal resources and developed audience via guerrilla and social marketing (before that term existed). Users subscribe to mediabistro’s many services, which include online education,employment classifieds, conferences (offline), events (offline), forums, and industry-specific blogs, such as the popular TVNewser. Following the sale of the company for $23 mm to Jupitermedia, Laurel remained with the company through June, 2011.

Laurel began investing in seed-stage startups, including: AdYapper, Appboy, Apploi, Buddie, Clef, CreativeWorx, Fashion GPS, Learn Immersive and Pivit. She is an LP in Lowercase Ventures (with holdings in Twitter, Uber, etc.) and in Pershing Square, among others. Laurel is active as a public speaker and hosted “Secrets of Successful Startups“ on CBS Interactive. Past episodes of the show can be found here: http://bit.ly/CBSTouby Currently, she host the Series A Podcast. https://podfanatic.com/podcast/series-a-podcast

.An inveterate connector, Laurel touches the entrepreneurial community in various ways, including via her monthly co-hosted Cereal Entrepreneurs breakfast, Flatiron Angel meetings and Startup Digital Dinners. She lives in a loft in Silicon Alley and is married to Inc. Magazine Executive Editor Jon Fine.

We'll get a chance to hear about her journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you then!

On Wednesday May 4th the Africa Open Data Community(AODC) will host a one-day event in Cape Town, South Africa, at the edge of the regional Open Government Partnership Summit hosted by the Government of South Africa. As committed community members and experts in this field we hope you will join us in helping develop and shape this one-day event as a continued effort from AODC to expand awareness of the benefits of open data for Africa and increase participation and new partnerships across multiple sectors and disciplines. Please see the current working draft of the agenda here: http://bit.ly/SA_AODC_1Pager The target themes for this event are how open data can help achieve the SDGs and ensuring the private sector knows the value and leadership potential in open data for Africa. As ever we welcome any comments, criticisms, or concerns and look forward to adding new names and faces to the community as presenters and participants.

As discussed at the last monthly call this advisory call will occur each Friday 3:30pm SAST until the conference. These are open calls, feel free to invite others to participate. Notes will be taken and shared at http://bit.ly/AODC_CapeTownMay4_Feedback

results.description:
Field Trip:  Conference House and Park, Tottenville, Staten Island                    Friday, April 8, 11 AM (Opening - first day of season)

The Conference House  is located at the southern most tip of Staten Island  

and is named in honor and commemoration of the famous peace conference of 1776.  On September 11, 1776, Continental Congress representatives John Adams, Edward Rutledge, and Benjamin Franklin met with the King’s representative, Lord Richard Howe, at Colonel Christopher Billopp’s home.  The British would not consider independence a negotiable term and the congressional representatives had been authorized only to negotiate terms that included independence.  No reconciliation was reached.  With the failed peace conference, both the Crown and the colonists faced the inevitability of war.

The Conference House (formerly known at the Billopp House) is a two-story, rubble stone masonry building constructed circa 1680 by Captain Christopher Billopp.  Originally a rectangle in plan, with two rooms and a center hall on each level, the house was extended in the 18th century with the addition of a one-and-a-half story kitchen wing.  The wing was constructed of rubble stone and clapboard.  The steep gable roof is distinguished by brick gable ends and parapets.

We will also explore the park area, Tottenville with its Victorian architecture and across Arthur Kill is Perth Amboy, NJ.   For more info, see: http://conferencehouse.org/

Take the #1 Train to South Ferry or R Train to Whitehall, South Ferry Station.

Meet in the upstairs waiting area of the Staten Island Ferry (on the Manhattan side), at 11 AM.  At St George, we'll then take the Staten Island Railway (Subway) to the park which should take approx 45 minutes. 

At 3 PM, we'll grab a bite to eat at a local restaurant (optional and dutch).

RSVP at right!  There is no charge for this event except carfare and any meals/beverages!

Register/details here: http://earth.columbia.edu/events/view/82462

The Sustainability Management Student Association (SUMASA) presents their 5th Annual Sustainable Perspective Symposium, Driving Sustainability: Whos Responsible?

Limited resources, rapid urbanization and social accountability are a few of the many challenges facing the private and public sectors. Driving Sustainability will ignite enthusiasm and accelerate solutions to societys most pressing environmental concerns.

Join us as industry leaders illustrate how sustainability is integrated into our society and how associated challenges are addressed through a combination of ideas, best practices and strategic planning. Our expert panels and featured presentations will provide a dynamic venue for exploring sustainability opportunities and showcase innovative initiatives, to achieve environmental objectives within our communities using multidisciplinary approaches.

Open to the public.

RSVP required. Doors open 11:00. Presentations 11:30-3:00. Reception to follow.

Opening Remarks: Steven Cohen, The Executive Director, The Earth Institute, Columbia University; Speakers: Ralph Bianculli Jr., Managing Director, Emerald Brand; Marisa Buchanan, Executive Director, Sustainable Finance, JPMorgan Chase & Company; Steve Clemons, Editor-at-Large, The Atlantic, Editor-in-Chief, AtlanticLIVE; Collette Ericsson, Chief Sustainability Officer & Enterprise Asset Management Lead, New York Metropolitan Transportation Bus Operations; Allen Hershkowitz, President, Green Sports Alliance; Matthew Ketschke, Vice President of Distributed Resource Integration, Con Edison Company of New York; Ellen Kondracki, Senior Director, Global Sustainability, Becton, Dickinson and Company; Nilda Mesa, Director, NYC Mayors Office of Sustainability; Sharyn OHalloran, Senior Vice Dean & Chief Academic Officer, Columbia Universitys School of Professional Studies; Celine Ruben-Salama, Corporate Sustainability Consultant, CBRE; Peter Smith, Vice President of Delos Solutions, Delos Living; Miguel Sossa, Co-lead Smart Cities NA, Accenture; Amanda Stevens, Manager, Env. Research Program, NYSERDA; Brian E. Wennersten, Director, Project Management & Design, Global Real Estate NBCUniversal Media, LLC

You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:

http://register.communitypass.net/Englewood

You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of." After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Register" button, then the yellow "Continue" button under "2016 Winter Programs, and follow the prompts. To register, you will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) You will be able to pay the $40 fee online, as well. If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at[masked] or email [masked].  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL 10!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class:  Getting Started

Synopsis:  This first class is the most basic.  It introduces the essentials of working in a classroom.  Learning these help both your child and the group cooperate and succeed.  This class begins to teach the children how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.

Activities:  Pegged Puzzles, Chunky Beads, other Transitional Materials (which are self-explanatory exercises any child can do before learning specific Montessori materials) such as play dough, stamping, a pegboard, Mega Blocks

Adult Learning:  Adults will be made privy to Montessori rationale such as why we use a work mat, why particular apparatus is chosen, how the classroom set-up promotes learning, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After the first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a melon baller, pouring

Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing

Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eyedropper, clothespins
results.name: Fun Fingers - PM Last Class

 The demo will be followed by a graduation celebration.  Mingle with students, entrepreneurs, the Byte Academy team, founders and business leaders to kick off your weekend.

About Byte Academy : Byte Academy offers intensive full and part-time courses that emphasize full-stack programming using Python and industry-oriented programs such as FinTech (financial technology), Data Sciences and MedTech.  Byte Academy is the first coding bootcamp in the world to offer a Financial Technology (FinTech) program and the first in New York City to teach full stack Python. Small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events are included in the program.  Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and women receive $2,000 scholarships. Byte Academy accepts applications on a rolling basis for all courses.

results.description:
Greetings everyone, In this Free Meetup we will focus on 
Speedlight Photography & Adobe Lightroom:

Students will learn how to use Speedlight's in manual and TTL mode Best uses
of flash on and off camera Basics of photography students learn the
mechanics of quickly achieving reliable and consistent exposures. To achieve
this, the wonderful tools available in digital cameras will be explained and
demonstrated: Histograms, various metering patterns. 
. Exposure compensation, depth-of-field, and bracketing. 
. Will learn to measure lights with a light meter 
. Change background color from white to gray to black.
. Lens types and filters. 
. The proper use of light modifiers, color gels, reflectors & grids. 
. Balancing ambient light with Speedlight's to capture the mood of the
environment. 
. Multi-light setup for in studio portraits. We will take our camera
and speedlight in the studio balancing light and capturing images 
. Finally all the images captured in class will be imported, cataloged
and edited in Adobe Lightroom. 

In Lightroom students will learn how to: 
. Import images into Lightroom & Tether capture of images from the
speedlight session 
. Add metadata and copyright information to images 
. Perform color correction on images 
. Images selection process, cropping, and filter effects in Lightroom 
. Image clean up (Spot removal, cropping, lens distortion, noise
reduction and saving for print and web)
results.name: Speedlight Photography & Adobe Lightroom

results.description:
RECEPTION: April 8th , 6-9PM Six Summit Gallery in Ivoryton. The gallery is currently featuring the artwork of William Kent. I thought the reception would be a fun follow up after the tour. 

www.sixsummitgallery.com


In this tempestuous election year and explosive political season we offer a journey back into the sixties with world renowned printmaker, sculptor, and satirist- William Kent.


Psychedelic chameleons, alluring insects and bold political prints take us back to a time when things were..... pretty much the same!


We ask you to “End Your Silence” “Abolish HUAC” and “Take It Easy but Take It” in this second installment of our retrospective on the elusive Connecticut artist. The hand made prints were created by carving huge Italian slate blackboards, and reproducing on fabric and rice paper- without a printing press.


Five of Kent’s monumental wooden sculptures are also on display with content that reflects everyday items such as a hammer, shoe, key, shoehorn, and a crushed beer can. The rich illustrious hand carvings complement 32 prints in the second in a series of shows at New England’s diverse Six Summit Gallery


Kent, who many consider one of America’s greatest printmakers and sculptors, lived as a recluse. His work was included alongside such titans as Jasper Johns, Robert Motherwell, and Phillip Guston. He attended Yale University, was the first curator of the John Slade Ely House, and exhibited at some the


finest museums and galleries including-


The Wadsworth Atheneum, Sundsvall Sweden, Colgate, Brooklyn Museum,


Whitney Museum of American Art, 


New Britain Museum of American Art and more. His work is in the collections of Smithsonian, Brooklyn Museum, Princeton University,


New Britain Museum of American Art, Lyman Allen Art Museum, Yale University Art Gallery, Florence Griswold and many more.


Private viewings and receptions available. Hours subject
results.name: Reception at Six Summit Gallery

results.description:
There is no charge for participating in this retreat. Donations are welcome, and will be used to sustain the teachers of this event, as well as fund more free classes and retreats led by Buddhist monks and nuns.

PROGRAM:
As the calm of winter gives way to the energetic vivacity of spring and the frantic heat of summer, it's time to establish a solid foundation for our mind, to keep it grounded in the midst of accelerating activity. Devoting an extended length of time to developing tranquility and mindful awareness is an excellent way to stabilize the mind by means of careful attention to our bodies. This weekend retreat offers us the opportunity to do just that, with several periods of sitting meditation, walking meditation, and yoga, all intended to aid us in reestablishing a firm connection with our physical experience. The main teacher for the event is Bhante Suddhāso, a local Buddhist monk, who will guide us in the process of taming our restless minds and regaining a sense of presence and attentive serenity.

INFO:
Vegetarian meals will be served using organic ingredients and featuring desserts made locally by The Paleo Factory. You are welcome to eat at the Retreat House or arrange for your own meals.

Participants may attend as much or as little of the schedule as they wish. If you wish to stay overnight, you can purchase tickets on buddhistinsights.eventbrite.com to stay at the Rockaway Retreat House (see info on rooms below) or arrange for your own accommodation in the area. 

ACCOMMODATION AVAILABLE AT THE ROCKAWAY RETREAT HOUSE:
- 8 Bunk Beds

For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project.

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details.

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!

results.description:
I am really pleased to have Alp Kucukelbir for our upcoming speaker. He is a post-doc research scientist with David Blei's lab at Columbia.

Abstract: Machine learning is changing the way we analyze data. We want to study large datasets to shed light on complicated processes. (How do proteins function? How do people navigate a city?) To this end, we need tools to rapidly and iteratively explore hidden patterns in data. However, using machine learning to discover such patterns requires enormous effort and cross-disciplinary expertise.


In this talk, Alp will present strategies to automate tedious machine learning computations. He will show how we can design one algorithm to work for many problems and gain new insights from large datasets.

Bio: Alp is a postdoctoral research scientist at the Data Science Institute and the
department of Computer Science at Columbia University. He works with David Blei on developing scalable and robust machine learning tools. He collaborates
with Andrew Gelman on the Stan probabilistic programming system. 

Alp received his Ph.D. from Yale University in Engineering and Applied Science. He was awarded the Becton prize for best thesis in engineering and applied science. He holds a B.A.Sc. from the University of Toronto in Electrical Engineering.


Here's a link to his papers and software contributions: http://www.proditus.com.  

Here's a link to Stan:  http://mc-stan.org. 

The wiki page on: probabilistic programming here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Probabilistic_programming_language.
results.name: Can One Algorithm Rule Them All? How to Automate Machine Learning Computations?

venue.name: Center for Social Innovation New York City

results.description:
*Register for this event on Eventbrite! http://collabhack.eventbrite.com/?aff=mu*

Have an app idea that will improve collaboration?
Join us for a Mobile App & IoT Hackathon focused on finding innovative solutions to help bring people together and be more collaborative.
A key ingredient in the recipe for innovation is collaboration. Whether it's in a shared workspace or a vast network of connections, innovation requires community. At a place like the Centre for Social Innovation, shared space forms the bedrock of our model. Being physically together is what sets the conditions for new relationships, new projects, and unexpected outcomes. But sometimes that's not enough. Being in the same space does not automatically spark connection and collaboration.
When the community of innovators is diverse and vast, how can they optimize their ability to learn about each other, work together, and ultimately, make impact and effect change? How can technology foster an even deeper level of community between a network of innovators and changemakers?
Hackathons are coding competitions, where individuals and teams build mobile apps from scratch over a 24 hour period. The apps are then pitched to judges and prizes award for the best apps. Hackathons are a great opportunity to learn new technologies, network with fellow developers, enjoy some food, most importantly have some fun!

Your Mission...
To hack collaboration to transform the ways groups connect in a shared space, ultimately increasing productive and collective collaboration.

You Bring...
Your laptop, skills & ideas. Come with a collaborative, team focused mindset and/or team up in advance on Twitter/Facebook/Google+ via the #atthack hashtag. Whether you are a backend person, designer, entrepreneur, student, or just interested in tech; you are invited to attend this event. Every group needs a good balance of talent and your development skills are needed!

We Supply...
Quick presentations and code samples that help to bootstrap your hacking, food to keep you going, and caffeine to keep you awake. We will have technical senseis to assist you in building faster, smarter, and with new tools. We will also have loaner hardware on-site for you to use in your solutions.

• Arduino Boards: Sunfounder Super Kit with Uno R3 for Arduino (Documentation)

• RobotLinking 37 Sensor Kit

• Intel Edison (Documentation) + Grove - Starter Kit Plus Intel IoT Edition

• CanaKit Raspberry Pi 2 Complete Starter Kit (Monitor and keyboard not included)

• Raspberry Pi 2, Model B 1GB, Documentation (Monitor and keyboard not included)

• Photon Board Maker Kit (Documentation) 

Event Schedule
The following is a list of the weekend's agenda:
Day 1

• 6PM - Kickoff event with dinner, networking and developer dating

• 7PM - Speakers present

• 8PM - Pitch ideas and form teams

• 12AM - The venue will close for the evening. You may continue hacking overnight offsite or get some sleep.

Day 2

• 10:00AM - The fun continues with coffee served in the morning! Work with the teams from Day 1 to complete the app spec'd. Mentors will be available throughout the entire day to help you code your solution. App submissions will be accepted throughout the day with a deadline of 4PM.

• 12:00PM - Lunch is served

• 4PM - Submit your app!

• 5PM - Dinner is served

• 6PM - Pencils down. Pitches start promptly at 6PM and are limited to three (3) minutes per team. PowerPoint presentations are NOT recommended!

Prizes

• Best Hackathon Overall App or IoT Solution: $1000 in Amazon gift cards for the team

• ...More to come...

Judging Criteria

Apps will be judged based on the criteria below and weighted accordingly.

• 33% Weight - Ability to clearly articulate what your app does

• 33% Weight - Originality of idea

• 33% Weight - Technically creative and/or challenging implementation

Hackathon Legal
Hackathon terms: http://db.tt/kyPS9ojR

Social Media
Follow us, @attdeveloper, for live updates and photos from the event
"Like" us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/ATTDeveloper
results.name: AT&T Mobile App & IoT Hackathon @ CSI NYC

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

The card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.

results.description:
Start Planning Your April Vacation Now! Experience all the natural wonders of Iceland — glaciers, volcanoes, waterfalls, geothermal hot springs, and more. Visitors who come to Iceland in spring get the best of both worlds – There are lower prices than the Summer and fewer crowds but the weather is pleasant. As Requested, Since February Icelandic Adventure is Sold out Springtime in Iceland is Coming! Iceland is one of those rare places on Earth that feels more science-fiction than fact, even when you’re actually there. Gushing geysers, bubbling hot springs, mammoth volcanoes, and acres of polar ice lend this laidback island nation a palpable otherworldly allure Iceland offers plenty to do in Spring, April can be can be wonderful times to visit, before the Summer Crowds arrive in June. https://player.vimeo.com/video/150341865" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen>

Embracing the Amazing Natural Beauty of the County

Temperatures The month of April is characterized by Rising daily high temperatures, with daily highs increasing from 40°F to 45°F over the course of the month, exceeding 51°F and dropping Below 33°F only one day in ten.

Over the course of April, the length of the day is very rapidly increasing. The average sunrise in April is 5:37am, with sunset around 8:38pm. 15 hours of daylight- April visitors will find that nearly all of the summer outdoor activities are available to them, including horseback riding, glacier-walking, caving, and even snorkeling. Bring a warm jacket, some sturdy boots, a hat, scarf and gloves, and you’ll find the weather not much different from early spring in the northern US. 

What Included?

Following Tours Included on this Trip: 

1. Exploring the Golden Circle(the Golden Circle is the name given to the tourist track that starts from Reykjavik and ventures to National Park, Geysirs and erupting ever 4-8 minutes.! Then to Gullfoss, a massive waterfall that spans a huge river. Along and just off the route you’ll find sprawling lava fields, sparkling lakes, black sand beaches, rushing rivers and cascading waterfalls, plus fields full of Icelandic horses 

2. The Blue Lagoon is Iceland’s most famous attraction. A pool of super heated neon blue water. Visit Iceland's famous Blue Lagoon on this full-day trip from Reykjavik. Relax in the warm waters of this natural geothermal pool.

http://www.bluelagoon.com/ 

3. The south coast and Jökulsárlón glacier lagoon- takes you along the entire south coast of Iceland, through picturesque fishing villages all the way to the breathtakingly beautiful Jökulsárlón glacier lagoon. On the way, you'll pass Iceland's largest glacier, Vatnajökull, as well as the beautiful Seljalandsfoss and Skógafoss waterfalls where you can stop to walk around one and to the top of the other.

 4. Reykjavik Food Tour offers exclusive food samples in the best restaurants and gourmet stores in Reykjavík. Reykjavik has become a melting pot of great restaurants and gourmet stores. What makes them unique is their foundation – the pure Icelandic ingredients.We will take you to „fresh from the farm“ stores, Nordic kitchen restaurants along with multicultural ones. While we taste delicious samples we hear the stories behind the ingredients and the cooking. http://reykjavikfoodtour.com/

Hotel Accommodations

Rt Air on ICELANDIC AIR from Newark Airport

All Tours w our Own Private Expert Guide & Vehicle Price: 

We are going to Create Lifetime Memories Robert Questions?

 Please email: [masked]

OR Call my Cell[masked]

Love art? Hate art? Just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because you're sure to have fun with our MOMA Scavenger Hunt. 

There is no better way to go see this  artwork than with dozens of new friends!  You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, have picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at Old Castle Pub for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle Pub for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

We had a great time at their other location which is sadly becoming condos.  So lets try this location.  I have been here before and it's a lot of fun.  We meet and greet for an hour to eat and drink (that is how to easily find us - at the table with the yellow balloon), then go where the fun is.   They offer bowling, nightlife, billiards, and arcade games.

We accept a $5 suggested donation, but no one is turned away. 

Come and have some fun with some amazing people, while building your network too!

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice.

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001

results.description:
With director Parvez Sharma in person.

2015, 79 mins. Digital projeciton. For a gay filmmaker, making a movie in Saudi Arabia presents two serious challenges: filming is forbidden in the country, and homosexuality is punishable by death. For filmmaker Parvez Sharma, however, these were risks he had to assume as he embarked on his Hajj pilgrimage, a journey considered the greatest accomplishment and aspiration within Islam, his religion. Sharma brings back the story of the religion like it has never been told before, having endured the biggest jihad there is: the struggle with the self. 

Tickets: $12 (Free for members at the Film Lover and MoMI Kids Premium levels and above).  Order tickets online. (Members may contact [masked] with any questions regarding online reservations.) 

Ticket purchase may be applied toward same-day admission to the Museum (see gallery hours). View the Museum’s ticketing policy here. For more information on membership and to join online, visit our membership page. 


Screening room typically opens at 6:30.  The film begins at 7:30.  After the film we can get a bite to eat nearby if anyone is interested.


Be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates to this event.

Originally posted 3/7/16

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Scene / Fun Stuff to do in NYC

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. 

When: Fridays 6:30pm-7:30pm.  Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbies

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)
results.name: Meditate, Rest & Recharge

You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!


We get it... You want to meet someone special but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of recent college grads or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!

Drink Specials!

Win Prizes!

Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)

* Over 200 Single Professionals Attending

* Suggested Age Range: Late 30's to 50's
results.name: 40's & 50's Singles Spring Fling

results.description:
Get your tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/40-over-spring-singles-mixer-in-nyc-tickets-24273732387

40 & Over Spring Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!

Wow - Spring is finally here! Come on out and start spring off right at our 40 & Over Singles Mixer! We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES. 

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
Get your tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/40-over-spring-singles-mixer-in-nyc-tickets-24273732387

When: Friday April 8th, 2016: 6:30 - 10:30 PM (For those traveling in from a distance... it's perfectly fine if you arrive at 7:00 or later)
Where: Pranna Lounge - 79 Madison Avenue (at 27th St), New York, NY

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 40s & 50s Plus Welcome To Attend
* Amazing Drink Specials From 6:30 to 7:30!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)
* We're Raffling Off 5 Great Prizes!

One of the great things about our Meetup events is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.


TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
Get your tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/40-over-spring-singles-mixer-in-nyc-tickets-24273732387
results.name: 40 & Over Spring Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!

results.description:
This is intended for our 40s & Over Singles members. 

We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 & 30 somethings. That's why we've created this private Meetup event filled with more mature singles (40s, 50s+)! 

This is a multi-Meetup group event. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion attending. Based on pre-sales and other RSVPs, we'll have 75+ members attending.  

*GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/40sover/dates/Apr-08-2016_at_0630PM

*Prepay Only Event. Tickets Not Sold At Door. 

What to expect:   

• Free Light Appetizers (7-8pm) 

• Drink Specials (6:30-7:30pm)

• Up to 100 singles in their 40s, 50s+  

• Ice Breakers, Raffle & Prizes 

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

*MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE ($20) - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/40sover/dates/Apr-08-2016_at_0630PM

*Price goes up to $30 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. 

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot, especially women. 

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. UP TO 100 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

PREPAY ONLY - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/40sover/dates/Apr-08-2016_at_0630PM

results.description: HRU Yuya T. Assaan-ANU prepares you for your own spiritual shift. This show delves into the dark aspects of life altering wisdom and the illumination of soul enlightenment via occult studies, holistic health information, self-hypnosis and mental deprogramming, and cultural education. For a free psychic reading send in your question via the Sadulu House website or call into “The Enlightenment and Transformation” broadcast Friday’s at 6:30pm and HRU will provide you with a reading on the spot! Go to Blogtalkradio.com/Enlightenmentandtransformation at 6:30pm.

results.name: Join us on our Blogtalk Radio Broadcast "Enlightenment and Transformation"

results.description:
Join us this April with fabulous caller Alexandra Deis-Lauby and the awesome band The Gaslight Tinkers!


Contra dancing is a great way to have fun, meet new people, burn a few calories and let loose all the stress of the week!

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm, and the dance will begin at 7pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance!  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Join us after the dance for socializing at a nearby diner.


For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/
results.name: Let's meetup and contra dance!

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。请在入场时交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间4月8日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开两桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
A reading of the Book of the Law: Chapter 1
with Live Music

Liber AL vel Legis is the central sacred text of Thelema, delivered to Aleister Crowley in Cairo, Egypt by the spirit Aiwass, his Holy Guardian Angel, in the year 1904. Its full title is Liber AL vel Legis, sub figura CCXX, as delivered by XCIII=418 to DCLXVI, and it is commonly referred to as The Book of the Law.

Liber AL vel Legis contains three chapters, each of which was written down in one hour, beginning at noon, on 8 April, 9 April, and 10 April. We will commemorate the writing of the first chapter this evening.

6:30 pm doors open for socializing.

7:00 pm reading and music starts.

Bring food & drink to share - suggested to please Nuit:

“rich foods and …sweet wines and wines that foam!”, and vegetarian foods: “there is no blood therein”

$8.00 donation for rent.

results.description:
Start Planning Your April Vacation Now! 

Experience all the natural wonders of Iceland — glaciers, volcanoes, waterfalls, geothermal hot springs, and more.

Visitors who come to Iceland in spring get the best of both worlds – There are lower prices than the Summer and fewer crowds but the weather is pleasant.

As Requested, Since February Icelandic Adventure is Sold out


Springtime in Iceland is Coming! 


Iceland is one of those rare places on Earth that feels more science-fiction than fact, even when you’re actually there. Gushing geysers, bubbling hot springs, mammoth volcanoes, and acres of polar ice lend this laidback island nation a palpable otherworldly allure

Iceland offers plenty to do in Spring, April can be can be wonderful times to visit, before the Summer Crowds arrive June.

https://player.vimeo.com/video/150341865" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen>


This Guy just filmed his latest Music Video in Iceland:

Embracing the Amazing  Natural Beauty of the County

https://youtu.be/PfGaX8G0f2E


Temperatures

The month of April is characterized by Rising daily high temperatures, with daily highs increasing from 40°F to 45°F over the course of the month, exceeding 51°F  and dropping Below 33°F only one day in ten.

Sun

Over the course of April, the length of the day is very rapidly increasing. 

The average sunrise in April is 5:37am, with sunset around 8:38pm.


15 hours of daylight- 

https://youtu.be/_vcXol3ME2k

April visitors will find that nearly all of the summer outdoor activities are available to them, including horseback riding, glacier-walking, caving, and even snorkeling. Bring a warm jacket, some sturdy boots, a hat, scarf and gloves, and you’ll find the weather not much different from early spring in the northern US. The First Day of Summer (sumardagurinn fyrsti) is held on the first Thursday after April 18. Icelanders previously used the Old Norse calendar which divided the year into only two seasons, winter and summer, with summer beginning in April.

https://youtu.be/wdI_ZYqwuzo

What Included?

Following Tours Included on this Trip:  

1. Exploring the Golden Circle(the Golden Circle is the name given to the tourist track that starts from Reykjavik and ventures to  National Park, Geysirs and erupting ever 4-8 minutes.!  Then  to Gullfoss, a massive waterfall that spans a huge river. Along and just off the route you’ll find sprawling lava fields, sparkling lakes, black sand beaches, rushing rivers and cascading waterfalls, plus fields full of Icelandic horses 

2. The Blue Lagoon is Iceland’s most famous attraction. A pool of super heated neon blue water. Visit Iceland's famous Blue Lagoon on this full-day trip from Reykjavik. Relax in the warm waters of this natural geothermal pool.

http://www.bluelagoon.com/ 


3. The south coast and Jökulsárlón glacier lagoon- takes you along the entire south coast of Iceland, through picturesque fishing villages all the way to the breathtakingly beautiful Jökulsárlón glacier lagoon. On the way, you'll pass Iceland's largest glacier, Vatnajökull, as well as the beautiful Seljalandsfoss and Skógafoss waterfalls where you can stop to walk around one and to the top of the other.


4. Reykjavik Food Tour offers exclusive food samples in the best restaurants and gourmet stores in Reykjavík. Reykjavik has become a melting pot of great restaurants and gourmet stores.  What makes them unique is their foundation – the pure Icelandic ingredients.We will take you to „fresh from the farm“ stores, Nordic kitchen restaurants along with multicultural ones.  While we taste delicious samples we hear the stories  behind the ingredients and the cooking. http://reykjavikfoodtour.com/

Hotel Accommodations

Rt Air on ICELANDIC AIR from Newark Airport

and MORE! 

All Tours w our Own Private Expert Guide & Vehicle


Price: TBA -Emailed this Week

We are going to Create Lifetime Memories 

Robert 

Questions?  Please email: 

I do not see all the writing on the wall. 

[masked]

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
CDI President, Allison Davis to Perform a Short Monologue, 

Friday April 8th. 6:45-7:45 pm

SAGE Center, 305 Seventh Avenue (Between 27 & 28) 15th Floor, New York, NY 10001

Over the past eight weeks, Allison has been part of a multigenerational theater project for Transgender people (I am the oldest one!). It is spearheaded by three graduate students at CUNY’s School of Professional Studies. Their final work, Trans Generations, is an original one hour show created and performed by the 20 participants in the Theater Project. 

As part of that show, she researched, wrote and will perform an intensely personal monologue on transgender suicide titled WHY?. It concludes with an interpretive dance duet with Kai,  a talented 19 YO dancer from Brooklyn.

There is no cost. but please RSVP through Meetup by Wed, April 6th. or email me.

<a href="https://support.google.com/mail/answer/180707?hl=en"></a>

results.description:
Tonight's theme is holiness and sinfulness! In that order, I'd never let you guys go home holy.

8 PM - Bibleman. Two episodes of the show that teaches religious fundamentalist kids how to bring the word of the Lord into our godless society by ripping off Star Trek, Star Wars, and Batman and throwing in lots of bible quotes. It isn't the single most painfully earnest thing I've ever seen, but that's only because I've seen educational videos from the 50s.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5PN_85ZQJlc

10 PM - Tokyo Tribe. It's your typical Japanese rap opera. Gang wars in an alternate universe post-apocalyptic Tokyo overrun by prostitution and, well, gangs. A little bit over the top, but you're going to need to refill your brain with corrupting thoughts after it's been cleansed and bleached by Bibleman.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m1R7nOBg7T0

Please arrive between 7 and 8. Drinks and snacks appreciated!
results.name: Bibleman + Tokyo Tribe

results.description:
Awww yeah, Whisky group don't you dare be sour, clap, for your next meet up is here and feel the power. After a busy and dry month of March which is way too long to have a meet up, I figured that we should have a meet up in April and drink twice as much. For this meetup we will be going to two different locations.

Place number 1: Beer Authority. This bar is located in the busy section of Midtown Manhattan right next to port authority, I wonder if that has something to do with the name? This bar boasts an impressive 73 beer tap list, as well as 87 bottles! They also have a few ciders for those who can't really drink beer. Now you can't beat that. http://www.beerauthoritynyc.com/home


Place number 2: District Tap house. This holds a special place in my heart, as this was the first place I held my meet up. This bar is also located in Midtown Manhattan. They boast 50 beers on tap, and 72 bottles! In that list also contains a few ciders. This place also makes a real good cocktail and one of the best burgers, don't believe me ask the shift leader about it. http://www.districttaphouse.com/


Both places are about a 5 minute walk from each other, which makes it easy for the group to walk or stumble to the next location. Pending after hours there's a third secret spot that we can go to, just don't tell nobody.

As this is a Friday Night meet up in Midtown Manhattan, I can't control the crowd or space issues in the bars. As I have seen with this group we always make do of what we have.

Come one, come all. If this is your first meet up we are happy to meet you. If you are returning member or legacy member it's good to see you again. All are welcome to join us

results.description:
The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event... 

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ... 

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake (weather permittig) and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.
results.how_to_find_us: www.nyshamaniccircle.org
results.name: Shamanic Open Circle and celebration of Spirit

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Ethics and the Theater will present a play reading of The Call, by Tanya Barfield.

Adopting a baby from Africa seems so right to Anna and Peter, a socially conscious couple who have tried painfully and unsuccessfully to conceive on their own. But the glow of prospective parenthood dims and good-humored teasing becomes barbed as the couple confronts the complex realities of raising a child from another race and culture.

Come at 6:30 pm for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar.

results.description:
The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event...


Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ...

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake (weather permittig) and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
