results.description:
ICELANDIC SPRING APRIL NORTHERN LIGHTS ADVENTURE-

Start Planning Your April Vacation Now! Experience all the natural wonders of Iceland — glaciers, volcanoes, waterfalls, geothermal hot springs, and more. Visitors who come to Iceland in spring get the best of both worlds – There are lower prices than the Summer and fewer crowds but the weather is pleasant. As Requested, 

Springtime in Iceland is Coming! Iceland is one of those rare places on Earth that feels more science-fiction than fact, even when you’re actually there. Gushing geysers, bubbling hot springs, mammoth volcanoes, and acres of polar ice lend this laidback island nation a palpable otherworldly allure Iceland offers plenty to do in Spring, 

April can be can be wonderful times to visit, before the Summer Crowds arrive June. https://player.vimeo.com/video/150341865" width="500" height="281" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen>

Embracing the Amazing Natural Beauty of the County

Temperatures The month of April is characterized by Rising daily high temperatures, with daily highs increasing from 40°F to 45°F over the course of the month, exceeding 51°F and dropping Below 33°F only one day in ten.

Over the course of April, the length of the day is very rapidly increasing. The average sunrise in April is 5:37am, with sunset around 8:38pm. 15 hours of daylight- April visitors will find that nearly all of the summer outdoor activities are available to them, including horseback riding, glacier-walking, caving, and even snorkeling. Bring a warm jacket, some sturdy boots, a hat, scarf and gloves, and you’ll find the weather not much different from early spring in the northern US. The First Day of Summer (sumardagurinn fyrsti) is held on the first Thursday after April 18. Icelanders previously used the Old Norse calendar which divided the year into only two seasons, winter and summer, with summer beginning in April. What Included?

Following Tours Included on this Trip: 1. Exploring the Golden Circle(the Golden Circle is the name given to the tourist track that starts from Reykjavik and ventures to National Park, Geysirs and erupting ever 4-8 minutes.! Then to Gullfoss, a massive waterfall that spans a huge river. Along and just off the route you’ll find sprawling lava fields, sparkling lakes, black sand beaches, rushing rivers and cascading waterfalls, plus fields full of Icelandic horses 2. The Blue Lagoon is Iceland’s most famous attraction. A pool of super heated neon blue water. Visit Iceland's famous Blue Lagoon on this full-day trip from Reykjavik. Relax in the warm waters of this natural geothermal pool.

http://www.bluelagoon.com/ 3. The south coast and Jökulsárlón glacier lagoon- takes you along the entire south coast of Iceland, through picturesque fishing villages all the way to the breathtakingly beautiful Jökulsárlón glacier lagoon. On the way, you'll pass Iceland's largest glacier, Vatnajökull, as well as the beautiful Seljalandsfoss and Skógafoss waterfalls where you can stop to walk around one and to the top of the other. 4. Reykjavik Food Tour offers exclusive food samples in the best restaurants and gourmet stores in Reykjavík. Reykjavik has become a melting pot of great restaurants and gourmet stores. What makes them unique is their foundation – the pure Icelandic ingredients.We will take you to „fresh from the farm“ stores, Nordic kitchen restaurants along with multicultural ones. While we taste delicious samples we hear the stories behind the ingredients and the cooking. http://reykjavikfoodtour.com/

Hotel Accommodations

Rt Air on ICELANDIC AIR from Newark Airport

and MORE! 

All Tours w our Own Private Expert Guide & Vehicle Price: 


Here is a Tentative Brief Itinerary and whats included:
> Round Trip Airfare on Icelandic Airways Departing Newark
> Rt Airport Transfers to Hilton
> 5 nights @ Hotel in Reykjavik
> 5 Breakfasts 
> Reykjavik Food Walking tour
> Blue Lagoon Tour and Admission
> Private Guided Tour " Golden Circle"
> Private Guided Tour "Southern Coast"
> Private Guided Tour "Northern Lights All Taxes and Tips for Guides Drivers:


We are going to Create Lifetime Memories 

QUESTIONS ? [masked]

Thanks Robert

results.description:
Join a bunch of singles from multiple Meetup groups as we casually stroll along a 1.5-mile stretch of waterfront in Hoboken. Afterwards we'll make our way to Benny Tudino's Pizzeria for a super yummy slice like you've never had before! It's soooo good. Trust me. After we all have garlic breath, we'll get a few drinks somewhere close. 

Check out the pics from the last time we did this. We had an amazing time! My walks always bring out the most beautiful people! 

We will meet at 7 PM in front of Caffebene located at 79 Hudson Street, Hoboken, NJ 07030. The walk will start at exactly 7:30 PM so do not be late or you will miss us. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of Caffebene and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend/non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. Every 10 minutes or so I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken to yet so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter

Our first meeting on March 4th was great ! including me, 10 people showed up from 4-6 different meetup groups. they all expressed enthusiasm and thanked me for a great night of discussion.


I set up a table top projection screen, a projector and small computer speakers and we watched short youtube videos about subjects that people wanted to know more of. one of our members ( Tom ) was there to explain direct questions and he did a wonderful job.

we watched videos and talked about the northern lights, gravity waves, atomic particles and several other subjects I do not remember ( I did not take notes nor atendence)
most of the people arrived on time, 7pm +/- 20 minutes and most of the people left at about 9pm though a few  stayed till closing time 10pm

as I said, this meeting will be on the second Friday of each month.

it is open to all questions of science.
I was watching science lectures on youtube in the past few weeks and it encouraged me to find some simple harmless experiments we can do there at Penara's to show the mysteries of quantum physics ( with NO MATH !!!!! )

hope to see YOU there.

results.description:
Public Talk and Weekend Teachings with Professor Jan Willis 

Friday, April 8 from 7 to 9pm 

Saturday & Sunday, April 9-10 from 10am to 5pm 

at Tibet House

Register

"Every individual has a responsibility to help guide our global family in the right direction. Good wishes are not sufficient; we must become actively engaged." 


- His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama 

Public Talk: 

Friday, April 8 from 7 to 9pm 

Today's media stories reflect major divisions of race, class, faith, and gender in the United States. Amid concerns about institutionalized racism, the gap between the rich and poor, religious intolerance, and gender inequality, people are angry and confused.

Around 2500 years ago, the Buddha was considered a social revolutionary, questioning the rigid caste system that fixed people's roles in society. Could the Buddha's message offer any solutions today with respect to social injustice?How does individual spiritual development contribute to society and the greater good? How is it possible to cultivate love and compassion in reaction to hatred and anger?

Professor Jan Willis shares her perspectives while recounting her own journey. Growing up in segregated Alabama, she endured a burning cross on her family's lawn and police dogs during the Birmingham Campaign led by Martin Luther King Jr. She considered joining the Black Panthers but instead chose a Buddhist path, where she met Lama Thubten Yeshe and followed the way of meditation, unconditional love, and higher education, eventually becoming a scholar of Indic and Buddhist studies. Professor Willis will share with us how Buddhism impacted her views about herself, social justice, and the role of personal healing in an angry and unjust society.

Weekend Teachings: Being a Bodhisattva in the Modern World 

Saturday & Sunday, April 9-10 from 10am to 5pm 

In these weekend teachings, Professor Jan Willis will discuss how to apply the traditional Buddhist teachings on bodhichitta to life in our modern world. What does it mean to be a bodhisattva today? How can we live this ideal in our daily lives? How can we contribute to a better world while growing our compassion and wisdom? She will especially focus on Shantideva's Guide to the Bodhisattva's Way of Life. How can we recognize and transform our biases to enact the principle regularly taught by His Holiness the Dalai Lama -- that all beings are exactly the same in that they don't want to suffer and all want happiness? What does it mean to exchange oneself with others?  

Professor Willis teaches in a lively way. Her teachings will also include discussions and meditations. They are open to all levels of practitioners, from people new to Buddhism to experienced students. If you have a personal copy of Shantideva's text, please bring it along.  

Suggested Donation: 

Weekend Teachings and Public Talk: $120, which includes light refreshments, lunch, and materials.  

Friday Public Talk only: $20

Weekend Teachings only: $100, which includes light refreshments, lunch, and materials. 

Shantideva Meditation, Tibet House, and Nalanda Members:

Public Talk: $18, Weekend Teachings: $90, Weekend Teachings and Public Talk: $108

Donations may be made online or at the door. 

Registration:

Please register in advance so we can prepare material to distribute. 

To register, click here.

Online registration will close at 3pm on Friday, April 8. Walk-ins are welcome.

While the Dharma is given freely and no one is turned away for lack of funds, we invite you to inquire about volunteering or other ways you might support our efforts to make these teachings available in New York. As an emerging volunteer organization, Shantideva Meditation Center relies entirely on donations to cover the cost of space rental, transportation, housing, materials, and administration. Thank you for your generosity. 

About the Teacher: 

Jan Willis, PhD, is Professor Emerita of Religion at Wesleyan University in Middletown, CT. One of the earliest American scholar-practitioners of Tibetan Buddhism, she has studied with Buddhist teachers worldwide for almost five decades and has taught courses on Buddhism for more than forty years. She has written extensively on Buddhist meditation, women and Buddhism, and Buddhism and race. Among her published works are Dreaming Me: Black, Baptist, and Buddhist - One Woman's Spiritual Journey and Enlightened Beings: Life Stories from the Ganden Oral Tradition. She also edited Feminine Ground: Essays on Women and Tibet. In December 2000, Time magazine named Willis one of six "spiritual innovators for the new millennium," and in May 2007, Ebony magazine named Willis one of its "Power 150" most influential African Americans.
results.name: Life, Liberty, the Pursuit of Happiness, and Justice: A Buddhist Perspective

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
We are FULL - Waiting List Only!!!

The Hikes are a Sierra Club Event... 

Lets Hike - Reboot our Mind - Enjoy Nature - Mingle - Bonfire - Party 

IN The Mountains of PA !!!

Here is are links to some of the PICs from our last Few Trips ... 

http://www.meetup.com/HangOutInQueensAndNassau/photos/26280067/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/events/220625428/

http://www.meetup.com/new-york-brainiacs/photos/25843664/ 

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25783623/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/25132142/ 

http://www.meetup.com/LongIslandTrailEnthusiasts/photos/21129322/

http://www.meetup.com/5BoroEXPLORATION/photos/22901702/

Quick Getaway !!!

Located in a Private community with 4 lakes, Tennis/Basketball/Volleyball Courts and other community amenities.


Please understand that Space is Limited... this meetup is listed on multiple groups!!! RSVPs on this Group are not the complete Attendee list.

Newly Built, fully furnished, roomy, Full Kitchen, FirePlace and other amenities. 

THE PLANNED ITINERARY:

HIKE... Relax... Mingle... Meditate... Bonfire Party ... 

• Friday: Get there as early as you can. Orientation party. Then optional Night Walk. Enjoy an evening walk in the hills of PA. See the stars/moon on a dark night. Music, talk, mingle.

• Sat Morning: Breakfast get together. We have a full kitchen. Please bring/pack your breakfast (so we are not wasting valuable daylight waiting to get served at a restaurant). You can surely go to town (10 min away) for breakfast as long as you can meet the rest of the day's schedule.

• After Breakfast: Rejuvenate, Relax & Center your mind with Optional Guided Meditation (approx. 20-25 min). 

• Sat Afternoon: Hike, enjoy the beautiful surroundings in the Mtns of PA. 

• Picnic Lunch:. (sandwiches etc - Could be purchased from the town before the start of the hike - or you can bring it from home).

• Sat Evening - FIREPLACE: Return from the hike, relax, Coffee/Tea/Wine/Beer break. Pack up the Cooler Go for Swim at Community Lake (weather permittig) and/or WARM UP by the indoor FIREPLACE. Then later Fire up the BONFIRE!!!  Marshmallows - Music - Songs around the BONFIRE. Please bring your musical instruments & Party Games.

• Sat Dinner: Depending on popular opinion, in the past, we mostly ordered pizza, or BBQ'd. If you wish, you can surely pickup what ever you desire to eat from the town.  

• Sat Night - BONFIRE: House Party!!!  Games, Party, Dance, Music, Sing or play your musical instrument.

• Sun Morning: Breakfast get together

• Sun Afternoon: Hike / Explore nearby area

• Lunch: Optional Lunch at nearby Diner or Picnic spot.

• Return Sun evening.                    

==>>>    The above Itinerary worked well in the past few trips, so we plan to keep it similar...  all activities are optional... 

COST:

$58 per night = TOTAL $116 (for Two nights) - House Shared Rent. 

Paypal $116 to:    [masked] 

Please send funds as a gift, and the Friends / Family Box (on paypal) must be checked.  Please ensure there are no paypal fees for this payment! 

We need to receive full amount ($116) to confirm your spot, which will be filled on a first come first serve basis.  An RSVP on the meetup site does not hold the spot.

Car-Pool (gathering spot): 

Please post if you will need a ride or are driving ... we will finalize car-pools closer to the event.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.name: FULL-WaitList ONLY-Weekend Retreat - Hike, Bonfire & Fun in Mtns of PA!

Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 1:30AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.

results.description:
Dreams can represent a number of things. They can help one process the day, or give repressed emotions a place for expression, sometimes the conscious mind directs them (e.g. lucid dreaming). Dreams can be magickal, astral (travel to other dimensions or other locations), premonitions, warnings, visits from spirit(s)/ancestors or lessons with spirit guides/totems. 

We will cover how to recognize different types of dreams and accessing their healing power. We will reviews tips for remembering dreams and 2 techniques for analyzing dreams and practice doing it.

If time permits, there will be a small group support opportunity for those with recurrent and/or disturbing dreams. Please bring a pen and note pad.


Donation $15. Please pay facilitator directly.
results.how_to_find_us: The entrance is next door to State Farm Insurance right after the Bank of America ATM machine. Look for the elevator entrance. Go to the 3rd floor.  Parking available in Bank of America parking lot.
results.name: Explore Your Dreamscape

results.description:
"A Time To Kill"  is a suspenseful courtroom drama infused with crisp humor. Dialogue on racism, moral courage, perspective, ethics and law propel this story of rape, murder and justice – both vigilante and legal.

A young, inexperienced, white Mississippi lawyer defends a black father for taking the law into his own hands. It’s not only the murder of two white rapists that bring out both the KKK and the NAACP in dueling demonstrations, but the demand for color-blind justice — and the resistance to that demand.

After-show “talkback” dates with the author, Tony and Drama Desk award winner, Rupert Holmes to be announced.

<a href="https://flic.kr/s/aHskuhr8ib"></a>


Purchase Senior or student ticket (special courtesy for meetup group) at:http://elmwoodplayhouse.com and select April 8th "A Time to Kill" the 8pm show.   THIS IS A SMALL THEATRE AND THE SHOWS USUALLY SELL OUT SO IF YOU PLAN TO GO GET YOUR TICKETS ASAP.

Unassigned seating so come early to sit with the group and get prime seats.  

 PLEASE POST WHEN YOU GET YOUR TICKETS.  THANKS! If you can’t make the show but would like to join us for dinner about  5:15  at Tarantellas let me know.


SCROLL DOWN FOR DIRECTIONS AND PARKING INFO BELOW

General Box Office Information


Buying tickets in person
The Elmwood Playhouse Box Office is located at the theatre: 
10 Park Street, Nyack, NY 10960
Box office Hours are Tuesday through Friday,
9:00am - 3:00pm; Saturday from 10:00am - 2:00pm (closed Sunday and Monday.)

To order by phone, call: (845)[masked] 
They accept Visa, Mastercard and Checks.

PLAYS: Adult Admission - $22.00
Senior (65 and over) & Student (under 22) Admission $21.00 (except Saturday) 

Elmwood Playhouse is fully air conditioned and handicapped accessible.
Listening devices are available for the hearing impaired.
All seats are general admission. Tickets are not refundable.

8:00 pm Performances Wednesday through Saturday ·  2:00 pm Sunday Matinees
Sundays @ 7 Series Performances 7:00 pm

Latecomers seated at the discretion of the management


SUNDAYS PARKING IS FREE UNTIL 11PM..

Weeknights FREE from 6pm-11pm

DINNER at  5:15  at Tarantellas just a short walk from the playhouse at 128 Main St. Nyack, NY. [masked]-3583.  Check out their deliciosa menu at: http://tarantellapizza.com/MENU.html Separate checks should be available.

Directions and Parking info from the web:


Directions & ParkingParkingNyack is delightful, charming, and resplendent with culture. There are fantastic restaurants, nightclubs, antique shops, pubs, street fairs, and lots of special events in our little river village bustling with tourism. Parking can be challenging. Elmwood Playhouse, like most businesses in Nyack, does not have on-site parking. On weekends, we recommend you get to the theatre at least 30 minutes early to find parking. Be aware of parking signs and regulations as they will ticket, and nothing can ruin a good mood like a $25.00 parking fine. Best Bet: municipal parking lot on Main St, across from Park St. 

You do not need to leave a performance to feed the meters.
The meters can be pre-fed earlier in the evening and will go into effect at eleven.This means that if you put in .75c in the machine you will get a receipt reflecting 12 midnight, the hour you just bought. Cool.

Parking meters are in effect from 11:00 am until 6:00 pm.
They go back into effect at 11:00 pm until 6:00 am.
Evening meters will allow for pre-purchase of up to eight hours of parking in advance. Those attending the theater can put in a quarter (or more) at any time between 6PM and 11 PM and receive a meter ticket that begins at eleven and is good for the amount of time purchased.
results.how_to_find_us: for dinner 5:15  at Tarantellas 128 Main St.(short walk to theatre), for show only by the entrance or in the lobby 7:15(seating should open at 7:30 come early for best seats)show starts at 8
results.name: Early Dinner & Friday Night at The Elmwood Playhouse w/"A Time to Kill"

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)

results.description:
The Metrograph presents a 35mm screening of Pedicab Driver!

Sammo Hung's action-comedy-drama-romance masterpiece, long unseen and until very recently unavailable on home video, burns up the screen with old school intensity. Featuring appearances by a galaxy of big-name Hong Kong stunt actors and filmmakers, this is audience-pleasing, heart-pumping, nitro-burning moviemaking, featuring two of the world’s greatest action directors themselves—Lau Kar-Leung and Sammo Hung—duking it out onscreen. One of the best martial arts movies of the 1980s.


For tix visit: http://metrograph.com/film/film/130/pedicab-driver

This screening is part of the 6th Annual Old School Kung Fu Fest!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SBAb8zlbxOk

results.description:
Does Islam mandate that Muslims have a government headed by a Caliph, or Khalifa, a representative of God on earth?  Can Islam have a secular political system or must there be an “Islamic” form of government.  For over a thousand years, most Muslims have understood the prophet to be both a spiritual and temporal leader.  The Caliph, in this viewpoint, is someone who not only inherits both the secular and religious mantle of the prophet, but is also a necessary person in the Muslim world. The re-establishment of the Caliphate is a rallying cry for fundamentalist movements in the present era also.

Ali Abd Al-Raziq [masked]) was an Egyptian scholar, a judge and also a government minister. In his book "Islam and the Foundations of Government", published in 1924, he questioned the idea that Muslims should  have a Caliph. The caliphate in the Ottoman Empire had just been abolished after the first world war, and his argument  was considered so controversial that afterwards he was forbidden from holding any public office.

Please join us to read an excerpt from his thought provoking book, to discuss his ideas , their relevance today, and how they are similar or different from older concepts such as Shia Quietism and Sufi notions of withdrawal from the political sphere.

Please feel free to bring healthy snacks to share.  

We ask attendees to contribute $5 each for the rental of the location.
results.name: Islam and the Caliphate

results.description:
The First Friday Night Rip of April!  Come out to Prospect Park for a great evening of skating, sliding and hanging!

We’ll be gathering at 8pm on the west side of Center Drive inside Prospect Park across from the of 16th street and Prospect Park South West entrance to the park.  We will be skating, downhilling and sliding one of our favorite spots in Prospect Park.  Bring your board, your helmet, your moves and your friends.  It’s going to be a great time! 


The First Friday Night Rip series is a long tradition of Brooklyn skaters.  For more than 10 years skaters have gathered in Prospect Park on Friday Nights to share their skills and enthusiasm for the sport. 

The first friday of each month Ghostskate hosts the a group skate from 8pm - 10pm.  We will be on Center Drive in Prospect Park most easily accessible from the entrance at 16th street and Prospect Park South West.

• Please make sure to bring your helmet, you are responsible for your own safety.

results.description:
Intro. To Rohun Spiritual Psychotherapy Thru Chakra Cleansing W/ Dr. Jay Kantor

Rohun is a systematic and rapid-acting psychotherapy for personal growth and change.  It is an energy-based method of healing which works on the energy fields surrounding the physical body to work simultaneously on the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual bodies.  The energy fields of the client and therapist are joined in a creative interaction to bring about deep and insightful change and the accelerated evolution of consciousness.

The human body is the temple of the indwelling spirit.  The indwelling spirit and its potential are connected to the human body through the chakra system.  When negative emotional blocks and faulty thoughts are removed from the chakra system,, the indwelling spirit is freed to flow upward from its origin at the base of the spine to the crown energizing all of the potential and natural abilities and dimensions of man.

Tonight we will learn about the chakras and how they function.  What do chakras do?  What happens when chakras become blocked?  How does blockage occur?  How can blockages be cleared?

You can learn more about Rohun on Jay’s website: http://Rohun.Com .

You can read about a Rohun session in the article “Overcoming The Real Pain Of Living A False Life”, http://www.njholisticguide.com/overcome.htm .

I hope you can join us and expand your knowledge of how emotional and mental challenges can be dealt with by utilizing an energy therapy.  We begin at 7:30PM.
results.name: Intro. To Rohun Spiritual Psychotherapy Thru Chakra Cleansing W/ Dr. Jay Kantor

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
HI Ladies,
Too bad the rain got the best of us last night..
No worries, we are rescheduling for next Friday April 8th at 8pm.
Have you ever walked the Highline at night? I have and it is even more beautiful at night. Beginning April 1st the Highline is open till 10pm.

All of the views are enhanced by the street lights, and will bring more ambiance to the walk.

Let's meet at 7:45 pm at the Southern most entrance to the Highline. which is located on Gansvoort St between Greenwich and Washington Street . We are meeting at the base of the steps leading up to the Highline we will then walk north to the 34th Street end of the Highline and back to Gansvoort St. www.thehighline.org.

Approximately 2miles.

Along the way, we can stop for refreshments, snacks, drinks,desserts, beverages. There are an array of vendors with unique offerings, including a few local artists, selling their crafts.

This is a fun, casual, informal, way to meet and greet, make new friends, couples welcome, of course!

This is an after dinner event Ladies as per our start time, so plan according, although, some of us may want to go out for a drink, dessert afterwards.

RSVP when you know you will be joining us.

We will begin walking at 8. so lets line up about 7:45..


I look forward to seeing your smiling faces.

xxxx

Carly

[masked]

I will pass around an envelope for first timers. a 2-5 dollar donation is appreciated to keep the meetup.com site and this meetup thriving.

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

This event is now completely sold out for women. We have space for men only.

Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 singles just like you in one FUN evening!

How does it work?


You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out!

Recommended ages: Men 25-38, Women 23-36

Tickets are $25 if you RSVP on our Meetup group / $40 at door without RSVP if space is available.


PS: We are promoting this event on several Asian professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone - we assure you we will have a good amount of men and women participate at our event.

The 3-day festival includes 30 bands, vocal and instrumental workshops, a family-friendly square dance and swing dance, jam sessions, film screenings, the famous Banjo Toss contest and more!

(But I, Natalie, will be at all three sessions and possibly working one of the brewery booths on Saturday afternoon.) 

The largest beer festival on the east coast will return to The Atlantic City Convention Center on Friday, April 8 & Saturday, April 9! Over 150 breweries, nearly a thousand beers, local culinary, awesome exhibitors & more!

Session 1: Friday, April 8, 8pm-12am
Session 2: Saturday, April 9, 12pm-4pm
Session 3: Saturday, April 9, 6pm-10pm

More info can be found @ http://www.acbeerfest.com/ or via Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/events/450437591783449/

GENERAL ADMISSION TICKETS
$55 advance per session, includes beer tasting and live entertainment / $60 at the door (if they last)
http://www.acbeerfest.com/tickets.aspx

VIP TICKETS
$ 99 VIP ticket (LIMITED)
VIP Credential includes:
-Festival Admittance 30 minutes prior to gate
-Welcome toast with Festival Producer, Featuring one of NJ great brewers and headlining act (15 minutes prior to doors opening)
-VIP Hot dog bar and snack bar in the Mustache lounge 

VIP Gift Bag
-Limited VIP Beer Fest T-shirt (Email will be sent after purchase to obtain shirt size.)
-Official AC Beer Fest Pint Glass
-I love AC Beer Fest Sunglasses & Mustache
-----------

$20 per session for designated driver tickets, sold ONLY at the door before each session!

-----------
MAIN STAGE
Session 1: Friday, April 8- 8pm til 12am
-Headliner: Dashboard Confessional
-Direct Support: Hidden In Plain View
-Opener: The Elwins
--------------------
Session 2: Saturday, April 9 12pm-4pm
-Headliner: Manchester Orchestra
-Direct support: Superheaven
-Opener: The Superweaks
--------------------
Session 3: Saturday, April 9 6pm-10pm
-Headliner: Reel Big Fish
-Direct support: Backyard Superheroes
-Opener: Solace
--------------------

This event is for attendees ages 21 and up. Absolutely no exceptions to this rule.
results.name: The 2016 Atlantic City Beer & Music Festival

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
Join Winter  Brook, psychic medium, and four other professional psychic mediums (to be announced) at one of the best events of the year at the Eyes of Learning!

Event:  "Meet the Psychics"  This evening's program is designed to bring you the opportunity to get up close and personal with our gifted readers, mediums and psychics.  The audience is scheduled to be seated in one of five semi-circles and five psychics will each spend 25 to 30 minutes in each circle before roatating to the next circle.  By the end of the evening, all attendees will have had the opportunity to interact with all of the psychics.

So mark his date on your calendar and be there at "Meet the Psychics" to experience it first hand, in a very intimate environment.  Most of these gifted metaphysicians will be doing readings at our Spring Festival on Sunday April 10, 2016

Members:  $10  Non-Members:  $15,  No Pre-registration Required

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:15pm-8:29pm - Class Check-in 
8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Musicality) w/ Shoshi & Olivia
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Really The Blues) w/ John
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ John and Kathleen

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Really The Blues 
Really, what is the blues? Join the national stars John and Shoshi Krieger-Joven for a month exploring the essence of the blues, and how to embody the blues aesthetic in your dancing.

This Week: Complex Jookin'
In this class, we will explore how to make your dancing to Jookin’ music more complex and interesting. We will play around with polyrhythms and triple patterns and apply them to Jookin’ music.

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 50 to 150 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/about/locations
results.name: Friday Night Blues NYC

results.description:
Every other week, we meet up in Elmsford for karaoke. Since the music starts at 10:00, some of us also meet up at 8:30 for dinner beforehand, while others come only for the dinner and drinks. Come join us for some alcohol, a big food selection, and good times!

There is free valet parking, and when the valet guy leaves, he parks your car very close by (as parking becomes more available) and gives you back your keys. Street parking is also readily available.

If you're interested in both eating and singing, don't forget to sign up for the karaoke event too!
results.name: Bi-weekly Pre-Karaoke Dinner

results.description:
Hello JazzSpotters!


I would like to invite you all to our show at Espresso 77
[masked]th St, Jackson Heights, NY 11372) on Friday, April 8th from 8:30-10pm. They are currently renovating the cafe (expanding), and this will be our first performance there since the renovations. We're very excited- there will be more seating room AND we hear they have installed a spanking new stage with a spotlight! We hope you will join us for our first show back. It also happens to be the first stop on our Birthday Tour. We will actually be leaving that night after the show to head to Georgia, followed by Florida, Virginia, and Canada.

Vocals - Amanda Sprecher
Lead Guitar - Robert Scalici

If you haven't been to Espresso 77 before- it's a great cafe with wine, beer, coffee, pastries, sandwiches, and more. It's a free event. Come join us for a night of jazz and great company. Looking forward to meeting all of you!

Amanda & Rob
(Wishing On Stars)
results.name: [FREE EVENT] Wishing On Stars (Jazz Duo) at Espresso 77

results.description:
Join us for a 'Silent Film Fashion' Drawing Session at The National Arts Club! 


This session is open to sketchers of all levels from beginners to pros!

This is a great chance to meet others in our group, hang out in an amazing environment (see below), listen to a wonderful DJ and of course create great work! There will also be a bar where you can buy a drink.

We will have two models to draw from. Watercolor, color pencil and odorless  markers are welcome. 


We will drawing in the Grand Gallery at The National Arts club one of the most historic and iconic arts buildings in New York City. (the room seen here.)

If you have any questions please feel free to email me. 


Thank you.

Simon

results.name: Silent Film Fashion - Drawing at The National Arts Club (Free Event)

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


This is going to be a very special night because for the first time we’re going to step into the 1920’s world of the Great Gatsby. We’ll be making everything a sign of the times, so costumes are of course fully encouraged, being that the only thing that won’t be 1920’s style, will be those glowing headphones on top of our heads. This is going to be a great night, with 3 DJ’s to help is rock the night away, so if you’re going to be out, this is definitely the place to be!

Your 3 Channels will be / Your 3 DJs will be spinning:
DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop with a mix of 1920’s Party Music Remixes and Electro Swing!
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
results.how_to_find_us: Bubble Directions: Hofstra soccer bubble! Use Hofstra Blvd from Hempstead Tpke....from security booth, turn right after 2nd stop sign towards the athletic fields.  Drive all the way down until u c d dome on your right!!

RendezVous Rooftop Party

Yara and Jean-Philippe are happy to welcome you to our Friday rooftop party in the highest rooftop of NYC: Sky Room : free admission before midnight, free drinks for ladies at our VIP table, Live DJ, and VIP admission if you mention that you're onYara's Guest List (please read carefully the event recap below).

__________EVENT RECAP__________

Where: Sky Room – 330 West 40th Street New York, NY 10018

We will be on the second floor of the rooftop, cross from the bar and front of the DJ booth. 
Call/text Yara[masked] if you need anything.

When: Fridays. Doors open at 10:30 PM and close at 4:00 AM.

YARA'S GUEST LIST :  Ladies free all night, gents free admission before midnight; reduced after. 21+ event with photo ID.

Dress Code: Men: jacket or collared shirt, pants. Women: skirt/dress or dressy pants. Dress to impress; 
More info: http://www.skyroomnyc.com/

__________SPONSORS__________

Jean-Philippe Photography, RendezVous Events

Yara

This is held in NYC but is also available as an online stream.

- Scott

The countdown is on! QuantCon 2016, Quantopian's annual quant trading conference, starts at 9am EDT on April 9th.

As a member of our meetup community, we would like to offer you a 10% discount code you can use on any ticket (online or in-person): MeetupFaithfulQuantCon20­16.

Join us Online or In-Person QuantCon, Quantopian's annual quant trading conference will focus on innovative trading strategies, unique data sets, machine learning, and Python. Highlights from our expert lineup include:

- "Financial Engineering and Its Discontents" by Dr. Emanuel Derman, Professor at Columbia University and author of "My Life as a Quant" and "Models.Behaving.Badly."

- "Untapped Alpha" by Manoj Narang, Founder and CEO of MANA Partners, LLC.

- "The Peculiarities of Volatility" by Dr. Ernest Chan, Managing Member of QTS Capital Management, LLC.

The goal of the day is to give you all the support you need to craft outperforming investment strategies.

All Streaming Tickets Sales are being Donated to Code.Org
Live streaming and in-person tickets are still available. All ticket holders will have first-access to recordings and presentation decks. All streaming ticket sales will be donated to Code.Org.

Code.org is a non-profit dedicated to expanding access to computer science, and increasing participation by women and underrepresented students of color in this field.

To RSVP for your spot online or in-person, click here and enter your discount code: MeetupFaithfulQuantCon20­16 at checkout.

http://www.quantcon.com/

Study hard consistently, challenge yourself and use the language daily. That's how you'll get fluent in your target language. I study languages every day from six in the morning. Can you keep up? It'll make you fluent!

English? Español? Français? Italiano? 中文? 日本語? 한국어?

Fun 8 day / 7 night trip to Peru!  We'll spend 3 nights in Urubamba (Sacred Valley), 1 night in Aguas Clientes (base destination for Machu Picchu) and 3 nights in Cusco!  Apply directly on our website here: https://travendly.com/tours/peru-group-travel/


Dates: 

Saturday, April 9, 2016 - Saturday, April 16, 2016

What's included:

• 7 breakfasts, 1 lunch, 2 dinners

• Pisac Ruins tour (Sacred Valley)

• Moray and Maras tour (Sacred Valley)

• Visit to a Local Village (Sacred Valley)

• Machu Picchu Exploration

• City tour (Cusco)

• Free time to explore Urubamba, Machu Picchu, and Cusco

• Good people from NYC :)


Price: 

• $1,495


Quick itinerary:

• Day 1: Welcome to the Sacred Valley!  No agenda until tonight - dinner together!  Meals: dinner

• Day 2: Pisac ruins.  Meals: Breakfast

• Day 3: Moray & Maras.  Meals: Breakfast

• Day 4: Local town village visit.  Meals: Breakfast 

• Day 5: Machu Picchu!  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch

• Day 6: Free time in Cusco.  Meals: Breakfast 

• Day 7: Tour of Cusco and free time.  Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

• Day 8: Return flight home 

Notes

• Airfare is NOT included 

• Book directly here: https://travendly.com/tours/peru-group-travel/

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description: Inspired by the stories of the thru-hikers and my recent reading of "A Walk in the Woods: Rediscovering America on the Appalachian Trail" by Bill Bryson, yet I cannot afford to quit my job to do the full trail --neither would I dare to hike thousands of miles in one trip to be honest-- I decided to lead a section AT hike over two days. The first leg is from Mount Peter in Warwick to Arden (roughly 11 miles) and is scheduled on 3/12 (Sat). The second leg is from Arden to Jones Point (roughly 18 miles) and is scheduled on 4/9 (Sat). This hike is not designed for the beginners who have never navigated themselves in the woods using maps and a compass or GPS. All the participants are expected to be independent and self-sufficient, as the group will walk at his or her own pace without a sweep. The group will meet at the Shortline ticket counter at 8:10 and take the 8:30 bus to Arden. The bus is scheduled to arrive at Arden at 9:26, and the hike will begin shortly thereafter. We aim to finish up the hike by 17:00, which would give us 7.5 hours to hike 18 miles (= 2.4 miles/hour in average including breaks). More info here: http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/details/id/88465
results.name: Section AT (Leg-2 of 2): Arden to Jones Point
3 spots left - Saturday soccer @ 8AM - 1 HOUR.

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
